original: atha khalu śakrasya devānām indrasyaitad abhavat /🔽pūrvajinakṛtādhikārās te kulaputrāḥ kuladuhitaraś ca bhaviṣyanti /

translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, had this thought:🔽Those sons and daughters of good family who will hear this perfection of wisdom will have previously made offerings to the Victors.

original: yeṣām iyaṃ prajñāpāramitāśrotrāvabhāsam āgamiṣyati / tathāgatāvaropitakuśalamūlās te sattvā bhaviṣyanti /

translated: Those beings will have planted wholesome roots under the Tathāgatas.

original: yeṣām iyaṃ prajñāpāramitāśrotrāvabhāsam āgamiṣyati / kalyāṇamitraparigṛhītās te sattvā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: yeṣām iyam prajñāpāramitā śrotra avabhāsam āgamiṣyati kalyāṇa mitra parigṛhītāḥ te sattvāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Those beings for whom this perfection of wisdom will come within the range of their hearing will have been taken hold of by spiritual friends.

original: yeṣām iyaṃ prajñāpāramitāśrotrāvabhāsam āgamiṣyati / kaḥ punar vādo ya udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti yoniśaś ca manasikariṣyanti /
analyzed: yeṣām iyam prajñāpāramitā śrotra avabhāsam āgamiṣyati kaḥ punar vādaḥ ye udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti yoniśas ca manasikariṣyanti
translated: Those beings for whom this perfection of wisdom will come within the range of their hearing, how much more so those who will take it up, bear it in mind, recite and study it, and who will wisely attend to it!

original: udgṛhya dhārayitvā vācayitvā paryavāpya tathatvāya pratipatsyante /🔽bahubuddhaparyupāsitās te kulaputrāḥ kuladuhitaraś ca bhaviṣyanti / ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ🔽śrutvā udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti yoniśaś ca manasikariṣyanti /
analyzed: udgṛhya dhārayitvā vācayitvā paryavāpya tathatvāya pratipatsyante  bahu buddha paryupāsitāḥ te kula putrāḥ kula duhitaraḥ ca bhaviṣyanti ye imām prajñāpāramitām  śrutvā udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti yoniśas ca manasikariṣyanti
translated: Having taken it up, borne it in mind, recited and studied it, and wisely attended to it, they will practice it for suchness.🔽Those sons and daughters of good family who, having heard this perfection of wisdom, will take it up, bear it in mind, recite and study it, and wisely attend to it,

original: udgṛhya dhārayitvā vācayitvā paryavāpya tathatvāya pratipatsyante paripṛṣṭhāś ca
analyzed: udgṛhya dhārayitvā vācayitvā paryavāpya tathatvāya pratipatsyante paripṛṣṭhāḥ ca
translated: having taken it up, borne it in mind, recited and studied it, and wisely attended to it, will practice it for suchness, and will be surrounded by many Buddhas.

original: pūrvakā api taiḥ kulaputraiḥ kuladuhitṛbhiś ca tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ
analyzed: pūrvakāḥ api taiḥ kula putraiḥ kula duhitṛbhiḥ ca tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: Those sons and daughters of good family have also served the Tathagatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones of the past,

original: paripraśnīkṛtāḥ sevitā bhajitāḥ paryupāsitāḥ /
analyzed: paripraśnīkṛtāḥ sevitāḥ bhajitāḥ paryupāsitāḥ
translated: They have attended on, served, venerated, and worshipped those who have questioned them.

original: ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ śrutvā nottrasiṣyanti na saṃtrasiṣyanti na saṃtrāsam āpatsyante / bahubuddhakoṭīṣu te dānapāramitāyāṃ caritāḥ /
analyzed: ye imām prajñāpāramitām śrutvā na uttrasiṣyanti na saṃtrasiṣyanti na saṃtrāsam āpatsyante bahu buddha koṭīṣu te dāna pāramitāyām caritāḥ
translated: Those who, having heard this perfection of wisdom, will not tremble, be frightened, or terrified, have practiced the perfection of giving in many millions of Buddha-fields.

original: evaṃ śīlapāramitāyāṃ kṣāntipāramitāyāṃ vīryapāramitāyāṃ dhyānapāramitāyāṃ bahubuddhakoṭīṣu te prajñāpāramitāyāṃ /
analyzed: evam śīla pāramitāyām kṣānti pāramitāyām vīrya pāramitāyām dhyāna pāramitāyām bahu buddha koṭīṣu te prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: Thus, in the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, and the perfection of concentration, they have practiced the perfection of wisdom in many millions of Buddha-fields.

original: caritā / ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ śrutvā nottrasiṣyanti na saṃtrasiṣyanti na saṃtrāsam āpatsyante /
analyzed: caritā ye imām prajñāpāramitām śrutvā na uttrasiṣyanti na saṃtrasiṣyanti na saṃtrāsam āpatsyante
translated: Those who, having heard this perfection of wisdom, will not tremble, be frightened, or terrified,

original: atha khalu āyuṣmāñ cchāriputro bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the Venerable Śāriputra said this to the Blessed One:

original: ye bhagavan kulaputrā vā kuladuhitaro vā imām evaṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ śrutvā nottrasiṣyanti na saṃtrasiṣyanti na saṃtrāsam āpatsyante /
analyzed: ye bhagavan kula putrāḥ vā kula duhitaraḥ vā imām evam gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām śrutvā na uttrasiṣyanti na saṃtrasiṣyanti na saṃtrāsam āpatsyante
translated: Blessed One, those sons or daughters of good family who, having heard this profound perfection of wisdom, will not tremble, be frightened, or terrified,

original: śrutvā ca udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti yoniśaś ca manasikariṣyanti /
analyzed: śrutvā ca udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti yoniśas ca manasikariṣyanti
translated: having heard it, will take it up, bear it in mind, recite it, master it, and attend to it wisely,

original: yathā avinivartanīyā bodhisattvā mahāsattvās tathā te kulaputrāḥ kuladuhitaro vā dhārayitavyāḥ / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: yathā a vinivartanīyāḥ bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ tathā te kula putrāḥ kula duhitaraḥ vā dhārayitavyāḥ tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: As the irreversible bodhisattva mahāsattvas are, so should those sons of good family or daughters of good family be regarded. Why is that?

original: gambhīrā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā / na khalu pūrvam acaritena ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu śakyeyaṃ🔽gambhīrā prajñāpāramitā adhimoktum / ye punar bhagavan kulaputrāḥ kuladuhitaro vā
analyzed: gambhīrā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā na khalu pūrvam acaritena ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu śakyā iyam  gambhīrā prajñāpāramitā adhimoktum ye punar bhagavan kula putrāḥ kula duhitaraḥ vā
translated: The perfection of wisdom is profound, Blessed One. It is not possible to have conviction in this profound perfection of wisdom without having practiced for a long time.

original: imāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ pratikṣeptavyāṃ maṃsyante pūrvāntato 'pi taiḥ kulaputraiḥ🔽kuladuhitṛbhiś ca iyaṃ gambhīrā prajñāpāramitā pratiksiptā / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi teṣāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṛṇāṃ cāsyāṃ gambhīrāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ nāsti
analyzed: imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām pratikṣeptavyām maṃsyante taiḥ kula putraiḥ  kula duhitṛbhiḥ ca iyam gambhīrā prajñāpāramitā pratiksiptā tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi teṣām kula putrāṇām kula duhitṛṇām ca asyām gambhīrāyām prajñāpāramitāyām na asti
translated: Those sons of good family or daughters of good family, Blessed One, who will think to reject this profound perfection of wisdom, have rejected this profound perfection of wisdom from the past as well. Why is that?

original: śraddhā nāsti prasādo nāsti prema nāsty adhimuktis taiḥ kulaputraiḥ kuladuhitṛbhiś
analyzed: śraddhā nā asti prasādaḥ nā asti prema nā asti adhimuktiḥ taiḥ kula putraiḥ kula duhitṛbhiḥ
translated: Because for those sons of good family or daughters of good family, there is no faith, no confidence, no love, no devotion to this profound perfection of wisdom. Those sons of good family or daughters of good family

original: ca na buddhā vā bodhisattvā vā pratyekabuddhā vā śrāvakā vā paripraśnīkṛtāḥ /
analyzed: ca na buddhāḥ vā bodhisattvāḥ vā pratyekabuddhāḥ vā śrāvakāḥ vā paripraśnīkṛtāḥ
translated: have not asked the Buddhas, Bodhisattvas, Pratyekabuddhas, or Śrāvakas.

original: kathaṃ dānapāramitāyāṃ caritavyaṃ /
analyzed: katham dāna pāramitāyām caritavyam
translated: How should one practice the perfection of giving?

original: kathaṃ śīlapāramitāyāṃ caritavyaṃ /🔽kathañ ca kṣāntipāramitāyāṃ caritavyaṃ /
analyzed: katham śīla pāramitāyām caritavyam  katham ca kṣānti pāramitāyām caritavyam
translated: How should one practice the perfection of morality?🔽How should one practice the perfection of patience?

original: kathaṃ vīryapāramitāyāṃ caritavyaṃ /
analyzed: katham vīrya pāramitāyām caritavyam
translated: How should one practice the perfection of effort?

original: kathaṃ dhyānapāramitāyāṃ caritavyaṃ /
analyzed: katham dhyāna pāramitāyām caritavyam
translated: How should one practice the perfection of meditation?

original: kathaṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caritavyaṃ /🔽katham adhyātmaśūnyatāyāṃ caritavyaṃ /
analyzed: katham prajñāpāramitāyām caritavyam  katham adhyātma śūnyatāyām caritavyam
translated: How should one practice the perfection of wisdom?🔽How should one practice inner emptiness?

original: kathaṃ bahirdhāśūnyatāyāṃ caritavyaṃ /🔽kathara adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāyāṃ caritavyaṃ /
analyzed: katham bahirdhā śūnyatāyām caritavyam  adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatāyām caritavyam
translated: How should one practice outer emptiness?🔽How should one practice inner and outer emptiness?

original: yāvat kathaṃ abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāyāñ caritavyaṃ /
analyzed: yāvat katham abhāva svabhāva śūnyatāyām caritavyam
translated: Up to how should one practice the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence?

original: kathaṃ smṛtyupasthānāni bhāvayitavyāni /
analyzed: katham smṛti upasthānāni bhāvayitavyāni
translated: How should the establishments of mindfulness be cultivated?

original: kathaṃ samyakprahāṇāni /🔽katham ṛddhipādāḥ /
analyzed: katham samyakprahāṇāni  katham ṛddhipādāḥ
translated: How should the right efforts?🔽How should the bases of spiritual power?

original: katham indriyāṇi /
analyzed: katham indriyāṇi
translated: How should the faculties?

original: kathaṃ balāni /
analyzed: katham balāni
translated: How should the powers?

original: kathaṃ bodhyaṅgāni /
analyzed: katham bodhyaṅgāni
translated: How should the limbs of awakening?

original: katham āryāṣṭāṅgo mārgo bhāvayitavyaḥ /
analyzed: katham ārya aṣṭa aṅgaḥ mārgaḥ bhāvayitavyaḥ
translated: How should the noble eightfold path be cultivated?

original: katham apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattayo bhāvayitavyāḥ /
analyzed: katham apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattayaḥ bhāvayitavyāḥ
translated: How should the immeasurables, meditations, and formless concentrations be cultivated?

original: katham āryasatyāni bhāvayitavyāni /
analyzed: katham ārya satyāni bhāvayitavyāni
translated: How should the noble truths be cultivated?

original: katham aṣṭa vimokṣā bhāvayitavyāḥ /
analyzed: katham aṣṭa vimokṣāḥ bhāvayitavyāḥ
translated: How should the eight liberations be cultivated?

original: kathaṃ navānupūrvavihārasamapattayo bhāvayitavyāḥ /
analyzed: katham nava anupūrva vihāra sama pattayaḥ bhāvayitavyāḥ
translated: How should the nine successive abodes be cultivated?

original: kathaṃ śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitāni bhāvayitavyāni /
analyzed: katham śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihitāni bhāvayitavyāni
translated: How should emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness be cultivated?

original: kathaṃ ṣaḍ abhijñā bhāvayitavyāḥ /
analyzed: katham ṣaḍ abhijñāḥ bhāvayitavyāḥ
translated: How should the six supernormal knowledges be cultivated?

original: kathaṃ samādhayaḥ samāpattavyāḥ /
analyzed: katham samādhayaḥ samāpattavyāḥ
translated: How should the concentrations be entered?

original: kathaṃ dhāraṇīmukhāni praveṣṭavyāni /
analyzed: katham dhāraṇī mukhāni praveṣṭavyāni
translated: How should the doors of retention be entered?

original: kathaṃ daśatathāgatabalāni bhāvayitavyāni /🔽kathaṃ vaiśāradyāni /
analyzed: katham daśa tathāgata balāni bhāvayitavyāni  katham vaiśāradyāni
translated: How should the ten powers of the Tathagata be cultivated?

original: bhāvayitavyāni /
analyzed: bhāvayitavyāni
translated: How should the fearlessnesses be cultivated?

original: kathaṃ pratisaṃvido bhāvayitavyāḥ /
analyzed: katham pratisaṃvidaḥ bhāvayitavyāḥ
translated: How should the analytical knowledges be cultivated?

original: katham aṣṭādaśāveṇikā buddhadharmā bhāvayitavyā / iti /
analyzed: katham aṣṭādaśa āveṇikāḥ buddha dharmāḥ bhāvayitavyāḥ iti
translated: How should the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha be cultivated?

original: atha khalu śakro devānām indra āyuṣmantaṃ śāriputram etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ āyuṣmantam śāriputram etat avocat
translated: Then indeed Shakra, lord of the gods, said this to the Venerable Shariputra:

original: gambhīrā bhadanta śāriputra prajñāpāramitā / kim atrāścaryaṃ syāt /
analyzed: gambhīrā bhadanta śāriputra prajñāpāramitā kim atra āścaryam syāt
translated: Venerable Shariputra, the perfection of wisdom is profound. What wonder is there in this?

original: ya imāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ pūrvānte 'pi nādhimuktā bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ
analyzed: ye imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām pūrva ante na adhimuktāḥ bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ
translated: Those bodhisattva mahasattvas who had no faith in this profound perfection of wisdom in the past

original: dānapāramitāyāṃ śīlapāramitāyāṃ kṣāntipāramitāyāṃ vīryapāramitāyāṃ dhyānapāramitāyāṃ
analyzed: dāna pāramitāyām śīla pāramitāyām kṣānti pāramitāyām vīrya pāramitāyām dhyāna pāramitāyām
translated: in the perfection of giving, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration,

original: prajñāpāramitāyāṃ nādhimuktāḥ /🔽adhyātmaśūnyatāyāṃ nādhimuktāḥ /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyām na adhimuktāḥ  adhyātma śūnyatāyām na adhimuktāḥ
translated: They have no faith in the perfection of wisdom.🔽They have no faith in inner emptiness,

original: yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāyāṃ nādhimuktāḥ /
analyzed: yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatāyām na adhimuktāḥ
translated: up to and have no faith in the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣeṣu dharmeṣv anadhimuktāḥ /
analyzed: saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣeṣu dharmeṣu an adhimuktāḥ
translated: They have no faith in the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattiṣv anadhimuktāḥ /
analyzed: a pramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattiṣu an adhimuktāḥ
translated: They have no faith in the immeasurables, the concentrations, and the formless absorptions.

original: śūnyatānimittāpraṇihiteṣv anadhimuktāḥ /
analyzed: śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihiteṣu anadhimuktāḥ
translated: They have no faith in emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: aṣṭavimokṣanavānupūrvavihārasamāpattiṣv anadhimuktāḥ /
analyzed: aṣṭa vimokṣa nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattiṣu anadhimuktāḥ
translated: They have no faith in the eight deliverances and the nine serial absorptions.

original: daśatathāgatabaleṣu caturṣu vaiśāradyeṣu catasṛṣu pratisaṃvitsu pañcasv abhijñāsu nādhimuktāḥ /
analyzed: daśa tathāgata baleṣu caturṣu vaiśāradyeṣu catasṛṣu pratisaṃvitsu pañcasu abhijñāsu na adhimuktāḥ
translated: They have no faith in the ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the five clairvoyances.

original: aṣṭādaśasv āveṇikeṣu buddhadharmeṣu nādhimuktāḥ / ye pratikṣipeyur iti nātrāścaryam /
analyzed: aṣṭādaśasu āveṇikeṣu buddha dharmeṣu na adhimuktāḥ ye pratikṣipeyuḥ iti na atra āścaryam
translated: They have no faith in the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha. It is not surprising that they would reject it.

original: namaskaromi bhagavatyai prajñāpāramitāyai sarvajñajñānasya sa namaskāraṃ karoti yaḥ
analyzed: namaskaromi bhagavatyai prajñāpāramitāyai sarvajña jñānasya sa namaskāram karoti yaḥ
translated: I pay homage to the Blessed Mother, the perfection of wisdom. Whoever pays homage to the perfection of wisdom pays homage to the knowledge of all modes.

original: prajñāpāramitāyā namaskāraṃ karoti /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyāḥ namaskāram karoti
translated: He who pays homage to the perfection of wisdom pays homage to the knowledge of all modes.

original: atha khalu bhagavān śakraṃ devānām indram etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān śakram devānām indram etat avocat
translated: Then the Blessed One said to Śakra, lord of the gods:

original: evam etat kauśikaivam etat / sarvajñajñānasya sa namaskāraṃ karoti /
analyzed: evam etat kauśika evam etat sarvajña jñānasya sa namaskāram karoti
translated: Kauśika, it is so, it is so. He pays homage to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: yaḥ prajñāpāramitāyā namaskāraṃ karoti / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāḥ namaskāram karoti tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: He who pays homage to the perfection of wisdom. Why is that?

original: ato nirjātā hi kauśika buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ sarvākārajñatā /
analyzed: atas nirjātā hi kauśika buddhānām bhagavatām sarva ākārajña tā
translated: For from this, Kauśika, arises the knowledge of all aspects of the Blessed Buddhas.

original: sarvākārajñatānirjātā ca prajñāpāramitā prabhāvyante / sarvajñatāṃ kauśikātikramitukāmena kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitrā vā prajñāpāramitāyāṃ sthātavyam /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā nirjātā ca prajñāpāramitā prabhāvyante sarvajña tām kauśika atikramitu kāmena kula putreṇa vā kula duhitrā vā prajñāpāramitāyām sthātavyam
translated: And the perfection of wisdom, arisen from the knowledge of all aspects, is manifested. Kauśika, a son of good family or a daughter of good family who wishes to surpass the knowledge of all aspects should stand in the perfection of wisdom.

original: evaṃ mārgajñatāyāṃ sthātukāmena sarvākārajñatājñānam utpādayitukāmena sarvavāsanānusaṃdhikleśān🔽samudghātayitukāmenānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhukāmena dharmacakraṃ pravartayitukāmena
analyzed: evam mārga jña tāyām sthātu kāmena sarva ākāra jña tā jñānam utpādayitu kāmena sarva vāsanā anusaṃdhi kleśān  samudghātayitu kāmena anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhu kāmena dharmacakram pravartayitu kāmena
translated: In the same way, one who wishes to stand in the knowledge of the path, who wishes to generate the knowledge of the knowledge of all aspects, who wishes to completely destroy all the afflictions that are latent tendencies,

original: kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitrā vā prajñāpāramitāyāṃ sthātavyam /
analyzed: kula putreṇa vā kula duhitrā vā prajñāpāramitāyām sthātavyam
translated: who wishes to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, who wishes to turn the wheel of the Dharma, that son of good family or daughter of good family should stand in the perfection of wisdom.

original: evaṃ srotaāpattiphale sattvān sthāpayitukāmena sakṛdāgāmiphale anāgāmiphale arhattve sattvān sthāpayitukāmena pratyekāyāṃ bodhau sattvān pratiṣṭhāpayitukāmena /
analyzed: evam srotaāpatti phale sattvān sthāpayitu kāmena sakṛdāgāmi phale anāgāmi phale arhat tve sattvān sthāpayitu kāmena pratyekāyām bodhau sattvān pratiṣṭhāpayitu kāmena
translated: In the same way, one who wishes to establish beings in the fruit of stream-entry, in the fruit of once-returning, in the fruit of non-returning, in arhatship,

original: anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau sattvān pratiṣṭhāpayitukāmena /
analyzed: anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau sattvān pratiṣṭhāpayitu kāmena
translated: who wishes to establish beings in individual enlightenment, in unsurpassed perfect enlightenment,

original: bhikṣusaṃghaṃ parikarṣayitukāmena iha bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ yogam āpattavyam /
analyzed: bhikṣu saṃgham parikarṣayitu kāmena iha bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām yogam āpattavyam
translated: who wishes to attract a community of monks, by that bodhisattva mahāsattva this perfection of wisdom should be practiced.

original: evam ukte śakro devānām indro bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: When this was said, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said to the Blessed One:

original: kathaṃ bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ pratiṣṭhito bhavati /
analyzed: katham bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām pratiṣṭhitaḥ bhavati
translated: Blessed One, how is a bodhisattva mahāsattva established in the perfection of wisdom?

original: kathaṃ vā yujyate /
analyzed: katham vā yujyate
translated: Or how does he practice?

original: evaṃ dhyānapāramitāyāṃ vīryapāramitāyāṃ kṣāntipāramitāyāṃ śīlapāramitāyāṃ /
analyzed: evam dhyāna pāramitāyām vīrya pāramitāyām kṣānti pāramitāyām śīla pāramitāyām
translated: In the same way, in the perfection of meditation, in the perfection of effort, in the perfection of patience, in the perfection of morality,

original: kathaṃ dānapāramitāyāṃ pratiṣṭhito bhavati /
analyzed: katham dāna pāramitāyām pratiṣṭhitaḥ bhavati
translated: how is he established in the perfection of giving?

original: kathaṃ vā yogam āpadyate /
analyzed: katham vā yogam āpadyate
translated: Or how does he practice?

original: kathaṃ vā prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carann adhyātmaśūnyatāyāṃ yogam āpadyate yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāyāṃ yogam āpadyate /
analyzed: katham vā prajñāpāramitāyām caran adhyātma śūnyatāyām yogam āpadyate yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatāyām yogam āpadyate
translated: How, while practicing the perfection of wisdom, does one apply oneself to the emptiness of internal phenomena, up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities?

original: kathaṃ bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāñ caran saptatriṃsadbodhipakṣeṣu dharmeṣu yogam āpadyate /
analyzed: katham bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran saptatriṃsat bodhi pakṣeṣu dharmeṣu yogam āpadyate
translated: Blessed One, how does a bodhisattva-mahāsattva, while practicing the perfection of wisdom, apply himself to the thirty-seven factors of awakening?

original: evam apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattiṣu / kathaṃ śūnyatānimittāpraṇihiteṣu yogam āpadyate /
analyzed: evam apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattiṣu katham śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihiteṣu yogam āpadyate
translated: In the same way, how does he apply himself to the immeasurables, concentrations, and formless attainments? How does he apply himself to emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness?

original: evam aṣṭavimokṣeṣu navānupūrvavihārasamāpattiṣu yogam āpadyate / katham abhijñāsu yogam āpadyate /
analyzed: evam aṣṭa vimokṣeṣu nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattiṣu yogam āpadyate katham abhijñāsu yogam āpadyate
translated: In the same way, how does he apply himself to the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, and the applications of mindfulness? How does he apply himself to the superknowledges?

original: evaṃ daśasu tathāgatabaleṣu caturṣu vaiśāradyeṣu catasṛṣu pratisaṃvitsu / katham aṣṭādaśasv āveṇikeṣu buddhadharmeṣu prajñāpāramitāyāñ caran
analyzed: evam daśasu tathāgata baleṣu caturṣu vaiśāradyeṣu catasṛṣu pratisaṃvitsu katham aṣṭādaśasu āveṇikeṣu buddha dharmeṣu prajñāpāramitāyām caran  /
translated: In the same way, how does he apply himself to the ten powers of the Tathāgata, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha? How, while practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: yogam āpadyante bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ /
analyzed: yogam āpadyante bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ
translated: does a bodhisattva-mahāsattva apply himself to the applications of mindfulness?

original: evam ukte bhagavān śakraṃ devānām indram etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān śakram devānām indram etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to Śakra, Lord of the Gods:

original: sādhu sādhu kauśika sādhu khalu punas tvaṃ kauśika yas tvaṃ tathāgatam etam arthaṃ
analyzed: sādhu sādhu kauśika sādhu khalu punar tvam kauśika yaḥ tvam tathāgatam etam artham
translated: Good, good, Kauśika! It is indeed good, Kauśika, that you have asked the Tathāgata about this matter.

original: paripraśnīkartavyaṃ manyase / idam api te kauśika buddhānubhāvena pratibhānam utpannam /
analyzed: paripraśnīkartavyam manyase idam api te kauśika buddha anubhāvena pratibhānam utpannam
translated: Well said, well said, Kauśika! It is indeed good that you think to question the Tathāgata about this matter. This inspiration has arisen in you, Kauśika, through the Buddha's power.

original: tena hi kauśika śṛṇu sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca manasikuru bhāṣiṣye 'haṃ te / iti catvāraḥ prayoktākāraḥ
analyzed: tena hi kauśika śṛṇu sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca manasikuru bhāṣiṣye haṃ te iti catvāraḥ prayoktā ākāraḥ
translated: Therefore, Kauśika, listen well and remember it! I will speak to you. This is the fourth application of the speaker.

original: iha kauśika bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran rūpe na tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: iha kauśika bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran rūpe na tiṣṭhati
translated: Here, Kauśika, a bodhisattva mahāsattva, practicing the perfection of wisdom, does not stand in form.

original: yadā rūpe na tiṣṭhati tadā rūpe na yogam āpadyate /
analyzed: yadā rūpe na tiṣṭhati tadā rūpe na yogam āpadyate
translated: When he does not stand in form, then he does not engage in union with form.

original: vedanāsaṃjñāsaṃskāreṣu /
analyzed: vedanā saṃjñā saṃskāreṣu
translated: In feeling, perception, volitional formations,

original: vijñāne na tiṣṭhati yadā vijñāne na tiṣṭhati tadā vijñāne na yogam āpadyate / cakṣuṣi na tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: vijñāne na tiṣṭhati yadā vijñāne na tiṣṭhati tadā vijñāne na yogam āpadyate cakṣuṣi na tiṣṭhati
translated: and consciousness he does not stand. When he does not stand in consciousness, then he does not engage in union with consciousness. He does not stand in the eye.

original: evaṃ śrotre ghrāṇe jihvāyāṃ kāye manasi na tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: evam śrotre ghrāṇe jihvāyām kāye manasi na tiṣṭhati
translated: Thus he does not stand in the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind.

original: evaṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ yogam āpadyate / rūpe na tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: evam prajñāpāramitāyām yogam āpadyate rūpe na tiṣṭhati
translated: Thus he engages in union with the perfection of wisdom. He does not stand in form.

original: evaṃ śabde gandhe rase spraṣṭavye dharmeṣu na tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: evam śabde gandhe rase spraṣṭavye dharmeṣu na tiṣṭhati
translated: Thus he does not stand in sound, smell, taste, touch, or dharmas.

original: evaṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ yogam āpadyate / cakṣurvijñāne na tiṣṭhati /🔽cakṣuḥsaṃsparśe na tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: evam prajñāpāramitāyām yogam āpadyate cakṣuḥ vijñāne na tiṣṭhati  cakṣuḥ saṃsparśe na tiṣṭhati
translated: Thus one engages in the perfection of wisdom. One does not stand in eye-consciousness.🔽One does not stand in eye-contact.

original: cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedayite na tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedayite na tiṣṭhati
translated: One does not stand in the feeling that arises from the condition of eye-contact.

analyzed: evam śrotra ghrāṇa jihvā kāye manaḥ vijñāne na tiṣṭhati  manaḥ saṃsparśe na tiṣṭhati
translated: Thus one does not stand in ear-, nose-, tongue-, body-, and mind-consciousness.🔽One does not stand in mind-contact.

original: manaḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedayite na tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: manaḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedayite na tiṣṭhati

analyzed: evam prajñāpāramitāyām yogam āpadyate pṛthivī dhātau na tiṣṭhati
translated: Thus one engages in the perfection of wisdom. One does not stand in the earth element.

original: evam abdhātau tejodhātau vāyudhātau ākāśadhātau /
analyzed: evam ap dhātau tejaḥ dhātau vāyu dhātau ākāśa dhātau
translated: Thus one does not stand in the water, fire, wind, space, or consciousness elements.

original: vijñānadhātau na tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: vijñāna dhātau na tiṣṭhati
translated: One does not stand in the consciousness element.

original: evaṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ yogam āpadyate / avidyāyāṃ na tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: evam prajñāpāramitāyām yogam āpadyate avidyāyām na tiṣṭhati
translated: Thus one engages in the perfection of wisdom. One does not stand in ignorance.

original: evaṃ saṃskāreṣu vijñāne nāmarūpe ṣaḍāyatane sparśe vedanāyāṃ tṛṣṇāyām upādāne bhave jātau jarāmaraṇaśokaparidevaduḥkhadaurmanasyopāyāseṣu na
analyzed: evam saṃskāreṣu vijñāne nāma rūpe ṣaṣ āyatane sparśe vedanāyām tṛṣṇāyām upādāne bhave jātau jarā maraṇa śoka parideva duḥkha daurmanasya upāyāseṣu na
translated: Thus one does not stand in volitional actions, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, depression, and distress.

original: evaṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ yogam āpadyate / dānapāramitāyāṃ na tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: evam prajñāpāramitāyām yogam āpadyate dāna pāramitāyām na tiṣṭhati
translated: Thus one engages in the perfection of wisdom. One does not stand in the perfection of generosity.

analyzed: evam śīle kṣāntau vīrye dhyāne prajñāpāramitāyām na tiṣṭhati
translated: In the same way, he does not stand in the perfection of morality, patience, perseverance, or concentration.

analyzed: evam prajñāpāramitāyām yogam āpadyate adhyātma śūnyatāyām na tiṣṭhati
translated: In the same way, he applies himself to the perfection of wisdom. He does not stand in the emptiness of internal phenomena.

original: evaṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ yogam āpadyate yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāyāṃ na tiṣṭhati /

translated: In the same way, he applies himself to the perfection of wisdom. He does not stand in the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of internal and external phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great extent, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-discarded, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of intrinsic nature, or the emptiness of non-apprehension.

original: evaṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ yogam āpadyate / smṛtyupasthāneṣu na tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: evam prajñāpāramitāyām yogam āpadyate smṛti upasthāneṣu na tiṣṭhati
translated: In the same way, he applies himself to the perfection of wisdom. He does not stand in the applications of mindfulness.

analyzed: evam prajñāpāramitāyām yogam āpadyate evam samyak prahāṇa ṛddhipāda indriya bala bodhyaṅga mārgeṣu na tiṣṭhati
translated: In the same way, he applies himself to the perfection of wisdom. He does not stand in the right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, or path.

original: evaṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ yogam āpadyate / evaṃ caturṣv apramāṇeṣu caturṣu dhyāneṣu catasṛṣv
analyzed: evam prajñāpāramitāyām yogam āpadyate evam caturṣu apramāṇeṣu caturṣu dhyāneṣu catasṛṣu

translated: Thus one engages in union with the perfection of wisdom. Thus one does not stand in the ten powers of a tathāgata, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, or the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: evaṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ yogam āpadyate / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: evam prajñāpāramitāyām yogam āpadyate tat kasya hetoḥ

original: vedanāsaṃjñāsaṃskārā /
analyzed: vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārā

translated: or any consciousness in which one could stand or in which one could engage in union.

translated: Thus one does not apprehend any constituents, any sense fields, any aspects of dependent origination, any perfections, any thirty-seven aspects of the harmonies with enlightenment,🔽any emptinesses, any meditative stabilizations, any dhāraṇī gateways, any immeasurables, any concentrations, any formless absorptions, any eight aspects of liberation,

analyzed: yat vijñāne na yujyate
translated: In that he does not apply himself to consciousness,

analyzed: bhagavān āha

original: vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārā /
analyzed: vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārā
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional formations,

translated: the elements, the sense bases, dependent origination, the perfections, the emptinesses, all meditative absorptions, all dhāraṇī gateways, the factors of awakening, the noble truths, the immeasurables, the concentrations, the formless attainments, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, the higher knowledges, the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the unique qualities of a buddha

translated: Feeling, perception, volitional formations,

original: uttare ca śrutvā vimokṣate /
analyzed: uttare ca śrutvā vimokṣate
translated: And having heard more, he will be liberated.

translated: Then Śakra, lord of the gods, said this to the venerable Śāriputra:

translated: Venerable Śāriputra, if this profound perfection of wisdom were to be taught in the presence of a bodhisattva mahāsattva who has newly set out in the vehicle, what would be the problem?

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

analyzed: saced kauśika nava yāna saṃprasthitasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya puratas iyam prajñāpāramitā
translated: Kauśika, if this perfection of wisdom were to be taught in the presence of a bodhisattva mahāsattva who has newly set out in the vehicle,🔽he would tremble, be frightened, and terrified, would doubt and reject it, would not have faith in it,

original: bhāṣyeta uttrasyeta saṃtrasyeta saṃtrāsam āpadyeta pratibādhyeta pratikṣipet / nādhimucyeta

analyzed: sthānam etat kauśika vidyate yaḥ sa nava yāna saṃprasthitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ imām
translated: Kauśika, it is possible that a bodhisattva mahāsattva who has newly set out in the vehicle might think: I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and then I will liberate beings from the three realms, which are filled with many kinds of suffering, and establish them in the happiness of the gods.

original: gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ śrutvā pratikṣipya vinipātagāmikarmopacinuyāt /
analyzed: gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām śrutvā pratikṣipya vinipāta gāmi karma upacinuyāt
translated: Kausika, it is possible that a bodhisattva, a great being who has newly set out in the vehicle, having heard this profound perfection of wisdom, will reject it and accumulate actions leading to a fall,

original: sa kṛcchreṇa cireṇānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyeta / iti kṛcchre cirābhisaṃbodhaprayogaḥ

translated: and that one will attain highest genuine full Awakening only after a long time, with difficulty. This is the application to attaining Awakening after a long time with difficulty.

original: śakra āha / santi punar bhadanta śāriputra avyākṛtā bodhisattvā mahāsattvā ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ śrutvā nottrasiṣyanti na saṃtrasiṣyanti na
analyzed: śakraḥ āha santi punar bhadanta śāriputra avyākṛtāḥ bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ ye imām prajñāpāramitām śrutvā na uttrasiṣyanti na saṃtrasiṣyanti na
translated: Sakra said, Venerable Sariputra, there are also uncommitted bodhisattva great beings who, having heard this perfection of wisdom, will not tremble, be frightened, or terrified,

original: saṃtrāsam āpatsyante /
analyzed: saṃtrāsam āpatsyante
translated: and will not be cowed by it.

original: śāriputra āha /🔽na te kauśika bodhisattvā mahāsattvāś cireṇa vyākaraṇaṃ pratilapsyante anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ / ya imāṃ /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha  na te kauśika bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ cireṇa vyākaraṇam pratilapsyante anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ yaḥ imām
translated: Sariputra said,🔽 Kausika, those bodhisattva great beings who, having heard this perfection of wisdom, will not tremble, be frightened, or terrified,

translated: and will not be cowed by it, will receive their prophecy in the near future to highest genuine full Awakening.

original: te ekaṃ vā dvau vā trīn vā tathāgatān atikramiṣyanti / tato vyākaraṇaṃ pratilapsyante
analyzed: te ekam vā dvau vā trīn vā tathāgatān atikramiṣyanti tatas vyākaraṇam pratilapsyante
translated: They will surpass one, two, or three Tathāgatas, and then they will receive a prophecy

original: anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ /
analyzed: anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: atha khalu bhagavān āyuṣmantaṃ śāriputram āmantrayate sma /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān āyuṣmantam śāriputram āmantrayate sma
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Śāriputra:

original: evam etac chāriputraivam etat /
analyzed: evam etat śāriputra evam etat

analyzed: cira yāna saṃprasthitāḥ te śāriputra bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ bhaviṣyanti cira caritāḥ
translated: Those bodhisattva mahāsattvas, Śāriputra, will have set out for a long time in the Great Vehicle, will have practiced for a long time

original: ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu bahubuddhaparyupāsitās te śāriputra bodhisattvā mahāsattvā ya imāṃ
analyzed: ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu bahu buddha paryupāsitāḥ te śāriputra bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ ye imām
translated: in the six perfections, and will have attended on many Buddhas, those bodhisattva mahāsattvas, Śāriputra, who,

analyzed: gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām śrutvā na uttrasiṣyanti na saṃtrasiṣyanti na saṃtrāsam āpatsyante
translated: having heard this profound perfection of wisdom, will not tremble, be frightened, or become terrified,

original: uttare ca śrutvā udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti yathopadiṣṭāyāṃ
analyzed: uttare ca śrutvā udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti yathā upadiṣṭāyām
translated: and having heard it, will take it up, bear it in mind, recite it, master it, and set it forth as it has been taught,

original: prajñāpāramitāyāṃ sthāsyanti /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyām sthāsyanti
translated: and will abide in it.

original: atha khalv āyuṣmān śāriputro bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra said to the Blessed One:

original: pratibhāti me bhagavan pratibhāti me sugata /
analyzed: pratibhāti me bhagavan pratibhāti me sugata
translated: Blessed One, it occurs to me, Well-Gone One, it occurs to me.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:🔽Śāriputra, you may speak freely.

original: pratibhātu te /
analyzed: pratibhātu te
translated: May it occur to you.

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: tadyathāpi nāma bhagavan svapnāntaragato mahāyānasaṃprasthitaḥ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāvayet /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bhagavan svapna antara gataḥ mahāyāna saṃprasthitaḥ kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā prajñāpāramitām bhāvayet
translated: Just as, Blessed One, a son or daughter of good family who has set out in the Great Vehicle, while dreaming, would cultivate the perfection of wisdom,

original: dhyānapāramitāṃ vīryapāramitāṃ kṣāntipāramitāṃ śīlapāramitāṃ dānapāramitāṃ bhāvayet /
analyzed: dhyāna pāramitām vīrya pāramitām kṣānti pāramitām śīla pāramitām dāna pāramitām bhāvayet
translated: would cultivate the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of giving,

original: yāvad bodhimaṇḍe niṣīded /🔽veditavyam etad bhagavann abhyāsannī bhavaty ayaṃ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ / kaḥ punar vādo /
analyzed: yāvat bodhimaṇḍe niṣīdet  veditavyam etat bhagavan abhyāsannī bhavati ayam kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ kaḥ punar vādaḥ
translated: and would sit on the terrace of enlightenment,

original: bhagavan yaḥ prativibuddhaḥ prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāvayet /
analyzed: bhagavan yaḥ prativibuddhaḥ prajñāpāramitām bhāvayet
translated: Blessed One, it should be known that this son or daughter of good family is near to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening. How much more so, Blessed One, if one who has awoken would cultivate the perfection of wisdom,

original: dhyānapāramitāṃ vīryapāramitāṃ kṣāntipāramitāṃ śīlapāramitāṃ dānapāramitāṃ bhāvayet /
analyzed: dhyāna pāramitām vīrya pāramitām kṣānti pāramitām śīla pāramitām dāna pāramitām bhāvayet
translated: would cultivate the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of giving.

original: veditavyam etad bhagavann abhyāsannī bhavaty ayaṃ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ / iti vyākaraṇalābhaprayogaḥ
analyzed: veditavyam etat bhagavan abhyāsannī bhavati ayam kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ iti vyākaraṇa lābha prayogaḥ
translated: Blessed One, it should be known that this son or daughter of good family is near to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening. Thus is the application to the attainment of prophecy.

original: paripakvakuśalamūlās te bhagavan kulaputrāḥ kuladuhitaraś ca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: paripakva kuśala mūlāḥ te bhagavan kula putrāḥ kula duhitaraḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: Those sons of good family and daughters of good family, Blessed One, will have ripened wholesome roots,

original: ya imāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ lapsyante śravaṇāya śrutvā ca pratipatsyante / cirayānasaṃprasthitās te bhagavan kulaputrā kuladuhitaraś ca
analyzed: ye imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām lapsyante śravaṇāya śrutvā ca pratipatsyante cira yāna saṃprasthitāḥ te bhagavan kula putrā kula duhitaraḥ ca
translated: who will obtain this profound perfection of wisdom to listen to it, and having listened, will practice it. They have set out in the vehicle for a long time, Blessed One, those sons of good family and daughters of good family,

original: avaropitakuśalamūlā bahubuddhaparyupāsitāḥ kalyāṇamitraparigṛhītās te bhagavan kulaputrāḥ kuladuhitaraś ca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: avaropita kuśala mūlāḥ bahu buddha paryupāsitāḥ kalyāṇa mitra parigṛhītāḥ te bhagavan kula putrāḥ kula duhitaraḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: who will have planted wholesome roots, attended on many Buddhas, and been assisted by good friends, Blessed One, those sons of good family and daughters of good family will be,

original: ya imāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ śrutvā udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti
analyzed: ye imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām śrutvā udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti
translated: who, having heard this profound perfection of wisdom, will take it up, bear it in mind, recite it,

original: paryavāpsyanti yoniśaś ca manasikariṣyanti / abhyāsannās te bhagavan kulaputrāḥ kuladuhitaraś
analyzed: paryavāpsyanti yoniśas ca manasi kariṣyanti abhyāsannāḥ te bhagavan kula putrāḥ kula duhitaraḥ
translated: understand it, and properly pay attention to it. They will be close, Blessed One, those sons of good family and daughters of good family,

original: ca bhaviṣyanty anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodhervyākaraṇasya vyākariṣyanti vā / /
analyzed: ca bhaviṣyanti anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ vyākaraṇasya vyākariṣyanti vā
translated: to the prediction of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, or they will have been predicted.

original: avinivartanīyā vā te kulaputrāḥ kuladuhitaraś cānuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodher /
analyzed: a vinivartanīyāḥ vā te kula putrāḥ kula duhitaraḥ ca anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: Or those sons of good family and daughters of good family are irreversible from unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: yeṣāṃ svayam iyaṃ prajñāpāramitā upapatsyate upapannāṃ ca satīm udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti yoniśaś ca manasikariṣyanti /
analyzed: yeṣām svayam iyam prajñāpāramitā upapatsyate upapannām ca satīm udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti yoniśas ca manasikariṣyanti
translated: Those who will themselves attain this perfection of wisdom, and having attained it will take it up, bear it in mind, recite it, learn it, and wisely attend to it.

original: ity avinivartanīyaprayogaḥ
analyzed: iti a vinivartanīya prayogaḥ
translated: Thus is the practice of the irreversible.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bhagavan puruṣo yojanaśatikād aṭavīkāntārān niṣkrāmet /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bhagavan puruṣaḥ yojana śatikāt aṭavī kāntārāt niṣkrāmet
translated: Just as, Blessed One, a man would come out of a hundred-league great forest,

original: dviyojanaśatikāt triyojanaśatikāc caturyojanaśatikāt pañcayojanaśatikād aṭavīkāntārān
analyzed: dvi yojana śatikāt tri yojana śatikāt catur yojana śatikāt pañca yojana śatikāt aṭavī kāntārān
translated: out of a two-hundred-league great forest, out of a three-hundred-league great forest, out of a four-hundred-league great forest, out of a five-hundred-league great forest,

original: niṣkrāmen niṣkramya paśyed grāmasya nagarasya nigamasya vā pūrvāni nimittāni gopālakān
analyzed: niṣkrāmet niṣkramya paśyet grāmasya nagarasya nigamasya vā pūrvāni nimittāni gopālakān
translated: having come out, he would see the first signs of a village, town, or city, such as cowherds,

original: vā paśupālakān vā sīmā vā ārāmān vā vanāni vā udyānāni vā udyānanimittāni vā grāmān🔽vā nagarāṇi vā nigamān vā rājadhānīn vā rāṣṭrāṇi vā pūrvanimittāni grāmasya nagarasya
analyzed: vā paśu pālakān vā sīmāḥ vā ārāmān vā vanāni vā udyānāni vā udyāna nimittāni vā grāmān  vā nagarāṇi vā nigamān vā rājadhānīn vā rāṣṭrāṇi vā pūrva nimittāni grāmasya nagarasya
translated: or shepherds, or boundaries, or parks, or forests, or gardens, or signs of gardens, or villages,

original: nigamasya vā dṛṣṭvaivaṃ bhavati yādṛśānīmāni pūrvanimittāni dṛśyante abhyāsanna ito
analyzed: nigamasya vā dṛṣṭvā evam bhavati yādṛśāni imāni pūrva nimittāni dṛśyante abhyāsanne itas
translated: or towns, or cities, or royal palaces, or countries, having seen the first signs of a village, town, or city, he would think: 'As these first signs are seen, they are near,

original: grāmo vā nagaraṃ vā nigamaṃ vā rājadhānyo vā rāṣṭrāṇi vā bhaviṣyanti / sa āśvāsaprāpto bhavet /
analyzed: grāmaḥ vā nagaram vā nigamam vā rājadhānyaḥ vā rāṣṭrāṇi vā bhaviṣyanti saḥ āśvāsa prāptaḥ bhavet
translated: or a village, or a town, or a market-town, or a royal city, or a country, he would be one who has obtained consolation.

original: na cāsya bhūyo bhavati caurabhayaṃ vā caṇḍālabhayaṃ vā caṇḍamṛgabhayaṃ vā bubhukṣābhayaṃ
analyzed: na ca asya bhūyaḥ bhavati caura bhayam vā caṇḍāla bhayam vā caṇḍa mṛga bhayam vā bubhukṣā bhayam
translated: And he would no longer have fear of thieves, or fear of Cāṇḍālas, or fear of wild animals, or fear of hunger,

original: vā pipāsābhayaṃ vā / evam eva bhagavan yasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya svayam iyaṃ🔽gambhīrā prajñāpāramitā upapatsyate upapannāṃ ca satīm udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati
analyzed: vā pipāsā bhayam vā evam eva bhagavan yasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya svayam iyam  gambhīrā prajñāpāramitā upapatsyate upapannām ca satīm udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati
translated: or fear of thirst. In the same way, Blessed One, it should be known that a bodhisattva mahāsattva for whom this profound perfection of wisdom🔽will occur, and having occurred will be taken up, borne in mind,

original: vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati yoniśaś ca manasikariṣyati /
analyzed: vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati yoniśas ca manasikariṣyati
translated: recited, mastered, and properly paid attention to,

original: veditavyam etad bhagavann abhyāsanno 'yaṃ bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhaviṣyati vyākaraṇasyānuttarāyāḥ
analyzed: veditavyam etat bhagavan abhyāsannaḥ yam bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhaviṣyati vyākaraṇasya anuttarāyāḥ
translated: Blessed One, that bodhisattva mahāsattva is near to the prediction of unsurpassed,

original: samyaksaṃbodher na cireṇābhisaṃbhotsyate / tena ca bodhisattvena mahāsattvena na bhetavyaṃ
analyzed: samyaksaṃbodheḥ na cireṇa abhisaṃbhotsyate tena ca bodhisattvena mahāsattvena na bhetavyam
translated: perfect enlightenment, and will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment before long. And that bodhisattva mahāsattva should not be afraid

original: śrāvakabhūmer vā pratyekabuddhabhūmer vā / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: śrāvaka bhūmeḥ vā pratyekabuddha bhūmeḥ vā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: of the level of the śrāvakas or the level of the pratyekabuddhas. Why is that?

original: imāni tāni pūrvanimittāni yad utemāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ bodhisattvo mahāsattvo labhate darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya śravaṇāya /
analyzed: imāni tāni pūrva nimittāni yat uta imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ labhate darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya śravaṇāya
translated: These are the former signs, namely that the bodhisattva mahāsattva obtains this profound perfection of wisdom for the sake of seeing, paying homage, serving, and listening.

original: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantaṃ śāriputram etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam śāriputram etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the venerable Śāriputra:

original: evam etac chāriputraivam etat / iti niryāṇaprayogaḥ
analyzed: evam etat śāriputra evam etat iti niryāṇa prayogaḥ
translated: It is so, Śāriputra, it is so. Thus is the application to departure.

original: pratibhātu te śāriputra bhūyasyā mātrayā buddhānubhāvena /
analyzed: pratibhātu te śāriputra bhūyasyā mātrayā buddha anubhāvena
translated: May it occur to you, Śāriputra, through the Buddha's power, even more.

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: tadyathā pi nāma bhagavan puruṣo mahāsamudraṃ draṣṭukāmo bhavet /
analyzed: tat yathā pi nāma bhagavan puruṣaḥ mahā samudram draṣṭu kāmaḥ bhavet
translated: It is just as if, Blessed One, a person were to wish to see the great ocean.

original: sa gacchet mahāsamudraṃ darśanāya yathā yathā gacchet mahāsamudraṃ tathā tathā paśyet stambaṃ vā stambanimittaṃ vā parvataṃ vā parvatanimittaṃ
analyzed: sa gacchet mahā samudram darśanāya yathā yathā gacchet mahā samudram tathā tathā paśyet stambam vā stamba nimittam vā parvatam vā parvata nimittam
translated: He would go to see the great ocean. As he goes to the great ocean, in that way he would see a stump or a sign of a stump, a mountain or a sign of a mountain.

original: tenaivaṃ veditavyaṃ dūre ito mahāsamudro nāsanna /
analyzed: tena evam veditavyam dūre itas mahā samudraḥ na āsan na
translated: He should know thus: 'Far from here is the great ocean, it is not near.

original: ito mahāsamudraḥ / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: itas mahā samudraḥ tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Here is the great ocean.' Why is that?

original: na hi mahāsamudrasyābhyāse kaścit stambo vā stambanimittaṃ vā parvato vā parvatanimittaṃ vā dṛśyante / tadyathāpi nāma bhagavan puruṣo mahāsamudraṃ 🔽draṣṭukāmo bhavet /
analyzed: na hi mahā samudrasya abhyāse kaścid stambaḥ vā stamba nimittam vā parvataḥ vā parvata nimittam vā dṛśyante tat yathā api nāma bhagavan puruṣaḥ mahā samudram  draṣṭu kāmaḥ bhavet
translated: For near the great ocean no tree or sign of a tree or mountain or sign of a mountain is seen. Just as, Blessed One, a person might wish to see the great ocean.🔽As he goes to see the great ocean,

original: sa yathā yathā gacchet mahāsamudraṃ darśanāya tathā tathā na paśyet stambaṃ vā stambanimittaṃ vā parvataṃ vā parvatanimittaṃ vā /
analyzed: sa yathā yathā gacchet mahā samudram darśanāya tathā tathā na paśyet stambam vā stamba nimittam vā parvatam vā parvata nimittam vā
translated: in that way he does not see a tree or sign of a tree or mountain or sign of a mountain.

original: tasyaivaṃ bhavati na dūre ito mahāsamudra āsanna ito mahāsamudraḥ / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tasya evam bhavati na dūre itas mahā samudraḥ āsannaḥ itas mahā samudraḥ tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: He thinks thus: 'The great ocean is not far from here, the great ocean is near here.' Why is that?

original: na hi mahāsamudrasyāsanne kaścit stambo vā stambanimittaṃ vā parvato vā parvatanimittaṃ vā dṛśyate /
analyzed: na hi mahā samudrasya āsanne kaścid stambaḥ vā stamba nimittam vā parvataḥ vā parvata nimittam vā dṛśyate
translated: For near the great ocean no tree or sign of a tree or mountain or sign of a mountain is seen.

original: kiṃ cāpi sa puruṣaś cakṣuṣā mahāsamudran na paśyati / atha ca punaḥ sa niṣṭhāṃ gacchati /
analyzed: kim ca api sa puruṣaḥ cakṣuṣā mahā samudrat na paśyati atha ca punar sa niṣṭhām gacchati
translated: Although that person does not see the great ocean with his eyes, nevertheless he comes to the conclusion:

original: āsanno 'smi mahāsamudrasyābhyāsanna ito mahāsamudra iti /
analyzed: āsannaḥ smi mahā samudrasya abhyāsannaḥ itas mahā samudraḥ iti
translated: 'I am near the great ocean, I am close to the great ocean.'

original: neto bhūyo dūre mahāsamudra iti / evam eva bhagavaṃs tena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena evaṃ veditavyam /
analyzed: na itas bhūyas dūre mahā samudraḥ iti evam eva bhagavan tena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena evam veditavyam
translated: It is not far from here to the great ocean. In the same way, Blessed One, that bodhisattva mahāsattva should know:

original: imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ śṛṇutā udgṛhṇatā dhārayatā vācayatā paryavāpnuvatā yoniśo manasikurvatā /
analyzed: imām prajñāpāramitām śṛṇutā udgṛhṇatā dhārayatā vācayatā paryavāpnuvatā yoniśas manasikurvatā
translated: Having heard, taken up, borne in mind, recited, understood, and contemplated this perfection of wisdom with wisdom,

original: evaṃ cintayitavyaṃ kiṃ cāpy ahaṃ tena bhagavatā na saṃmukhaṃ vyākṛto 'nuttarāyāṃ
analyzed: evam cintayitavyam kim ca api aham tena bhagavatā na saṃmukham vyākṛtaḥ nuttarāyām
translated: he should think like this: 'Although I have not been directly prophesied by that Blessed One to unsurpassed,

original: samyaksaṃbodhau iyadbhiḥ kalpair iyadbhiḥ kalpaśatair iyadbhiḥ kalpasahasrair iyadbhiḥ🔽kalpaśatasahasrair iyadbhiḥ kalpakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrais tvam anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim
analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhau iyadbhiḥ kalpaiḥ iyadbhiḥ kalpa śataiḥ iyadbhiḥ kalpa sahasraiḥ iyadbhiḥ  kalpa śata sahasraiḥ iyadbhiḥ kalpa koṭī niyuta śata sahasraiḥ tvam anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim
translated: perfect enlightenment in so many eons, in so many hundreds of eons, in so many thousands of eons, in so many🔽hundreds of thousands of eons, in so many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of eons, 'You will fully awaken

original: abhisaṃbhotsyasa iti /
analyzed: abhisaṃbhotsyase iti
translated: to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,'

original: atha ca punar bodhisattvena mahāsattvena evaṃ veditavyam /
analyzed: atha ca punar bodhisattvena mahāsattvena evam veditavyam
translated: nevertheless, the bodhisattva mahāsattva should know:

original: āsannībhūto 'smy anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodher vyākaraṇasyeti / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: āsannībhūtaḥ smi anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ vyākaraṇasya iti tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: 'I am close to the prophecy of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.' Why is that?

original: tathā hy aham imāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ labhe darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya
analyzed: tathā hi aham imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām labhe darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya
translated: Because I have obtained the opportunity to see, pay homage to, and serve this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: śravaṇāya śrutvā codgṛhṇāmi dhārayāmi vācayāmi paryavāpnomi yoniśaś ca manasikaromi /
analyzed: śravaṇāya śrutvā ca udgṛhṇāmi dhārayāmi vācayāmi paryavāpnomi yoniśas ca manasikaromi
translated: Having heard it, I take it up, retain it, recite it, master it, and properly pay attention to it.

original: iti niruttaraprayogaḥ
analyzed: iti niruttara prayogaḥ
translated: This is the unsurpassed practice.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bhagavan vasante pratyupasthite śīrṇaparṇapalāśeṣu stambheṣu ākarajāteṣu
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bhagavan vasante pratyupasthite śīrṇa parṇa palāśeṣu stambheṣu ākara jāteṣu
translated: Blessed One, it is just as when spring has arrived and the trunks of trees that have lost their leaves and bark

original: veditavyaṃ jāmbūdvīpakair manuṣyair netaś cireṇa patrāṇi ca puṣpāṇi ca phalāni ca
analyzed: veditavyam jāmbūdvīpakaiḥ manuṣyaiḥ na itas cireṇa patrāṇi ca puṣpāṇi ca phalāni ca
translated: are known by the people of Jambudvīpa that before long leaves, flowers, and fruits

original: prādurbhaviṣyanti / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: prādurbhaviṣyanti tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: will appear. Why is that?

original: imāni tāni pūrvanimittāni stambeṣu dṛśyante netaś cireṇa patrāṇi ca puṣpāṇi ca phalāni ca prādurbhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: imāni tāni pūrva nimittāni stambeṣu dṛśyante na itas cireṇa patrāṇi ca puṣpāṇi ca phalāni ca prādurbhaviṣyanti
translated: These are the previous signs seen on the trunks, that before long leaves, flowers, and fruits will appear.

original: āttamanaskā jāmbūdvīpakā manuṣyā bhaviṣyanti tāni ca pūrvanimittāni dṛṣṭvā stambeṣu /
analyzed: ātta manaskāḥ jāmbūdvīpakāḥ manuṣyāḥ bhaviṣyanti tāni ca pūrva nimittāni dṛṣṭvā stambeṣu
translated: The people of Jambudvīpa, having seen those previous signs on the trunks, will be delighted.🔽In the same way, Blessed One, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who obtains this profound perfection of wisdom for the sake of seeing, paying homage, serving, and listening to it,

original: evam eva bhagavan yo bodhisattvo mahāsattva imāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ labhate darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya śravanāya śrutvā /
analyzed: evam eva bhagavan yaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām labhate darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya śravanāya śrutvā
translated: having heard it,

original: codgṛhṇāti dhārayati vācayati paryavāpsyati yoniśaś ca manasikaroti paripakvakuśalamūlaḥ sa bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvo veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: ca udgṛhṇāti dhārayati vācayati paryavāpsyati yoniśas ca manasikaroti paripakva kuśala mūlaḥ sa bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: He who takes it up, bears it in mind, reads it aloud, masters it, and properly pays attention to it, that noble son or daughter, Blessed One, should be known as one whose wholesome roots are mature.

original: bahubuddhaparyupāsitaḥ sa bhagavan kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā veditavyaḥ / veditavyam🔽etad bhagavaṃs tena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena pūrvakair eva kuśalamūlair upanīto
analyzed: bahu buddha paryupāsitaḥ sa bhagavan kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā veditavyaḥ veditavyam  etat bhagavan tena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena pūrvakaiḥ eva kuśala mūlaiḥ
translated: That noble son or daughter, Blessed One, should be known as one who has attended upon many Buddhas.

original: 'smy anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ /
analyzed: smi anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: Blessed One, that Bodhisattva Mahasattva should know that he has been brought near to the highest complete enlightenment by his own wholesome roots.

original: yo 'ham imāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ labhe darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya śravaṇāya
analyzed: yaḥ ham imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām labhe darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya śravaṇāya
translated: I, having obtained this profound perfection of wisdom, for the sake of seeing, worshipping, attending upon, and listening to it,

original: yathopadiṣṭāyāṃ ca prajñāpāramitāyāṃ pratipadyeyaṃ tatra devaputrāḥ pūrvabuddhadarśino
analyzed: yathā upadiṣṭāyām ca prajñāpāramitāyām pratipadyeyam tatra deva putrāḥ pūrva buddha darśinaḥ
translated: and practicing the perfection of wisdom as taught, those gods, sons of gods, who have seen previous Buddhas,

original: bhavanti / te pramuditāḥ prītisaumanasyajātāḥ pūrvakāṇām api bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām
analyzed: bhavanti te pramuditāḥ prīti saumanasya jātāḥ pūrvakāṇām api bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām
translated: being greatly delighted, joyful, and pleased, say to each other: 'The former Bodhisattvas, the great beings,

original: imāny eva pūrvanimittāni abhūvan vyākaraṇāya na cireṇāyaṃ bodhisattvo mahāsattvo
analyzed: imāni eva pūrva nimittāni abhūvan vyākaraṇāya na cireṇa ayam bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ
translated: had just these very previous signs for the sake of receiving the prophecy. Before long, this Bodhisattva Mahasattva,🔽will receive the prophecy of the highest complete enlightenment.

original: vyākaraṇaṃ pratilapsyate anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: vyākaraṇam pratilapsyate anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: will receive a prophecy of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: ity āsannābhisaṃbodhaprayogaḥ
analyzed: iti āsanna abhisaṃbodha prayogaḥ
translated: Thus ends the chapter on the practice of being near to complete enlightenment, the eighth in the glorious Perfection of Wisdom in a Hundred Thousand Lines.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bhagavan strīgurviṇī sā yathā yathā āsannaprasavā bhavati tathā tathāsyāḥ kāyo veṣṭate 'dhimātraṃ ca kāye vedanāklamathaś ca
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bhagavan strī gurviṇī sā yathā yathā āsanna prasavā bhavati tathā tathā asyāḥ kāyaḥ veṣṭate dhimātram ca kāye vedanā klamathaḥ ca
translated: Blessed One, just as a pregnant woman, as her delivery draws near, has her body wracked with pain to an extreme degree,

original: na ca caṅkramaṇaśīlā bhavati /🔽alpasmṛtiś ca bhavati /🔽alpāhārā ca bhavati /
analyzed: na ca caṅkramaṇa śīlā bhavati  alpa smṛtiḥ ca bhavati  alpa āhārā ca bhavati
translated: and is not inclined to move around,🔽and has little memory,🔽and eats little,

original: alpastyānamiddhā ca bhavati /
analyzed: alpaḥ tyānam iddhā ca bhavati
translated: and has little sloth and torpor,

original: tābhir vedanābhir vartamānābhir alpabhāṣyā ca bhavati /
analyzed: tābhiḥ vedanābhiḥ vartamānābhiḥ alpa bhāṣyā ca bhavati
translated: and because of those present pains she speaks little,

original: na ca saṃvāsaśīlā bhavati /🔽tena pūrvakeṇāyoniśomanasikāreṇāsevitena bhāvitena niṣevitena imām evaṃrūpāṃ vedanāṃ
analyzed: na ca saṃvāsa śīlā bhavati  tena pūrvakeṇa a yoniśaḥ manasikāreṇa āsevitena bhāvitena niṣevitena imām evaṃrūpām vedanām
translated: and is not inclined to socialize,

original: pratyanubhavāmīti / veditavyam evaṃ tato 'nyābhiḥ strībhir yādṛśāny asyāḥ striyo nimittāni
analyzed: pratyanubhavāmi iti veditavyam evam tatas nyābhiḥ strībhiḥ yādṛśāni asyāḥ striyaḥ nimittāni
translated: and she thinks, ‘Because of those past improper thoughts, which I cultivated, developed, and increased, I am now experiencing this kind of pain.’ Other women can know from such signs

original: dṛśyante na cireṇaiveyaṃ strī prasaviṣyati / evam eva bhagavan bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām
analyzed: dṛśyante na cireṇa eva iyam strī prasaviṣyati evam eva bhagavan bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām
translated: that this woman will give birth before long. In the same way, Blessed One, from the signs of bodhisattva great beings

original: avaropitakuśalamūlānāṃ bahubuddhaparyupāsitānāṃ sucaritacīrṇacaritānāṃ kalyāṇamitraparigṛhītānāṃ
analyzed: avaropita kuśala mūlānām bahu buddha paryupāsitānām su carita cīrṇa caritānām kalyāṇa mitra parigṛhītānām
translated: for those who have planted the roots of virtue, who have attended on many Buddhas, who have practiced good conduct, who have been taken up by spiritual friends,

original: paripakvakuśalamūlānām iyaṃ gambhīrā prajñāpāramitā upapatsyate upapannāṃ ca satīm
analyzed: paripakva kuśala mūlānām iyam gambhīrā prajñāpāramitā upapatsyate upapannām ca satīm
translated: for those whose roots of virtue are ripe, this profound perfection of wisdom will occur, and once it has occurred,

original: udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti yoniśaś ca manasikariṣyanti /
analyzed: udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti yoniśas ca manasikariṣyanti
translated: they will take it up, bear it in mind, read it aloud, master it, and attend to it in the correct manner.

original: veditavyam etan na cireṇaiṣāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ vyākaraṇaṃ bhaviṣyati anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ /
analyzed: veditavyam etat na cireṇa eṣām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām vyākaraṇam bhaviṣyati anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: It should be known that before long, those Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas will receive the prophecy of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: sādhu sādhu śāriputra idam api te śāriputra buddhānubhāvena pratibhānam utpannam / iti kṣiprābhisaṃbodhaprayogaḥ
analyzed: sādhu sādhu śāriputra idam api te śāriputra buddha anubhāvena pratibhānam utpannam iti kṣipra abhisaṃbodha prayogaḥ
translated: Excellent, excellent, Śāriputra! This inspiration of yours has arisen through the Buddha's power. Thus is the practice for quickly attaining enlightenment.

original: atha khalv āyuṣmān subhūtir bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the Venerable Subhūti said this to the Blessed One:

original: āścaryaṃ bhagavan yāvad anugṛhītāḥ suparīttāś ceme bodhisattvā mahāsattvās /
analyzed: āścaryam bhagavan yāvat anugṛhītāḥ su parīttāḥ ca ime bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ
translated: It is amazing, Blessed One, how much these few Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas have been favored

original: tathāgatenārhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena /
analyzed: tathāgatena arhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena
translated: by the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:🔽Subhūti, it is so! It is so!

original: tathā hi subhūte bodhisattvā mahāsattvā bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya pratipannā
analyzed: tathā hi subhūte bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya pratipannā
translated: For thus, Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas are engaged for the benefit and happiness of many people,

original: lokānukampāyai mahato janakāyasyārthāya hitāya sukhāya devānāñ ca manuṣyānāñ cānuttarāyai
analyzed: loka anukampāyai mahataḥ jana kāyasya arthāya hitāya sukhāya devānām ca manuṣyānām ca anuttarāyai
translated: out of compassion for the world, for the sake, benefit, and happiness of great groups of people, of gods and humans, and are established in

original: samyaksaṃbodhaye pratiṣṭhante bodhisattvacaryāñ caranto 'nekāni sattvaśatāni anekāni
analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhaye pratiṣṭhante bodhisattva caryām carantaḥ nekāni sattva śatāni anekāni
translated: unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment. Practicing the bodhisattva conduct, they will benefit many hundreds of beings, many thousands of beings,

original: sattvasahasrāṇi anekāni sattvaśatasahasrāṇi anekāni sattvakoṭiniyutaśatasahasrāṇi anugrahīṣyanti /
analyzed: sattva sahasrāṇi anekāni sattva śata sahasrāṇi anekāni sattva koṭi niyuta śata sahasrāṇi anugrahīṣyanti
translated: many hundreds of thousands of beings, many koṭis of beings, many niyutas of koṭis of beings, and many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of beings.

original: caturbhiḥ saṃgrahavastubhir dānena priyavadyena arthacaryayā samānārthatayā daśakuśaleṣu karmapatheṣu samādāpayanti /
analyzed: caturbhiḥ saṃgraha vastubhiḥ dānena priyavadyena artha caryayā samāna artha tayā daśa kuśaleṣu karma patheṣu samādāpayanti
translated: They will establish them in the ten wholesome courses of action through the four means of gathering disciples: generosity, kind speech, meaningful action, and practicing what one preaches.

original: caturṣu dhyāneṣu caturṣv apramāṇeṣu catasṛṣv ārūpyasamāpattiṣu samādāpayanti / ātmanā
analyzed: caturṣu dhyāneṣu caturṣu apramāṇeṣu catasṛṣu ārūpya samāpattiṣu samādāpayanti ātmanā
translated: They will establish them in the four meditations, the four immeasurable [minds], and the four formless attainments. They themselves

original: caiteṣu dharmeṣu pratiṣṭhitā bhavanti / ātmanā ca dānapāramitāyāṃ caranti parāṃś ca
analyzed: ca eteṣu dharmeṣu pratiṣṭhitāḥ bhavanti ātmanā ca dāna pāramitāyām caranti parān ca
translated: are established in those dharmas. They themselves practice the perfection of generosity, and they establish others in the perfection of generosity.

original: dānapāramitāyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpayanti / ātmanā ca śīlapāramitāyāṃ caranti parāṃś ca śīlapāramitāyāṃ🔽pratiṣṭhāpayanti / ātmanā ca kṣāntipāramitāyāṃ caranti parāṃś ca kṣāntipāramitāyāṃ
analyzed: dāna pāramitāyām pratiṣṭhāpayanti ātmanā ca śīla pāramitāyām caranti parān ca śīla pāramitāyām  pratiṣṭhāpayanti ātmanā ca kṣānti pāramitāyām caranti parān ca kṣānti pāramitāyām
translated: They establish them in the perfection of generosity. They themselves practice the perfection of morality and establish others in the perfection of morality.🔽They themselves practice the perfection of patience and establish others in the perfection of patience.

original: pratiṣṭhāpayanti / ātmanā ca vīryapāramitāyāṃ caranti parāṃś ca vīryapāramitāyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpayanti /
analyzed: pratiṣṭhāpayanti ātmanā ca vīrya pāramitāyām caranti parān ca vīrya pāramitāyām pratiṣṭhāpayanti
translated: They themselves practice the perfection of effort and establish others in the perfection of effort.

original: ātmanā ca dhyānapāramitāyāṃ caranti parāṃś ca dhyānapāramitāyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpayanti /
analyzed: ātmanā ca dhyāna pāramitāyām caranti parān ca dhyāna pāramitāyām pratiṣṭhāpayanti
translated: They themselves practice the perfection of concentration and establish others in the perfection of concentration.

original: ātmanā ca prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caranti parāṃś ca prajñāpāramitāyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpayanti /
analyzed: ātmanā ca prajñāpāramitāyām caranti parān ca prajñāpāramitāyām pratiṣṭhāpayanti
translated: They themselves practice the perfection of wisdom and establish others in the perfection of wisdom.

original: te ca prajñāpāramitām āgamya upāyakauśalyena sattvān srotaāpattiphale pratiṣṭhāpayanti
analyzed: te ca prajñāpāramitām āgamya upāya kauśalyena sattvān srotaāpatti phale pratiṣṭhāpayanti
translated: And by means of the perfection of wisdom and skillful means, they establish beings in the fruit of entering the stream,

original: na cātmanā sākṣāt kurvanti / evaṃ sakṛdāgāmiphale anāgāmiphale arhattve /
analyzed: na ca ātmanā sākṣāt kurvanti evam sakṛdāgāmi phale anāgāmi phale arhat tve
translated: but they themselves do not actualize it. Similarly, in the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, and arhatship.

original: pratyekāyāṃ bodhau pratiṣṭhāpayanti na cātmanā pratyekāṃ bodhiṃ sākṣāt kurvanti /
analyzed: pratyekāyām bodhau pratiṣṭhāpayanti na ca ātmanā pratyekām bodhim sākṣāt kurvanti
translated: They establish them in individual enlightenment, but they themselves do not actualize individual enlightenment.

original: ātmanā cāvinivartanīyāṃ bhūmim ākrāmanti parāṃś cāvinivartanīyabhūmau pratiṣṭhāpayanti /
analyzed: ātmanā ca a vinivartanīyām bhūmim ākrāmanti parān ca a vinivartanīya bhūmau pratiṣṭhāpayanti
translated: They themselves enter the irreversible stage and establish others in the irreversible stage.

original: ātmanā ca buddhakṣetraṃ pariśodhayanti /
analyzed: ātmanā ca buddhakṣetram pariśodhayanti
translated: They themselves purify the Buddha-field

original: anyāṃś ca bodhisattvān buddhakṣetrapariśuddhau samādāpayanti / ātmanā ca sattvān paripācayanti
analyzed: anyān ca bodhisattvān buddhakṣetra pariśuddhau samādāpayanti ātmanā ca sattvān paripācayanti
translated: and encourage other bodhisattvas to purify the Buddha-field. They themselves bring beings to maturity

original: parāṃś ca sattvaparipāke samādāpayanti / ātmanā cābhijñā utpādayanti parāṃś cābhijñāprāptaye🔽samādāpayanti / ātmanā ca dhāraṇīmukhaṃ pariśodhayanti parān api dhāraṇīmukhapariśuddhaye
analyzed: parān ca sattva paripāke samādāpayanti ātmanā ca abhijñāḥ utpādayanti parān ca abhijñā prāptaye  samādāpayanti ātmanā ca dhāraṇī mukham pariśodhayanti parān api dhāraṇī mukha pariśuddhaye
translated: and encourage others to bring beings to maturity. They themselves produce the superknowledges🔽and encourage others to attain the superknowledges. They themselves purify the door of retention

original: samādāpayanti / ātmanā ca pratibhānasaṃpadaṃ pratilabhante parān api pratibhānasaṃpadi🔽samādāpayanti / ātmanā ca rūpasaṃpadaṃ parigṛhṇanti parān api rūpasaṃpatpratilābhāya
analyzed: samādāpayanti ātmanā ca pratibhāna saṃpadam pratilabhante parān api pratibhāna saṃpadi  samādāpayanti ātmanā ca rūpa saṃpadam parigṛhṇanti parān api rūpa saṃpad pratilābhāya
translated: and encourage others to purify the door of retention. They themselves attain the perfection of eloquence🔽and encourage others in the perfection of eloquence. They themselves take on the perfection of form🔽and encourage others to attain the perfection of form. They themselves take on the perfection of marks

original: samādāpayanti / ātmanā ca lakṣaṇasaṃpadaṃ parigṛhṇanti parān api /
analyzed: samādāpayanti ātmanā ca lakṣaṇa saṃpadam parigṛhṇanti parān api
translated: and encourage others in the perfection of marks.

original: lakṣaṇasaṃpatpratilābhāya samādāpayanti / ātmanā ca kumārabhūtasaṃpadaṃ parigṛhṇanti
analyzed: lakṣaṇa saṃpad pratilābhāya samādāpayanti ātmanā ca kumāra bhūta saṃpadam parigṛhṇanti
translated: They encourage the attainment of the perfection of the major and minor marks. They themselves take up the perfection of youthfulness.

original: parān api kumārabhūtasaṃpatpratigrahāya samādāpayanti / ātmanā ca bodhipakṣyān dharmān
analyzed: parān api kumāra bhūta saṃpad pratigrahāya samādāpayanti ātmanā ca bodhi pakṣyān dharmān
translated: They encourage others to take up the perfection of youthfulness. They themselves accomplish the factors of awakening.

original: niṣpādayanti parān api bodhipakṣyadharmapariniṣpattaye samādāpayanti / ātmanā ca satyavimokṣanavānupūrvavihārasamāpattiśūnyatānimittāpraṇihitadhāraṇīmukhān🔽utpādayanti parān apy eṣu samādāpayanti / ātmanā ca catvāri vaiśāradyāni utpādayanti
analyzed: niṣpādayanti parān api bodhi pakṣya dharma pariniṣpattaye samādāpayanti ātmanā ca satya vimokṣa nava anupūrva vihāra samāpatti śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita dhāraṇī mukhān  utpādayanti parān api eṣu samādāpayanti ātmanā ca catvāri vaiśāradyāni utpādayanti
translated: They encourage others to accomplish the factors of awakening. They themselves produce the truths, liberations, nine successive abodes, meditative absorptions, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.🔽They encourage others in these. They themselves produce the four forms of fearlessness.

original: parān api caturṣu vaiśāradyeṣu samādāpayanti / ātmanā ca catasraḥ pratisaṃvida utpādayanti🔽parān api caturaḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ prāptaye samādāpayanti / ātmanā ca mahāmaitrīṃ mahākaruṇāṃ
analyzed: parān api caturṣu vaiśāradyeṣu samādāpayanti ātmanā ca catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ utpādayanti  parān api caturaḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ prāptaye samādāpayanti ātmanā ca mahā maitrīm mahā karuṇām
translated: They encourage others in the four forms of fearlessness. They themselves produce the four forms of unobstructed cognition.🔽They encourage others to attain the four forms of unobstructed cognition. They themselves cultivate great loving kindness, great compassion,

original: mahāmuditāṃ mahopekṣāṃ vibhāvayanti parān api caturapramāṇā vibhāvanāyai samādāpayanti /
analyzed: mahā muditām mahā upekṣām vibhāvayanti parān api catur apramāṇāḥ vibhāvanāyai samādāpayanti
translated: great joy, and great equanimity. They encourage others to cultivate the four immeasurables.

original: ātmanā cāṣṭādaśāveṇikān buddhadharmān niṣpādayanti parān api aṣṭādaśāveṇikeṣu buddhadharmeṣu
analyzed: ātmanā ca aṣṭādaśa āveṇikān buddha dharmān niṣpādayanti parān api aṣṭādaśa āveṇikeṣu buddha dharmeṣu
translated: They themselves accomplish the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha, and they also cause others to take up the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha.

original: samādāpayanti / ātmanā ca sarvākārajñatām anuprāpnuvanti parāṃś ca sarvākārajñatāyāṃ
analyzed: samādāpayanti ātmanā ca sarva ākārajña tām anuprāpnuvanti parān ca sarva ākārajña tāyām
translated: They themselves attain omniscience, and they also cause others to take up omniscience.

original: samādāpayanti / ātmanā ca sarvavāsanānusaṃdhikleśān vijahanti parān api sarvavāsanānusaṃdhikleśotsargāya
analyzed: samādāpayanti ātmanā ca sarva vāsanā anusaṃdhi kleśān vijahanti parān api sarva vāsanā anusaṃdhi kleśa utsargāya
translated: They themselves abandon all afflictions along with their residues, and they also cause others to abandon all afflictions along with their residues.

original: samādāpayanti / ātmanā cānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyante parāṃś ca samyaksaṃbodhim🔽abhisaṃbodhaye samādāpayanti / ātmanā ca dharmacakraṃ pravartayanti parāṃś ca dharmacakraṃ
analyzed: samādāpayanti ātmanā ca anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyante parān ca samyaksaṃbodhim  abhisaṃbodhaye samādāpayanti ātmanā ca dharmacakram pravartayanti parān ca dharmacakram
translated: They themselves fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, and they also cause others to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: pravartanāya samādāpayanti /
analyzed: pravartanāya samādāpayanti
translated: They themselves turn the wheel of Dharma, and they also cause others to turn the wheel of Dharma.

original: iti parārthaprayogaḥ
analyzed: iti para artha prayogaḥ
translated: Thus is the application for the benefit of others.

original: evam ukte āyuṣmān subhūtir bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Subhūti said to the Blessed One:

original: āścaryaṃ bhagavann āścaryaṃ sugata yāvad bahuguṇasamanvāgatās te bodhisattvā mahāsattvā
analyzed: āścaryam bhagavan āścaryam sugata yāvat bahu guṇa samanvāgatāḥ te bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ
translated: It is wonderful, Blessed One, it is wonderful, Sugata, how much the Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas who possess these qualities are endowed with many qualities!

original: ye sarvasattvānāṃ kṛtaśaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caranti anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyante /
analyzed: ye sarva sattvānām kṛtaśas prajñāpāramitāyām caranti anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyante
translated: Those who practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of all beings attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: kathaṃ bhagavan bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ prajñāpāramitābhāvanāparipūriṃ gacchati /
analyzed: katham bhagavan bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām prajñāpāramitā bhāvanā paripūrim gacchati
translated: Subhūti said, Blessed One, how does the perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva-mahāsattvas reach completion?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: yadā subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran rūpasya vṛddhiṃ na samanupaśyati /
analyzed: yadā subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran rūpasya vṛddhim na samanupaśyati
translated: Subhūti, when a bodhisattva-mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom does not see an increase in form,

original: na vedanāyā na saṃjñāyā na saṃskārāṇāṃ /
analyzed: na vedanāyāḥ na saṃjñāyāḥ na saṃskārāṇām
translated: not in feeling, not in perception, not in volitional formations,

original: na vijñānasya vṛddhiṃ samanupaśyati /
analyzed: na vijñānasya vṛddhim samanupaśyati
translated: not in consciousness,

original: tadā bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitābhāvanāparipūriṃ gacchati /
analyzed: tadā bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitā bhāvanā paripūrim gacchati
translated: then the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva-mahāsattva reaches completion.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: yadā subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran na dhātvāyatanapratītyasamutpādapratītyasamutpādāṅgānāṃ
analyzed: yadā subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran na dhātu āyatana pratītyasamutpāda pratītyasamutpāda aṅgānām
translated: Subhūti, when a bodhisattva-mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom does not see an increase in the elements, the sense bases, dependent origination, the factors of dependent origination,

original: pāramitānāṃ saptatriṃśatāṃ bodhipakṣyāṇāṃ dharmāṇām āryasatyānām apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattīnām
analyzed: pāramitānām saptatriṃśatām bodhi pakṣyāṇām dharmāṇām ārya satyānām a pramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattīnām
translated: the perfections, the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, the noble truths, the immeasurable, concentration, and formless attainments,

original: aṣṭānāṃ vimokṣāṇāṃ navānupūrvavihārasamāpattīnāṃ śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitānāṃ saṇṇām
analyzed: aṣṭānām vimokṣāṇām nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattīnām śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihitānām saṇṇām
