translated: For the afflictions of all beings are born from the perfection of wisdom, and in the same way, in such and such a way, he will act by means🔽that no one will write this deep perfection of wisdom, will not take it up, will not master it,

original: na dhārayiṣyati na vācayiṣyati na svādhyāsyati na manasikariṣyati /
analyzed: na dhārayiṣyati na vācayiṣyati na su ādhyāsyati na manasikariṣyati
translated: will not bear it in mind, will not recite it, will not properly pay attention to it, will not make it the object of attention.

original: punar aparaṃ subhūte māraḥ pāpīyān bhikṣuveṣeṇāgatya bhedaṃ prakṣepsyati vivecayiṣyati /
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte māraḥ pāpīyān bhikṣu veṣeṇa āgatya bhedam prakṣepsyati vivecayiṣyati
translated: Furthermore, Subhuti, Mara, the Evil One, having approached in the guise of a monk, will cause division, will cause separation.🔽This is not the perfection of wisdom, as it has come down to us in the texts.

original: naiṣā prajñāpāramitā yathāsmākaṃ sūtrāntam āgatam ity asya prajñāpāramitāyāṃ likhyamānāyām
analyzed: na eṣā prajñāpāramitā yathā asmākam sūtrāntam āgatam iti asya prajñāpāramitāyām likhyamānāyām
translated: When this perfection of wisdom is being written down,

original: uddiśyamānāyāṃ paryavāpyamānāyāṃ svādhyāyamānāyāṃ yoniśo manasikriyamāṇāyāṃ bhāvyamānāyām /
analyzed: uddiśyamānāyām paryavāpyamānāyām su ādhyāyamānāyām yoniśas manasikriyamāṇāyām bhāvyamānāyām
translated: when it is being recited, studied, repeated, taken up, or contemplated,

original: idam api subhūte bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ mārakarma veditavyam /
analyzed: idam api subhūte bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām māra karma veditavyam
translated: this, Subhuti, should be known as a deed of Mara for the Bodhisattvas, the great beings.

original: punar aparaṃ subhūte māraḥ pāpīyān bhikṣuveṣeṇa bodhisattvān upasaṃkramyaivaṃ vakṣyati /
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte māraḥ pāpīyān bhikṣu veṣeṇa bodhisattvān upasaṃkramya evam vakṣyati
translated: Furthermore, Subhuti, Mara, the Evil One, having approached the Bodhisattvas in the guise of a monk, will say to them:

original: ya iha gambhīrāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carati sa bodhisattvo bhūtakoṭīṃ sākṣātkaroti /
analyzed: yaḥ iha gambhīrāyām prajñāpāramitāyām carati sa bodhisattvaḥ bhūtakoṭīm sākṣātkaroti
translated: The Bodhisattva who practices in this deep perfection of wisdom realizes the summit of reality.

original: srotaāpattiphalaṃ vā prāpnoti sakṛdāgāmiphalaṃ vā anāgāmiphalaṃ vā arhattvaṃ vā prāpnoti pratyekabodhiṃ vā prāpnoti /
analyzed: srotaāpatti phalam vā prāpnoti sakṛdāgāmi phalam vā anāgāmi phalam vā arhat tvam vā prāpnoti pratyeka bodhim vā prāpnoti
translated: He will attain the fruit of a Streamwinner, or the fruit of a Once-Returner, or the fruit of a Never-Returner, or the fruit of an Arhat, or he will attain Pratyekabuddha-enlightenment.

original: tadvacanaṃ śrutvā na prajñāpāramitāyāṃ cariṣyati /
analyzed: tad vacanam śrutvā na prajñāpāramitāyām cariṣyati
translated: Having heard these words, he will not practice in the perfection of wisdom.

original: iyam api subhūte visāmagrī bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: iyam api subhūte visāmagrī bhaviṣyati
translated: This too, Subhūti, will be a disharmony.

original: iha gambhīrāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ bhāṣyamāṇāyāṃ deśyamānāyāṃ vācyamānāyāṃ yāvad /🔽bhāvyamānāyām /
analyzed: iha gambhīrāyām prajñāpāramitāyām bhāṣyamāṇāyām deśyamānāyām vācyamānāyām yāvat  bhāvyamānāyām
translated: This also, Subhūti, will be a deed of Māra in regard to the bodhisattva mahāsattvas when this deep perfection of wisdom is being taught, being shown, being expounded, being clarified, being revealed, being expounded in detail, being made manifest.🔽This also, Subhūti, should be known as a deed of Māra to the bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

original: idam api subhūte bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ mārakarma veditavyam / iti mārasya pāpīyaso bhedaprayogaḥ
analyzed: idam api subhūte bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām māra karma veditavyam iti mārasya pāpīyasaḥ bheda prayogaḥ
translated: This is the application of Māra the wicked one to division.

original: punar aparaṃ subhūte iha gambhīrāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ likhyamānāyāṃ yāvad bhāvyamānāyāṃ bahūni mārakarmāṇy utpatsyante /
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte iha gambhīrāyām prajñāpāramitāyām likhyamānāyām yāvat bhāvyamānāyām bahūni māra karmāṇi utpatsyante
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, in this deep perfection of wisdom being written, up to being contemplated, many deeds of Māra will arise.

original: yāny antarāyakarāṇi bhaviṣyanti tāni mārakarmāṇi bodhisattvena mahāsattvena vivarjayitavyāni /
analyzed: yāni antarāya karāṇi bhaviṣyanti tāni māra karmāṇi bodhisattvena mahāsattvena vivarjayitavyāni
translated: Those deeds of Māra will be obstructive. Those deeds of Māra should be avoided by the bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: katamāni tāni bhagavan mārakarmāṇi yāni bodhisattvena mahāsattvena bodhavyāni buddhvā ca vivarjitavyāni /
analyzed: katamāni tāni bhagavat māra karmāṇi yāni bodhisattvena mahāsattvena bodhavyāni buddhvā ca vivarjitavyāni
translated: Blessed One, which are those deeds of Māra that should be known by the bodhisattva mahāsattvas, and having known, should be avoided?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: prajñāpāramitāpratirūpakāni subhūte mārakarmāṇy utpatsyante / evaṃ dhyānapāramitā vīryapāramitā kṣāntipāramitā śīlapāramitā /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā pratirūpakāni subhūte māra karmāṇi utpatsyante evam dhyāna pāramitā vīrya pāramitā kṣānti pāramitā śīla pāramitā
translated: Subhuti, there will arise deeds of Mara that are counterfeits of the perfection of wisdom, and likewise of the perfection of concentration, of energy, of patience, of morality, and of giving.

original: dānapāramitāpratirūpakāṇi mārakarmāṇy utpatsyante /
analyzed: dāna pāramitā pratirūpakāṇi māra karmāṇi utpatsyante
translated: There will arise deeds of Mara that are counterfeits of the perfection of giving.

original: yāni bodhisattvena mahāsattvena bodhavyāni buddhvā ca vivarjayitavyāni /
analyzed: yāni bodhisattvena mahāsattvena bodhavyāni buddhvā ca vivarjayitavyāni
translated: Which the Bodhisattva, the great being, should know and having known should avoid.

original: punar aparaṃ subhūte adhyātmaśūnyatāpratirūpakāṇi yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāpratirūpakāṇi mārakarmāṇy utpatsyante /
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte adhyātma śūnyatā pratirūpakāṇi yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā pratirūpakāṇi māra karmāṇi utpatsyante
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, there will arise deeds of Mara that are counterfeits of the emptiness of internal phenomena, up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence.

original: śrāvakapratyekabuddhapratisaṃyuktāni mārakarmāṇy utpatsyante /
analyzed: śrāvaka pratyekabuddha pratisaṃyuktāni māra karmāṇi utpatsyante
translated: There will arise deeds of Mara that are connected with the disciples and solitary buddhas.

original: tāni buddhvā bodhisattvena mahāsattvena mārakarmāṇi vivarjayitavyāni / evañ ca vakṣyati /
analyzed: tāni buddhvā bodhisattvena mahāsattvena māra karmāṇi vivarjayitavyāni evam ca vakṣyati
translated: Having known these deeds of Mara, the Bodhisattva, the great being, should avoid them. And he will say thus:

original: etān paryavāpnuhi etān paryavāpya ihaiva srotaāpattiphalaṃ prāpnuhi sakṛdāgāmiphalam anāgāmiphalam arhattvaṃ prāpnuhi /
analyzed: etān paryavāpnuhi etān paryavāpya iha eva srotaāpatti phalam prāpnuhi sakṛdāgāmi phalam anāgāmi phalam arhat tvam prāpnuhi
translated: Master this, having mastered this, attain the fruit of stream-entry, the fruit of once-returning, the fruit of non-returning, and arhatship right here.

original: imāny eva tvaṃ catvāri smṛtyupasthānāni bhāvaya samyakprahāṇāni bhāvaya ṛddhipādendriyabalabodhyaṅgamārgān
analyzed: imāni eva tvam catvāri smṛti upasthānāni bhāvaya samyakprahāṇāni bhāvaya ṛddhipāda indriya bala bodhyaṅga mārgān
translated: You should cultivate these four establishments of mindfulness, you should cultivate the right efforts, the bases of supernatural power, the faculties, the powers, the factors of awakening, and the path.

original: bhāvaya śūnyatāvimokṣamukham ānimittavimokṣamukham apraṇihitavimokṣamukhaṃ bhāvaya
analyzed: bhāvaya śūnyatā vimokṣa mukham ānimitta vimokṣa mukham apraṇihita vimokṣa mukham bhāvaya
translated: You should cultivate the emptiness gate of liberation, the signless gate of liberation, and the wishless gate of liberation.

original: kiṃ te 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhuṃ /
analyzed: kim te nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhum
translated: What do you want to fully awaken to unsurpassed true and complete enlightenment for?

original: iyam api subhūte visāmagrī bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: iyam api subhūte visāmagrī bhaviṣyati
translated: This, Subhūti, will be a disharmony.

original: iha gambhīrāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ likhyamānāyām udgṛhyamāṇāyāṃ yāvan manasikriyamāṇāyāṃ
analyzed: iha gambhīrāyām prajñāpāramitāyām likhyamānāyām udgṛhyamāṇāyām yāvat manasikriyamāṇāyām
translated: This, Subhūti, is a disharmony regarding the profound perfection of wisdom, when it is being written, being taken up, being borne in mind, being recited, being contemplated,

original: bhāvyamānāyāṃ māraḥ pāpīyān evaṃrūpāṇi mārakarmāṇi upasaṃhariṣyati / iti prativarṇikopasaṃhāraḥ
analyzed: bhāvyamānāyām māraḥ pāpīyān evaṃrūpāṇi māra karmāṇi upasaṃhariṣyati iti prativarṇika upasaṃhāraḥ
translated: being meditated upon, Māra the evil one will bring about such kinds of Māra's actions. This is the bringing about of a counterfeit.

original: punar aparaṃ subhūte māraḥ pāpīyān buddhaveṣeṇopasaṃkramiṣyati /
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte māraḥ pāpīyān buddha veṣeṇa upasaṃkramiṣyati
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, Māra the evil one will approach in the guise of a Buddha.

original: suvarṇavarṇakāyena vyāmaprabhāṃ kṛtvā tatra bodhisattvas taṃ dṛṣṭvā spṛhām utpādya sarvajñatāyāḥ parihāsyati /
analyzed: suvarṇa varṇa kāyena vyāma prabhām kṛtvā tatra bodhisattvaḥ tam dṛṣṭvā spṛhām utpādya sarvajña tāyāḥ parihāsyati
translated: Having made his body golden in color and his radiance extend a fathom, there the bodhisattva, having seen that, will produce longing and will fall away from omniscience.

original: iyam api subhūte visāmagrī bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: iyam api subhūte visāmagrī bhaviṣyati
translated: This, Subhūti, will be a disharmony.

original: iha gambhīrāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ likhyamānāyām uddiśyamānāyāṃ svādhyāyamānāyāṃ bhāṣyamāṇāyāṃ yoniśo manasikriyamāṇāyāṃ bhāvyamānāyām /
analyzed: iha gambhīrāyām prajñāpāramitāyām likhyamānāyām uddiśyamānāyām su ādhyāyamānāyām bhāṣyamāṇāyām yoniśas manasikriyamāṇāyām bhāvyamānāyām
translated: Here, when the profound perfection of wisdom is being written, being recited, being studied, being explained, being contemplated, being meditated upon,

original: idam api subhūte bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ mārakarma veditavyam /
analyzed: idam api subhūte bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām māra karma veditavyam
translated: this should also be known by the bodhisattva great beings as the work of Māra.

original: punar aparaṃ subhūte māraḥ pāpīyāṃs teṣāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṛṇāṃ ca purato buddhapramukhaṃ bhikṣusaṃgham upadarśayiṣyati /🔽sa tatra bodhisattvaḥ spṛhām utpādayiṣyati /
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte māraḥ pāpīyān teṣām kula putrāṇām kula duhitṛṇām ca puratas buddha pramukham bhikṣu saṃgham upadarśayiṣyati  sa tatra bodhisattvaḥ spṛhām utpādayiṣyati
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, Māra the wicked one will manifest the Buddha at the head of the community of monks in front of those sons and daughters of good family.

original: aham apy anāgate 'dhvany evaṃrūpas tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ syām /
analyzed: aham api anāgate dhvani evaṃrūpaḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ syām
translated: There the bodhisattva will arouse longing, thinking, 'In the future, may I also become a thus-gone one, a worthy one, a perfectly enlightened one like that.

original: evaṃ ca bhikṣugaṇaṃ parikarṣeyaṃ yathā yaṃ tathāgato dharmaṃ deśayati tathaivāham api dharmaṃ deśayeyaṃ /
analyzed: evam ca bhikṣu gaṇam parikarṣeyam yathā yam tathāgataḥ dharmam deśayati tathā eva aham api dharmam deśayeyam
translated: May I lead a community of monks just as the thus-gone one does. Just as the thus-gone one teaches the Dharma, may I also teach the Dharma in the same way.'

original: sa tatra spṛhām utpādayiṣyati spṛhām utpādya sarvajñatāyāḥ parihāsyati /
analyzed: sa tatra spṛhām utpādayiṣyati spṛhām utpādya sarvajña tāyāḥ parihāsyati
translated: There he will arouse longing, and having aroused longing, he will fall away from omniscience.

original: iyam api subhūte visāmagrī bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: iyam api subhūte visāmagrī bhaviṣyati
translated: This too, Subhūti, will be a cause of incompleteness.

original: iha gambhīrāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ likhyamānāyām uddiśyamānāyāṃ paryavāpyamānāyāṃ bhāṣyamāṇāyāṃ manasikriyamāṇāyāṃ bhāvyamānāyām /
analyzed: iha gambhīrāyām prajñāpāramitāyām likhyamānāyām uddiśyamānāyām paryavāpyamānāyām bhāṣyamāṇāyām manasikriyamāṇāyām bhāvyamānāyām
translated: Here, when the profound perfection of wisdom is being written, being recited, being mastered, being taught, being attended to in the mind, being meditated upon,

original: idam api subhūte bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ mārakarma veditavyam /
analyzed: idam api subhūte bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām māra karma veditavyam
translated: this should also be known by the bodhisattva mahāsattvas as the work of Māra.

original: punar aparaṃ subhūte māraḥ pāpīyān anekāni bodhisattvaśatāni anekāni bodhisattvasahasrāṇi upadarśayati /
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte māraḥ pāpīyān anekāni bodhisattva śatāni anekāni bodhisattva sahasrāṇi upadarśayati
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, Māra the evil one displays many hundreds of bodhisattvas, many thousands of bodhisattvas,

original: ye dānapāramitāyāṃ cariṣyanti /
analyzed: ye dāna pāramitāyām cariṣyanti
translated: who will practice the perfection of giving.

original: evaṃ śīlapāramitāyāṃ kṣāntipāramitāyāṃ vīryapāramitāyāṃ dhyānapāramitāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ cariṣyanti /
analyzed: evam śīla pāramitāyām kṣānti pāramitāyām vīrya pāramitāyām dhyāna pāramitāyām prajñāpāramitāyām cariṣyanti
translated: In the same way, they will practice the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: te bodhisattvās teṣāṃ māranirmitānām antike spṛhām utpādayiṣyanti spṛhām utpādya sarvajñatāyāḥ parihāsyanti /
analyzed: te bodhisattvāḥ teṣām māra nirmitānām antike spṛhām utpādayiṣyanti spṛhām utpādya sarvajña tāyāḥ parihāsyanti
translated: Those bodhisattvas will develop longing in the presence of those emanations of Māra, and having developed longing, they will fall away from omniscience.

original: iyam api subhūte visāmagrī bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: iyam api subhūte visāmagrī bhaviṣyati
translated: This, Subhūti, will be a lack of harmony.

original: iha gambhīrāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ likhyamānāyām uddiśyamānāyāṃ svādhyāyamānāyāṃ yoniśo manasikriyamāṇāyāṃ bhāvyamānāyām /
analyzed: iha gambhīrāyām prajñāpāramitāyām likhyamānāyām uddiśyamānāyām su ādhyāyamānāyām yoniśas manasikriyamāṇāyām bhāvyamānāyām
translated: Here, when this profound perfection of wisdom is being written, being recited, being studied, being contemplated, being meditated upon,

original: idam api subhūte bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ mārakarma veditavyam / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: idam api subhūte bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām māra karma veditavyam tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: this should also be known by the bodhisattva mahāsattvas as the work of Māra. Why is that?

original: na hīha subhūte gambhīrāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ rūpaṃ saṃvidyate /🔽na vedanā na saṃjñā na saṃskārāḥ /
analyzed: na hi iha subhūte gambhīrāyām prajñāpāramitāyām rūpam saṃvidyate  na vedanā na saṃjñā na saṃskārāḥ
translated: Subhūti, form does not exist in this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: na vijñānaṃ saṃvidyate /
analyzed: na vijñānam saṃvidyate
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness do not exist.

original: na skandhā na dhātavo nāyatanāni na pratītyasamutpādo na pratītyasamutpādāṅgāni saṃvidyante /
analyzed: na skandhāḥ na dhātavaḥ na āyatanāni na pratītyasamutpādaḥ na pratītyasamutpāda aṅgāni saṃvidyante
translated: The aggregates, elements, sense fields, dependent origination, and the factors of dependent origination do not exist.

original: na pāramitā na bodhipakṣyā dharmā nāryasatyāni nāpramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattayaḥ nāṣṭavimokṣā na navānupūrvavihārasamāpattayaḥ na śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitābhijñāḥ
analyzed: na pāramitā na bodhi pakṣyāḥ dharmāḥ na ārya satyāni na apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattayaḥ na aṣṭa vimokṣāḥ na nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattayaḥ na śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita abhijñāḥ
translated: The perfections, factors of awakening, noble truths, immeasurable, concentrations, formless attainments, eight liberations, nine serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness

original: na sarvaśūnyatā na sarvasamādhayaḥ na sarvadhāraṇīmukhāni saṃvidyante /
analyzed: na sarva śūnyatā na sarva samādhayaḥ na sarva dhāraṇīmukhāni saṃvidyante
translated: all emptinesses, all concentrations, and all dhāraṇī gateways do not exist.

original: na tathāgatabalāni na vaiśāradyāni na pratisaṃvido nāveṇikabuddhadharmā na vimokṣamukhāni na bodhiḥ saṃvidyate /
analyzed: na tathāgata balāni na vaiśāradyāni na pratisaṃvidaḥ na āveṇika buddha dharmāḥ na vimokṣa mukhāni na bodhiḥ saṃvidyate
translated: The powers of the Tathāgata, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, the attributes exclusive to a buddha, the doors of liberation, and enlightenment are not found.

original: yatra ca subhūte na rūpaṃ saṃvidyate /
analyzed: yatra ca subhūte na rūpam saṃvidyate
translated: Subhūti, where form is not found,

original: na vedanā na saṃjñā na saṃskārā na vijñānaṃ saṃvidyate /
analyzed: na vedanā na saṃjñā na saṃskārāḥ na vijñānam saṃvidyate
translated: feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not found.

original: na skandhā na dhātavo nāyatanāni na pratītyasamutpādo na pratītyasamutpādāṅgāni na
analyzed: na skandhāḥ na dhātavaḥ na āyatanāni na pratītyasamutpādaḥ na pratītyasamutpāda aṅgāni na
translated: The aggregates, constituents, sense fields, dependent origination, the factors of dependent origination,

original: pāramitā na bodhipakṣyā dharmā nāryasatyāni nāpramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattayo nāṣṭavimokṣā
analyzed: pāramitā na bodhi pakṣyāḥ dharmāḥ na ārya satyāni na apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattayaḥ na aṣṭa vimokṣā
translated: the perfections, the factors of awakening, the noble truths, the immeasurables, concentrations, and formless absorptions, the eight liberations,

original: na navānupūrvavihārasamāpattayo na śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitābhijñā na sarvaśūnyatā
analyzed: na nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattayaḥ na śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihitā abhijñāḥ na sarva śūnyatā
translated: the nine serial absorptions, the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness doors of liberation, all emptinesses,

original: na sarvasamādhayo na /
analyzed: na sarva samādhayaḥ na
translated: all meditative stabilizations,

original: sarvadhāraṇīmukhāni na tathāgatabalāni na vaiśāradyāni na pratisaṃvido nāveṇikabuddhadharmā na vimokṣamukhāni na bodhiḥ saṃvidyate /
analyzed: sarva dhāraṇī mukhāni na tathāgata balāni na vaiśāradyāni na pratisaṃvidaḥ na āveṇika buddha dharmāḥ na vimokṣa mukhāni na bodhiḥ saṃvidyate
translated: all dhāraṇī gateways, the powers of the Tathāgata, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, the attributes exclusive to a buddha, the doors of liberation, and enlightenment are not found.

original: yatra na bodhir na tatra buddho na bodhisattvā na śrāvakāḥ saṃvidyante / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: yatra na bodhiḥ na tatra buddhaḥ na bodhisattvāḥ na śrāvakāḥ saṃvidyante tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Where there is no enlightenment, there is no Buddha, no Bodhisattvas, and no Disciples. Why is that?

original: svabhāvaśūnyā hi subhūte sarvadharmāḥ /
analyzed: svabhāva śūnyāḥ hi subhūte sarva dharmāḥ
translated: Subhuti, all dharmas are empty of their own-being.

original: ity ayathāviṣayādispṛhotpādaḥ
analyzed: iti ayathā viṣaya ādi spṛhā utpādaḥ
translated: Thus, this is the arising of desire for what is not the object, etc.

original: punar aparaṃ subhūte bahvantarāyeyaṃ prajñāpāramitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte bahu antarāyā iyam prajñāpāramitā bhaviṣyati
translated: Furthermore, Subhuti, this perfection of wisdom will be beset by many obstacles.

original: teṣāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṛṇāṃ ca imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ dhārayatāṃ vācayatām uddiśatāṃ svādhyāyatāṃ yoniśo manasikurvatāṃ / tadyathāpi nāma
analyzed: teṣām kula putrāṇām kula duhitṛṇām ca imām prajñāpāramitām dhārayatām vācayatām uddiśatām su ādhyāyatām yoniśas manasikurvatām tat yathā api nāma
translated: For those sons and daughters of good family who are upholding, reading, reciting, teaching, and properly paying attention to this perfection of wisdom, just as

original: subhūte yāni jāmbūdvīpakāni ratnāni /
analyzed: subhūte yāni jāmbūdvīpakāni ratnāni
translated: Subhuti, the jewels in Jambudvipa,

original: yad uta suvarṇamaṇimuktāvaiḍūryaśaṅkhaśilāpravāḍarajatādīni bahvantarāyāṇi bahupratyarthikāni🔽bhaviṣyanti / evam etat subhūte teṣāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṛṇāṃ cāsyāṃ gambhīrāyāṃ
analyzed: yat uta suvarṇa maṇi muktā vaiḍūrya śaṅkha śilā pravāḍa rajata ādīni bahu antarāyāṇi bahu pratyarthikāni  bhaviṣyanti evam etat subhūte teṣām kula putrāṇām kula duhitṛṇām ca asyām gambhīrāyām
translated: namely gold, jewels, pearls, beryl, conch-shells, quartz, coral, silver, and so on, will be beset by many obstacles, by many adversaries.

original: prajñāpāramitāyāṃ likhyamānāyām uddiśyamānāyāṃ paryavāpyamānāyāṃ svādhyāyamānāyāṃ
analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyām likhyamānāyām uddiśyamānāyām paryavāpyamānāyām su ādhyāyamānāyām
translated: Just so, Subhuti, for those sons and daughters of good family who are writing out, taking up, reciting, teaching, and properly paying attention to this deep perfection of wisdom,

original: bhāṣyamāṇāyāṃ yoniśo manasikriyamāṇāyāṃ bhāvyamānāyāṃ bahavo 'ntarāyā bhaviṣyanti
analyzed: bhāṣyamāṇāyām yoniśas manasikriyamāṇāyām bhāvyamānāyām bahavaḥ ntarāyāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: When it is being taught, when it is being properly attended to in the mind, when it is being cultivated, there will be many obstacles

original: bahavaḥ pratyarthikāḥ /
analyzed: bahavaḥ pratyarthikāḥ
translated: and many opponents.

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhuti said:

original: evam etad bhagavann evam etat sugata /
analyzed: evam etat bhagavan evam etat sugata
translated: So it is, Blessed One, so it is, Well-Gone!

original: bahupratyarthikāni bhaviṣyanti prajñāpāramitāpratisaṃyuktāni sūtrāṇi /
analyzed: bahu pratyarthikāni bhaviṣyanti prajñāpāramitā pratisaṃyuktāni sūtrāṇi
translated: Those sutras connected with the perfection of wisdom will have many opponents.

original: mārādhiṣṭhitās te mohapuruṣā bhaviṣyanti /🔽ya imāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ likhatām uddiśatāṃ svādhyāyatāṃ bhāvayatām antarāyaṃ kariṣyanti / alpabuddhayas te bhagavan mohapuruṣā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: māra dhiṣṭhitāḥ te moha puruṣāḥ bhaviṣyanti  ye imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām likhatām uddiśatām su ādhyāyatām bhāvayatām antarāyam kariṣyanti alpabuddhayaḥ te bhagavat moha puruṣāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Those deluded people who will create obstacles for those who are writing, teaching, reciting, or meditating on this profound perfection of wisdom will be possessed by Mara.🔽Those deluded people, Blessed One, who will create obstacles for this profound perfection of wisdom when it is being written, taught, recited, or contemplated, will have little wisdom, Blessed One.

original: mandabuddhayo ye 'syāṃ gambhīrāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ likhyamānāyāṃ yāvad bhāvyamānāyām antarāyaṃ kariṣyanti / na teṣām udārodāreṣu dharmeṣu
analyzed: manda buddhayaḥ ye syām gambhīrāyām prajñāpāramitāyām likhyamānāyām yāvat bhāvyamānāyām antarāyam kariṣyanti na teṣām udāra udāreṣu dharmeṣu
translated: Those with little wisdom will create obstacles for this profound perfection of wisdom when it is being written, taught, recited, or contemplated. They will not have the opportunity to practice the vast and sublime dharmas.

original: ya imāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitān na likhiṣyanti likhyamānāyām antarāyaṃ kariṣyanti yāvan na bhāvayiṣyanti bhāvyamānāyāñ cāntarāyaṃ kariṣyanti /
analyzed: ye imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitāt na likhiṣyanti likhyamānāyām antarāyam kariṣyanti yāvat na bhāvayiṣyanti bhāvyamānāyām ca antarāyam kariṣyanti
translated: Those who will not write this profound perfection of wisdom, will create obstacles to its being written, and will not contemplate it, and will create obstacles to its being contemplated.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: evam etat subhūte evam etat mārādhiṣṭhitās te kulaputrāḥ kuladuhitaraś ca bhaviṣyanti
analyzed: evam etat subhūte evam etat māra dhiṣṭhitāḥ te kula putrāḥ kula duhitaraḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: It is so, Subhuti, it is so. Those sons and daughters of good family will be possessed by Mara.

original: navayānasaṃprasthitā anavaropitakuśalamūlāḥ parīttakuśalamūlāḥ na pūrvajinakṛtādhikārā
analyzed: nava yāna saṃprasthitāḥ an avaropita kuśala mūlāḥ parītta kuśala mūlāḥ na pūrva jina kṛta adhikārā
translated: They will be newly set out in the vehicle, will not have planted wholesome roots, will have few wholesome roots, will not have attended to former Buddhas,🔽will not have completed wholesome actions, will not have fulfilled their duties under former Jinas,

original: aparigṛhītakalyāṇamitrā /
analyzed: a parigṛhīta kalyāṇa mitrā
translated: will not have been taken hold of by good spiritual friends.

original: ya imāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ na likhiṣyanti na vācayiṣyanti noddekṣyanti na svādhyāsyanti na yoniśo manasikariṣyanti /
analyzed: ye imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām na likhiṣyanti na vācayiṣyanti na uddekṣyanti na su ādhyāsyanti na yoniśas manasikariṣyanti
translated: Those who will not write this profound perfection of wisdom, will not recite it, will not teach it, will not clearly articulate it, will not properly pay attention to it,

original: ye 'ntarāyaṃ kariṣyanti /
analyzed: ye ntarāyam kariṣyanti
translated: and will create obstacles to it.

original: alpabuddhikās te kulaputrāḥ kuladuhitaraś ca mandabuddhikāḥ parīttabuddhikā /
analyzed: alpabuddhikāḥ te kula putrāḥ kula duhitaraḥ ca manda buddhikāḥ parītta buddhikā
translated: Those sons and daughters of good family will be of little intelligence, of dull intelligence, of limited intelligence.

original: na ca teṣām udārodāreṣu dharmeṣu cittaṃ kramiṣyati /
analyzed: na ca teṣām udāra udāreṣu dharmeṣu cittam kramiṣyati
translated: And their minds will not progress in the vast and extensive teachings.

original: ya imāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ na /
analyzed: yaḥ imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām na
translated: Those who will not write this profound perfection of wisdom, will not recite it, will not teach it, will not clearly articulate it, will not properly pay attention to it,🔽and will create obstacles to it.

original: likhiṣyanti na dhārayiṣyanti noddekṣyanti na svādhyāsyanti na yoniśo manasikariṣyanti yāvan na bhāvayiṣyanti /
analyzed: likhiṣyanti na dhārayiṣyanti na uddekṣyanti na su ādhyāsyanti na yoniśas manasikariṣyanti yāvat na bhāvayiṣyanti
translated: They will not write it, will not bear it in mind, will not recite it, will not meditate on it, will not wisely attend to it, and will not cultivate it.

original: anyeṣāñ ca likhatāṃ yāvad bhāvayatām antarāyaṃ kariṣyanti /
analyzed: anyeṣām ca likhatām yāvat bhāvayatām antarāyam kariṣyanti
translated: And they will create obstacles for others who are writing, up to cultivating it.

original: kiñ cāpi subhūte iha gambhīrāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ likhyamānāyāṃ yāvad bhāvyamānāyām imāni mārakarmāṇy utpatsyante /🔽sacet punaḥ subhūte yad imāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṛṇāṃ ca likhatāṃ svādhyāyatām uddiśatāṃ yoniśo manasikurvatāṃ
analyzed: kim ca api subhūte iha gambhīrāyām prajñāpāramitāyām likhyamānāyām yāvat bhāvyamānāyām imāni māra karmāṇi utpatsyante  saced punar subhūte yat imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām kula putrāṇām kula duhitṛṇām ca likhatām su ādhyāyatām uddiśatām yoniśas manasikurvatām
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, even if these deeds of Māra arise when this profound perfection of wisdom is being written, up to cultivated,🔽if, Subhūti, these deeds of Māra do not arise for those sons of good family and daughters of good family who are writing, reciting, teaching, wisely attending to,

original: bhāvayatāṃ mārakarmāṇi notpatsyante /
analyzed: bhāvayatām māra karmāṇi na utpatsyante
translated: and cultivating this profound perfection of wisdom,

original: uttare ca dhyānapāramitāṃ paripūrayiṣyanti /
analyzed: uttare ca dhyāna pāramitām paripūrayiṣyanti
translated: and they will fulfill the perfection of meditation to a higher degree,

original: vīryapāramitāṃ kṣāntipāramitāṃ śīlapāramitāṃ dānapāramitāṃ paripūrayiṣyanti /
analyzed: vīrya pāramitām kṣānti pāramitām śīla pāramitām dāna pāramitām paripūrayiṣyanti
translated: they will fulfill the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of giving.

original: sarvaśūnyatāḥ saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣān dharmān paripūrayiṣyanti /
analyzed: sarva śūnyatāḥ saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣān dharmān paripūrayiṣyanti
translated: They will fulfill all the emptinesses and the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: sarvasamādhidhāraṇīvimokṣamukhāni apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattīḥ pañcābhijñā daśabodhisattvabhūmīr
analyzed: sarva samādhi dhāraṇī vimokṣa mukhāni apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattīḥ pañca abhijñāḥ daśa bodhisattva bhūmīḥ
translated: the doors of concentration, retention, and liberation, the immeasurables, the dhyānas, the formless attainments, the five superknowledges, the ten bodhisattva stages,

original: balāni vaiśāradyāni pratisaṃvida āveṇikabuddhadharmān yāvat sarvajñatāṃ paripūrayiṣyanti /
analyzed: balāni vaiśāradyāni pratisaṃvidaḥ āveṇika buddha dharmān yāvat sarvajña tām paripūrayiṣyanti
translated: the powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, the exclusive buddha qualities, up to the complete buddha knowledges.🔽Subhūti, it should be known that this is the power of the buddhas,

original: veditavyam idaṃ subhūte buddhānubhāva eṣa yenaiṣāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṛṇāṃ ca
analyzed: veditavyam idam subhūte buddha anubhāvaḥ eṣa yena eṣām kula putrāṇām kula duhitṛṇām ca
translated: by which these sons and daughters of good family,

original: imāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ likhatāṃ vācayatām uddiśatāṃ svādhyāyatāṃ yoniśo manasikurvatāṃ
analyzed: imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām likhatām vācayatām uddiśatām su ādhyāyatām yoniśas manasikurvatām
translated: when they write out, recite, explain, study, and properly pay attention to this deep perfection of wisdom,

original: nāntarāyā utpatsyante /
analyzed: na antarāyāḥ utpatsyante
translated: no obstacles will arise.

original: uttare ca sarvāḥ pāramitāḥ paripūrayiṣyanti /
analyzed: uttare ca sarvāḥ pāramitāḥ paripūrayiṣyanti
translated: And they will complete all the perfections higher up.

original: sarvaśūnyatāḥ sarvabodhipakṣyān dharmān sarvasamādhīn sarvadhāraṇīmukhāni sarvavimokṣamukhāni paripūrayiṣyanti /
analyzed: sarva śūnyatāḥ sarva bodhi pakṣyān dharmān sarva samādhīn sarva dhāraṇī mukhāni sarva vimokṣa mukhāni paripūrayiṣyanti
translated: They will complete all the emptinesses, all the dharmas on the side of awakening, all the concentrations, all the doors of retention, all the doors of liberation,

original: catvāri dhyānāni catvāry apramāṇāni catasra ārūpyasamāpattīḥ pañcābhijñāḥ paripūrayiṣyanti /
analyzed: catvāri dhyānāni catvāri apramāṇāni catasraḥ ārūpya samāpattīḥ pañca abhijñāḥ paripūrayiṣyanti
translated: the four dhyānas, the four immeasurables, the four formless attainments, and the five superknowledges.

original: daśa bodhisattvabhūmīḥ paripūrayiṣyanti /
analyzed: daśa bodhisattva bhūmīḥ paripūrayiṣyanti
translated: They will complete the ten bodhisattva stages.

original: daśa tathāgatabalāni catvāri vaiśāradyāni catasraḥ pratisaṃvido 'ṣṭādaśāveṇikān buddhadharmān paripūrayiṣyanti /
analyzed: daśa tathāgata balāni catvāri vaiśāradyāni catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ ṣṭādaśa āveṇikān buddha dharmān paripūrayiṣyanti
translated: They will perfect the ten powers of the Tathāgata, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.🔽They will perfect omniscience.

original: sarvākārajñatāṃ paripūrayiṣyanti / ye 'pi te daśasu dikṣu buddhā bhagavantas tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti dharmañ ca deśayanti /🔽te 'pi teṣāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṛṇāṃ ca kṛtaśa udyogam āpatsyante /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tām paripūrayiṣyanti ye pi te daśasu dikṣu buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti dharmam ca deśayanti  te pi teṣām kula putrāṇām kula duhitṛṇām ca kṛtaśas udyogam āpatsyante
translated: Those Blessed Buddhas who are present, supporting themselves, and teaching the Dharma in the ten directions,

original: imāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ likhatāṃ vācayatāṃ svādhyāyatāṃ yoniśo manasikurvatāṃ /
analyzed: imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām likhatām vācayatām su ādhyāyatām yoniśas manasikurvatām
translated: they too will make an effort for those sons of good family and daughters of good family who are writing, reading aloud, reciting, and properly paying attention to this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: ye 'pi te daśasu dikṣu avinivartanīyā bodhisattvās te 'pi teṣāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṛṇāṃ
analyzed: ye pi te daśasu dikṣu a vinivartanīyāḥ bodhisattvāḥ te pi teṣām kula putrāṇām kula duhitṛṇām
translated: Those irreversible bodhisattvas who are in the ten directions, they too will make an effort for those sons of good family and daughters of good family

original: ca imāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ likhatāṃ vācayatām uddiśatāṃ svādhyāyatāṃ yoniśo
analyzed: ca imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām likhatām vācayatām uddiśatām su ādhyāyatām yoniśas
translated: who are writing, reading aloud, reciting, and properly paying attention to this deep perfection of wisdom,

original: manasikurvatāṃ bhāvayatām udyogam āpatsyante anuparigrahīṣyanti /
analyzed: manasikurvatām bhāvayatām udyogam āpatsyante anuparigrahīṣyanti
translated: and will take them up.

original: tadyathāpi nāma subhūte striyāḥ kasyāścid eva bahavaḥ putrā bhaveyuḥ /🔽pañca vā daśa vā /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma subhūte striyāḥ kasyāścid eva bahavaḥ putrāḥ bhaveyuḥ  pañca vā daśa vā
translated: For example, Subhūti, a woman might have many sons,

original: viṃśatir vā triṃśad vā catvāriṃśad vā pañcāśad vā śataṃ vā sahasraṃ vā śatasahasraṃ vā /🔽te 'syā mātur glānāyāḥ sarve 'py udyogam āpadyeran /
analyzed: viṃśatiḥ vā triṃśat vā catvāriṃśat vā pañcāśat vā śatam vā sahasram vā śata sahasram vā  te syāḥ mātuḥ glānāyāḥ sarve pi udyogam āpadyeran
translated: five, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, a hundred, a thousand, a hundred thousand.🔽If that mother of theirs were to become sick,

original: kim ity asmākaṃ mātur antarāyo na bhavet /
analyzed: kim iti asmākam mātuḥ antarāyaḥ na bhavet
translated: they would all make an effort, thinking, 'How can there be no obstacle for our mother?

original: kim ity asmākaṃ mātā ciraṃ jīvet /
analyzed: kim iti asmākam mātā ciram jīvet
translated: How can our mother live long?

original: kim ity asmākaṃ mātuḥ śarīre amanaāpaḥ sparśo na nipated /
analyzed: kim iti asmākam mātuḥ śarīre amanaāpaḥ sparśaḥ na nipatet
translated: How can unpleasant touch not fall on our mother's body?'

original: eṣāsmākaṃ jananī śarīrasya dātrī jīvitasya dhātrī /
analyzed: eṣā asmākam jananī śarīrasya dātrī jīvitasya dhātrī
translated: 'This is our mother, the giver of our body, the nurse of our life.'

original: te tāṃ mātaram upasthitām upatiṣṭheran sugopitāṃ gopāyeyur /
analyzed: te tām mātaram upasthitām upatiṣṭheran su gopitām gopāyeyuḥ
translated: They would attend on that mother who is being attended to, they would protect her who is well protected.

original: mā bhūd asyā jīvitāntarāyo vā śarīradaurbalyaṃ vā daṃśamaśakasarīsṛpopanipāto vā śītoṣṇakṣutpipāsādi duṣkhaṃ vā /
analyzed: mā bhūt asyāḥ jīvita antarāyaḥ vā śarīra daurbalyam vā daṃśa maśaka sarīsṛpa upanipātaḥ vā śīta uṣṇa kṣudh pipāsā ādi duṣkham vā
translated: 'Let there be no obstacle to her life, or weakness of the body, or falling of mosquitoes, flies, and reptiles, or suffering from cold, heat, hunger, thirst, etc.'

original: evan te putrās tasyā mātuḥ sarvasukhopadhānāny upasaṃhareyuḥ /
analyzed: evam te putrāḥ tasyāḥ mātuḥ sarva sukha upadhānāni upasaṃhareyuḥ
translated: In this way, those sons would provide all the means of happiness for that mother.

original: evan te tāṃ mātaraṃ sukelāyitāṃ kelāyeyur mimīyur eṣāsmākam asya lokasya darśayitrī / evam eva subhūte tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ /
analyzed: evam te tām mātaram su kelāyitām kelāyeyuḥ mimīyuḥ eṣā asmākam asya lokasya darśayitrī evam eva subhūte tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: In this way, they would make that mother of theirs, who is well-cared for, well-cared for, and would measure her, thinking, 'She is the one who shows us this world.' In just the same way, Subhūti, the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones,

original: imāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ buddhacakṣuṣā satatasamitaṃ samanvāharanti / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām buddha cakṣuṣā satata samitam samanvāharanti tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: constantly and always attend to this deep perfection of wisdom with the Buddha-eye. Why is that?

original: eṣā hi gambhīrā prajñāpāramitāsmākaṃ sarvabuddhadharmāṇāṃ jananī jñānālokasya kārikā /
analyzed: eṣā hi gambhīrā prajñāpāramitā asmākam sarva buddha dharmāṇām jananī jñāna ālokasya kārikā
translated: Because this deep perfection of wisdom is the mother of all our Buddha-dharmas, the cause of the light of knowledge.

original: ye 'pi te daśasu dikṣu gaṅgānadīvālukopameṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhā bhagavantas tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti /
analyzed: ye pi te daśasu dikṣu gaṅgā nadī vālukā upameṣu lokadhātuṣu buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti
translated: And those Blessed Buddhas who are in the world-realms in the ten directions, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river,

original: te 'pīmām eva prajñāpāramitāṃ buddhacakṣuṣā satatasamitaṃ samanvāharanti / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: te pi imām eva prajñāpāramitām buddha cakṣuṣā satata samitam samanvāharanti tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: they too constantly and always attend to this very perfection of wisdom with the Buddha-eye. Why is that?

original: eṣā hi gambhīrā prajñāpāramitā jananī tathāgatānām /
analyzed: eṣā hi gambhīrā prajñāpāramitā jananī tathāgatānām
translated: Because this deep perfection of wisdom is the mother of the Tathāgatas,

original: asya ca sarvajñajñānasya saṃdarśayitrī /
analyzed: asya ca sarvajña jñānasya saṃdarśayitrī
translated: and it is the one who shows this knowledge of the Omniscient One.

original: tena tathāgatāḥ kṛtajñatām upādāya ye imāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ buddhacakṣuṣā satatasamitaṃ samanvāharanti / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tena tathāgatāḥ kṛtajña tām upādāya ye imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām buddha cakṣuṣā satata samitam samanvāharanti tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgatas, out of gratitude, constantly and always attend to this profound perfection of wisdom with the eye of the Tathāgata. Why is that?

original: ato nirjātā hi tathāgatānāṃ dhyānavīryakṣāntiśīladānapāramitā /
analyzed: atas nirjātā hi tathāgatānām dhyāna vīrya kṣānti śīla dāna pāramitā
translated: Because from this come the Tathāgatas' perfection of meditation, perfection of energy, perfection of patience, perfection of morality, and perfection of giving.

original: ato nirjātā hi tathāgatānām adhyātmaśūnyatā yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatā /
analyzed: atas nirjātā hi tathāgatānām adhyātma śūnyatā yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā
translated: Because from this come the Tathāgatas' inner emptiness up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: ato nirjātāni catvāri smṛtyupasthānāni catvāri samyakprahāṇāni catvāra ṛddhipādāḥ pañcendriyāṇi pañcabalāni saptabodhyaṅgāni āryāṣṭāṅgo mārgaḥ /
analyzed: atas nirjātāni catvāri smṛti upasthānāni catvāri samyakprahāṇāni catvāraḥ ṛddhipādāḥ pañca indriyāṇi pañca balāni sapta bodhyaṅgāni ārya aṣṭāṅgaḥ mārgaḥ
translated: Because from this come the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of supernatural power, the five faculties, the five strengths, the seven factors of awakening, and the noble eightfold path.

original: ato nirjātāni trīṇi vimokṣamukhāni /
analyzed: atas nirjātāni trīṇi vimokṣa mukhāni
translated: Because from this come the three gateways to liberation.

original: ato nirjātāni catvāry āryasatyāni /
analyzed: atas nirjātāni catvāri ārya satyāni
translated: Because from this come the four noble truths.

original: ato nirjātāni catvāri dhyānāni catvāry apramāṇāni catasra ārūpyasamāpattayo /
analyzed: atas nirjātāni catvāri dhyānāni catvāri apramāṇāni catasraḥ ārūpya samāpattayaḥ
translated: Because from this come the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, and the four formless absorptions.

original: ato nirjātā aṣṭau vimokṣā navānupūrvavihārasamāpattayaḥ /
analyzed: atas nirjātāḥ aṣṭau vimokṣāḥ nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattayaḥ
translated: Because from this come the eight liberations and the nine successive meditative absorptions.

original: ato nirjātāḥ sarvasamādhayaḥ sarvadhāraṇīmukhāni /
analyzed: atas nirjātāḥ sarva samādhayaḥ sarva dhāraṇīmukhāni
translated: Because from this come all meditative absorptions and all dhāraṇī gateways.

original: ato nirjātāni daśatathāgatabalāni catvāri vaiśāradyāni catasraḥ pratisaṃvido 'ṣṭādaśāveṇikā buddhadharmāḥ /
analyzed: atas nirjātāni daśa tathāgata balāni catvāri vaiśāradyāni catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ ṣṭādaśa āveṇikāḥ buddha dharmāḥ
translated: From this are born the ten powers of the Tathāgata, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: ato nirjātāḥ ṣaḍabhijñāḥ /
analyzed: atas nirjātāḥ ṣaḍabhijñāḥ
translated: From this are born the six superknowledges.

original: ato nirjātā sarvabuddhānāṃ sarvākārajñatā /
analyzed: atas nirjātā sarva buddhānām sarva ākārajña tā
translated: From this is born the knowledge of all aspects of all buddhas.

original: ato nirjātā aprameyāsaṃkhyeyā buddhadharmāḥ /
analyzed: atas nirjātāḥ aprameya asaṃkhyeyāḥ buddha dharmāḥ
translated: From this are born the immeasurable, incalculable dharmas of the buddhas.

original: ato nirjātāḥ srotāpannāḥ sakṛdāgāmino 'nāgāmino /
analyzed: atas nirjātāḥ srotāpannāḥ sakṛdāgāminaḥ nāgāminaḥ
translated: From this are born the stream enterers, once-returners, non-returners,

original: 'to nirjātā arhantaḥ pratyekabuddhā /🔽ato nirjātās tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ / ye 'pi kecit subhūte /
analyzed: nirjātāḥ arhantaḥ pratyekabuddhā  atas nirjātāḥ tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ ye pi kecid subhūte
translated: and the perfected beings and pratyekabuddhas.🔽From this are born the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened buddhas.

original: tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhā abhisaṃbudhyante abhisaṃbhotsyante ca /
analyzed: tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhāḥ abhisaṃbudhyante abhisaṃbhotsyante ca
translated: Subhūti, whatever tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened buddhas have fully awakened, are fully awakening, and will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect awakening,

original: sarve te imāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitām āgamyānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhāḥ abhisaṃbudhyante 'bhisaṃbhotsyante ca /
analyzed: sarve te imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām āgamya anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhāḥ abhisaṃbudhyante bhisaṃbhotsyante ca
translated: all of them have fully awakened, are fully awakening, and will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect awakening by relying on this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: ye 'pi te subhūte mahāyānasaṃprasthitāḥ kulaputrāḥ kuladuhitaraś ca imāṃ gambhīrāṃ
analyzed: ye pi te subhūte mahāyāna saṃprasthitāḥ kula putrāḥ kula duhitaraḥ ca imām gambhīrām
translated: Those sons and daughters of good family who have set out in the Great Vehicle, who have heard this deep perfection of wisdom, and who do not doubt, do not hesitate, do not waver, and do not become confused about it, they should be known as irreversible from awakening.

original: prajñāpāramitāṃ likhiṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti uddekṣyanti svādhyāsyanti
analyzed: prajñāpāramitām likhiṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti uddekṣyanti su ādhyāsyanti
translated: Those sons of good family and daughters of good family who have set out in the Great Vehicle and will write out this deep perfection of wisdom, will bear it in mind, will recite it, will master it, will wisely attend to it, all of them are constantly and always being looked at with the Buddha's eye

original: yoniśo manasikariṣyanti sarve te tathāgatair arhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhair buddhacakṣuṣā🔽satatasamitaṃ samanvāhriyante teṣāṃ subhūte bodhisattvānāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṛṇāñ
analyzed: yoniśas manasikariṣyanti sarve te tathāgataiḥ arhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ buddha cakṣuṣā  satata samitam samanvāhriyante teṣām subhūte bodhisattvānām kula putrāṇām kula duhitṛṇām
translated: by the Tathagatas, the Arhats, the Fully Enlightened Ones.

original: ca tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ satatasamitaṃ rakṣāvaraṇaṃ guptiṃ saṃvidhāsyanti
analyzed: ca tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ satata samitam rakṣā āvaraṇam guptim saṃvidhāsyanti
translated: The Tathagatas, the Arhats, the Fully Enlightened Ones constantly and always arrange protection, guard, and defense for those sons of good family and daughters of good family,

original: yathānuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodher na parihāsyanti /
analyzed: yathā anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ na parihāsyanti
translated: so that they will not fall away from unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: iti jāmbūdvīpakamahāratnodāharaṇādidṛṣṭāntena mahānubhāvatvam ity uktā doṣāḥ
analyzed: iti jāmbūdvīpaka mahāratna udāharaṇa ādi dṛṣṭāntena mahā anubhāva tvam iti uktāḥ doṣāḥ
translated: Thus, the faults have been stated by way of the example of the great jewel in Jambudvipa and so on, as having great power.

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhuti said:

original: yad bhagavān āha /
analyzed: yat bhagavān āha
translated: What the Blessed One has said:

original: prajñāpāramitā tathāgatānām arhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāṃ janayitrī asya ca lokasya darśayitrī ti / kathaṃ ca bhagavan buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ prajñāpāramitā
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām janayitrī asya ca lokasya darśayitrī ti katham ca bhagavan buddhānām bhagavatām prajñāpāramitā
translated: Blessed One, how is the perfection of wisdom of the Blessed Buddhas

original: kathañ ca bhagavan prajñāpāramitāsya lokasya darśayitrī /
analyzed: katham ca bhagavan prajñāpāramitā asya lokasya darśayitrī
translated: Blessed One, how is the perfection of wisdom the guide of this world?

original: kathañ ca bhagavan prajñāpāramitayā tathāgato janitaḥ /
analyzed: katham ca bhagavan prajñāpāramitayā tathāgataḥ janitaḥ
translated: How is the Tathagata born from the perfection of wisdom?

original: katamaś ca lokas tathāgatenākhyātaḥ /
analyzed: katamaḥ ca lokaḥ tathāgatena ākhyātaḥ
translated: What world has been declared by the Tathagata?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: anayā subhūte gambhīrayā prajñāpāramitayā daśatathāgatabalāni janitāni /
analyzed: anayā subhūte gambhīrayā prajñāpāramitayā daśa tathāgata balāni janitāni
translated: Subhuti, by this deep perfection of wisdom the ten powers of the Tathagata are born,

original: catvāri vaiśāradyāni catasraḥ pratisaṃvido mahākaruṇā mahāmaitrī mahāmuditā mahopekṣā aṣṭādaśāveṇikā buddhadharmā yāvat sarvākārajñatā janitā /
analyzed: catvāri vaiśāradyāni catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ mahā karuṇāḥ mahā maitrī mahā muditāḥ mahā upekṣāḥ aṣṭādaśā āveṇikāḥ buddha dharmāḥ yāvat sarva ākāra jña tā janitā
translated: the four grounds of self-confidence, the four analytical knowledges, great compassion, great love, great sympathetic joy, great equanimity, the eighteen special qualities of the Buddha, up to the knowledge of all modes is born.

original: ebhiś ca subhūte dharmais tathāgata iti prabhāvyate /
analyzed: ebhiḥ ca subhūte dharmaiḥ tathāgataḥ iti prabhāvyate
translated: Subhuti, by these dharmas the Tathagata is revealed.

original: tasmāt tarhi subhūte anayā gambhīrayā prajñāpāramitayā tathāgato janitaḥ / iti tathāgatanirvṛttijñānam
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi subhūte anayā gambhīrayā prajñāpāramitayā tathāgataḥ janitaḥ iti tathāgata nirvṛtti jñānam
translated: Therefore, Subhuti, the Tathagata is born from this deep perfection of wisdom. Thus is the knowledge of the Tathagata's appearance.

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhuti said:

original: katamaḥ punar bhagavaṃs tathāgatena loka ity ākhyātaḥ /
analyzed: katamaḥ punar bhagavan tathāgatena lokaḥ iti ākhyātaḥ
translated: Blessed One, what is the world that the Tathāgata has explained?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: pañca subhūte skandhās tathāgatena loka ākhyātaḥ /
analyzed: pañca subhūte skandhāḥ tathāgatena lokaḥ ākhyātaḥ
translated: Subhūti, the Tathāgata has explained the five aggregates to be the world.

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: kathaṃ bhagavan prajñāpāramitāyā pañca skandhā darśitāḥ /
analyzed: katham bhagavan prajñāpāramitāyāḥ pañca skandhāḥ darśitāḥ
translated: Blessed One, how have the five aggregates been shown in the perfection of wisdom?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: na subhūte prajñāpāramitā imān pañca skandhān lujyamānān darśayati /
analyzed: na subhūte prajñāpāramitā imān pañca skandhān lujyamānān darśayati
translated: Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom does not show these five aggregates as being destroyed,

original: na pralujyamānān darśayati /🔽notpadyamānān /🔽darśayati / na nirūdhyamānān darśayati /
analyzed: na pralujyamānān darśayati  na utpadyamānān  darśayati na nirūdhyamānān darśayati
translated: nor does it show them as being completely destroyed.🔽It does not show them as arising,🔽nor does it show them as ceasing.

original: na saṃkliśyamānān na vyavadāyamānān darśayati /
analyzed: na saṃkliśyamānān na vyavadāyamānān darśayati
translated: It does not show them as afflicted or purified.

original: na vṛddhiṃ na hāniṃ darśayati /
analyzed: na vṛddhim na hānim darśayati
translated: It does not show increase or decrease,

original: nāyūhaṃ na niryūhaṃ nātītān nānāgatān na pratyutpannān dharmān darśayati / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: na āyūham na niryūham na atītān na anāgatān na pratyutpannān dharmān darśayati tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: nor does it show the past, future, or present dharmas as being taken away or not taken away. Why is that?

original: na hi śūnyatā lujyate vā pralujyate vā /🔽nānimittaṃ lujyate vā pralujyate vā /
analyzed: na hi śūnyatā lujyate vā pralujyate vā  na animittam lujyate vā pralujyate vā
translated: Because emptiness is not destroyed or completely destroyed,🔽the signless is not destroyed or completely destroyed,

original: nāpraṇihitaṃ lujyate vā pralujyate vā /
analyzed: na apraṇihitam lujyate vā pralujyate vā
translated: and the wishless is not destroyed or completely destroyed.

original: nānabhisaṃskaro nānutpādo na nirodho nābhāvo nāsvabhāvo lujyate vā pralujyate vā / evaṃ hi subhūte tathāgatena gambhīrā prajñāpāramitā lokasya
analyzed: na anabhisaṃskaraḥ na anutpādaḥ na nirodhaḥ na abhāvaḥ na asvabhāvaḥ lujyate vā pralujyate vā evam hi subhūte tathāgatena gambhīrā prajñāpāramitā lokasya
translated: It is not non-production, not cessation, not non-existence, not non-intrinsic nature that is destroyed or dispersed. In this way, Subhūti, the profound perfection of wisdom has been taught by the Tathāgata as the

original: darśayitrī ākhyātā / iti lokasya jñānam
analyzed: darśayitrī ākhyātā iti lokasya jñānam
translated: revealer of the world. Thus is the knowledge of the world.

original: ye 'pi te subhūte aprameyāṇāṃ sattvānām asaṃkhyeyānāṃ sattvānām aparimāṇānāṃ sattvānāṃ cittacaritāni prajānanti /
analyzed: ye pi te subhūte aprameyāṇām sattvānām asaṃkhyeyānām sattvānām aparimāṇānām sattvānām citta caritāni prajānanti
translated: And, Subhūti, those who know the mental activities of immeasurable, countless, and limitless beings,

original: aprameyāḥ sattvāḥ paracittavidas te 'pi prajñāpāramitām āgamya prajānanti / na punaḥ subhūte iha gambhīrāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ sattvo na sattvaprajñaptir
analyzed: aprameyāḥ sattvāḥ para citta vidaḥ te pi prajñāpāramitām āgamya prajānanti na punar subhūte iha gambhīrāyām prajñāpāramitāyām sattvaḥ na sattva prajñaptiḥ
translated: those immeasurable beings who know the minds of others, knowing them by means of the perfection of wisdom, but, Subhūti, in this profound perfection of wisdom a being is not apprehended, nor is the designation of a being apprehended.

original: na rūpaṃ na rūpaprajñaptir upalabhyate /
analyzed: na rūpam na rūpa prajñaptiḥ upalabhyate
translated: Form is not apprehended, nor is the designation of form apprehended.

original: na vedanā na saṃjñā na saṃskārā /
analyzed: na vedanā na saṃjñā na saṃskārā
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional formations,

original: na vijñānaṃ na vijñānaprajñaptir upalabhyate /
analyzed: na vijñānam na vijñāna prajñaptiḥ upalabhyate
translated: and consciousness are not apprehended, nor is the designation of consciousness apprehended.

original: na cakṣūrūpaṃ na cakṣurvijñānaṃ na cakṣuḥsaṃsparśo na cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanā upalabhyate /
analyzed: na cakṣuḥ rūpam na cakṣuḥ vijñānam na cakṣuḥ saṃsparśaḥ na cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā upalabhyate
translated: The eye, form, eye-consciousness, eye-contact, and the feeling that arises dependent on eye-contact are not apprehended.

original: na cakṣūrūpaprajñaptir upalabhyate /🔽na cakṣurvijñānaprajñaptir upalabhyate /
analyzed: na cakṣuḥ rūpa prajñaptiḥ upalabhyate  na cakṣuḥ vijñāna prajñaptiḥ upalabhyate
translated: The designation of eye and form is not apprehended.🔽The designation of eye consciousness is not apprehended.

original: na cakṣuḥsaṃsparśaprajñaptir upalabhyate /
analyzed: na cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa prajñaptiḥ upalabhyate
translated: The designation of eye contact is not apprehended.

original: na cakṣuḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāprajñaptir upalabhyate /
analyzed: na cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā prajñaptiḥ upalabhyate
translated: The designation of the feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact is not apprehended.

original: evaṃ na śrotraṃ na śabdo na ghrāṇaṃ na gandho na jihvā na raso na kāyo na spraṣṭavyaṃ
analyzed: evam na śrotram na śabdaḥ na ghrāṇam na gandhaḥ na jihvā na rasaḥ na kāyaḥ na spraṣṭavyam
translated: In the same way, ear, sound, nose, smell, tongue, taste, body, and tangible object

original: na mano na dharmo na manovijñānaṃ na manaḥsaṃsparśo na manaḥsaṃsparśapratyayavedanāprajñaptir
analyzed: na manaḥ na dharmaḥ na manaḥ vijñānam na manaḥ saṃsparśaḥ na manaḥ saṃsparśa pratyaya vedanā prajñaptiḥ
translated: are not apprehended. The designation of mind, mental phenomena, mind consciousness, mind contact, and the feeling that arises from the condition of mind contact

original: upalabhyate / evaṃ na pāramitā na bodhipakṣyā dharmā na vimokṣamukhaṃ na balavaiśāradyapratisaṃvido
analyzed: upalabhyate evam na pāramitā na bodhi pakṣyāḥ dharmāḥ na vimokṣa mukham na bala vaiśāradya pratisaṃvidaḥ
translated: is not apprehended. In the same way, the perfections, the factors of awakening, the doors of liberation, the powers, the fearlessnesses, the analytical knowledges,

original: nāveṇikabuddhadharmā yāvan na sarvākārajñatāprajñaptir upalabhyate / evaṃ hi subhūte
analyzed: na āveṇika buddha dharmāḥ yāvat na sarva ākārajña tā prajñaptiḥ upalabhyate evam hi subhūte
translated: the unique qualities of a buddha, up to the designation of the knowledge of all aspects is not apprehended. In this way, Subhūti,

original: iyaṃ gambhīrā prajñāpāramitā tathāgatānāṃ lokasya saṃdarśayitrī /
analyzed: iyam gambhīrā prajñāpāramitā tathāgatānām lokasya saṃdarśayitrī
translated: this profound perfection of wisdom of the Tathāgatas reveals the world.

original: sā punar iyaṃ gambhīrā prajñāpāramitā na rūpasya darśayitrī yāvan na sarvajñatāyā darśayitrī / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: sā punar iyam gambhīrā prajñāpāramitā na rūpasya darśayitrī yāvat na sarvajña tāyāḥ darśayitrī tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Moreover, this profound perfection of wisdom does not reveal form, up to does not reveal omniscience. Why is that?

original: prajñāpāramitā eva tāvat subhūte prajñāpāramitāyāṃ na saṃvidyate nopalabhyate /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā eva tāvat subhūte prajñāpāramitāyām na saṃvidyate na upalabhyate
translated: Subhūti, even the perfection of wisdom itself is not found or apprehended in the perfection of wisdom.

original: kutaḥ punā rūpam upalapsyate /
analyzed: kutas punar rūpam upalapsyate
translated: How then could form be apprehended?

original: vedanāsaṃjñāsaṃskārāḥ /
analyzed: vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional formations,

original: kutaḥ punar vijñānam upalapsyate yāvat kutaḥ punaḥ sarvākārajñatā /
analyzed: kutas punar vijñānam upalapsyate yāvat kutas punar sarva ākāra jña tā
translated: How then could consciousness be apprehended, up to how could the knowledge of all aspects be apprehended?

original: upalapsyate / iti sarvacittacaritajñānam
analyzed: upalapsyate iti sarva citta carita jñānam
translated: This is the knowledge of the activities of all minds.

original: punar aparaṃ subhūte yāvantaḥ sattvāḥ sattvaprajñaptyā prajñapyante rūpiṇo vā arūpiṇo
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte yāvantaḥ sattvāḥ sattva prajñaptyā prajñapyante rūpiṇaḥ vā arūpiṇaḥ
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, as many beings as are designated by the designation 'being,' whether embodied or formless,

original: vā saṃjñino 'saṃjñino naivasaṃjñino nāsaṃjñina iha vā lokadhātau 'nyeṣu vā daśadiśi🔽lokadhātuṣu yāvantaḥ sattvās teṣāṃ yāni saṃkṣiptāni cittāni vikṣiptāni cittāni tāni
analyzed: vā saṃjñinaḥ saṃjñinaḥ na eva saṃjñinaḥ na a saṃjñinaḥ iha vā lokadhātau nyeṣu vā daśa diśi  lokadhātuṣu yāvantaḥ sattvāḥ teṣām yāni saṃkṣiptāni cittāni vikṣiptāni cittāni tāni
translated: perceiving or non-perceiving, neither perceiving nor non-perceiving, in this world system or in the other world systems in the ten directions,🔽as many beings as there are, he knows as they really are that their contracted minds and distracted minds

original: saṃkṣiptāni cittāni vikṣiptāni cittānīti yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti / kathañ ca subhūte
analyzed: saṃkṣiptāni cittāni vikṣiptāni cittāni iti yathābhūtam prajānāti katham ca subhūte
translated: are contracted minds and distracted minds. And how, Subhūti, does he know as they really are that their contracted minds and distracted minds🔽are contracted minds and distracted minds?

original: tathāgatas teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ tāni saṃkṣiptāni cittāni vikṣiptāni cittānīti yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: tathāgataḥ teṣām sattvānām tāni saṃkṣiptāni cittāni vikṣiptāni cittāni iti yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: The Tathāgata knows as it really is the contracted minds and distracted minds of those beings.

original: dharmatayā subhūte tathāgatas teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ saṃkṣiptāni cittāni vikṣiptāni cittānīti yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: dharma tayā subhūte tathāgataḥ teṣām sattvānām saṃkṣiptāni cittāni vikṣiptāni cittāni iti yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: Subhūti, by the true nature of dharmas, the Tathāgata knows as it really is the contracted minds and distracted minds of those beings.

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: katamayā bhagavan dharmatayā tathāgatas teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ saṃkṣiptāni cittāni vikṣiptāni cittānīti yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: katamayā bhagavan dharmatayā tathāgataḥ teṣām sattvānām saṃkṣiptāni cittāni vikṣiptāni cittāni iti yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: Blessed One, by what true nature of dharmas does the Tathāgata know as it really is the contracted minds and distracted minds of those beings?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: yatra subhūte dharmatāyāṃ dharmataiva nopalabhyate prāg eva saṃkṣiptāni cittāni vikṣiptāni cittāni /
analyzed: yatra subhūte dharmatāyām dharmatā eva na upalabhyate prāk eva saṃkṣiptāni cittāni vikṣiptāni cittāni
translated: Subhūti, in that true nature of dharmas, the true nature itself is not apprehended, let alone contracted minds and distracted minds.

original: anayā subhūte dharmatayā tathāgataḥ saṃkṣiptāni cittāni vikṣiptāni cittāni teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti / iti cittasaṃkṣepajñānam
analyzed: anayā subhūte dharma tayā tathāgataḥ saṃkṣiptāni cittāni vikṣiptāni cittāni teṣām sattvānām yathābhūtam prajānāti iti citta saṃkṣepa jñānam
translated: Subhūti, by this true nature of dharmas, the Tathāgata knows as it really is the contracted minds and distracted minds of those beings. Thus is the knowledge of contracted minds.

original: punar aparaṃ subhūte tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho 'kṣayataḥ teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ saṃkṣiptāni
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ kṣayataḥ teṣām sattvānām saṃkṣiptāni
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, knows as it really is the contracted minds and distracted minds of those beings from the inexhaustible.

original: cittāni vikṣiptāni cittāni yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti / kathaṃ ca subhūte tathāgatas teṣāṃ
analyzed: cittāni vikṣiptāni cittāni yathābhūtam prajānāti katham ca subhūte tathāgataḥ teṣām
translated: He knows as it really is the contracted minds of those beings.

original: sattvānām akṣayataḥ saṃkṣiptāni cittāni vikṣiptāni cittāni yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: sattvānām akṣayataḥ saṃkṣiptāni cittāni vikṣiptāni cittāni yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: And how, Subhuti, does the Tathagata know as it really is the contracted and distracted minds of those beings as being imperishable?

original: iha subhūte tathāgato nirodhataḥ prahāṇatas teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ tāni cittāni yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: iha subhūte tathāgataḥ nirodhataḥ prahāṇataḥ teṣām sattvānām tāni cittāni yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: Here, Subhuti, the Tathagata knows as it really is the cessation and abandonment of those beings' minds.

original: śāntatas tucchato viviktataḥ tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhas teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ saṃkṣiptāni cittāni vikṣiptāni cittāni yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: śāntataḥ tucchataḥ viviktataḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ teṣām sattvānām saṃkṣiptāni cittāni vikṣiptāni cittāni yathābhūtam prajānāti  /
translated: The Tathagata, the Arhat, the Fully Enlightened One knows as it really is the contracted and distracted minds of those beings as being peaceful, empty, isolated.

original: iti cittākṣayākārajñānam
analyzed: iti citta akṣaya ākāra jñānam
translated: Thus is the knowledge of the imperishable aspects of mind.

original: punar aparaṃ subhūte tathāgatas teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ sarāgaṃ cittaṃ sarāgaṃ cittam iti yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /🔽vītarāgaṃ cittaṃ vītarāgaṃ cittam iti yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte tathāgataḥ teṣām sattvānām sa rāgam cittam sa rāgam cittam iti yathābhūtam prajānāti  vīta rāgam cittam vīta rāgam cittam iti yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: Furthermore, Subhuti, the Tathagata knows as it really is the lustful mind of those beings as a lustful mind,🔽the mind free from lust as a mind free from lust,

original: sadoṣaṃ cittaṃ sadoṣaṃ cittam iti yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: sa doṣam cittam sa doṣam cittam iti yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: the hateful mind as a hateful mind,

original: vigatadoṣaṃ cittaṃ vigatadoṣaṃ cittam iti yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /🔽samohaṃ cittaṃ samohaṃ cittam iti yathābhūtaṃ /
analyzed: vigata doṣam cittam vigata doṣam cittam iti yathābhūtam prajānāti  sa moham cittam sa moham cittam iti yathābhūtam
translated: He knows a mind free from hatred as a mind free from hatred, as it really is.🔽He knows a mind with delusion as a mind with delusion, as it really is.

original: prajānāti / vigatamohaṃ cittaṃ vigatamohaṃ cittam iti yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: prajānāti vigata moham cittam vigata moham cittam iti yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: He knows a mind free from delusion as a mind free from delusion, as it really is.

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: kathaṃ bhagavaṃs tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhas teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ sarāgaṃ cittaṃ sarāgaṃ cittam iti yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: katham bhagavan tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ teṣām sattvānām sa rāgam cittam sa rāgam cittam iti yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: Blessed One, how does the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, know a mind with passion as a mind with passion, as it really is?

original: sadoṣaṃ cittaṃ sadoṣaṃ cittam iti yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: sa doṣam cittam sa doṣam cittam iti yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: How does he know a mind with hatred as a mind with hatred, as it really is?

original: samohaṃ cittaṃ samohaṃ cittam iti yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: sa moham cittam sa moham cittam iti yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: How does he know a mind with delusion as a mind with delusion, as it really is?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: yā subhūte cittasya sarāgadoṣamohatā na sā cittasya yathābhūtatā / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: yā subhūte cittasya sa rāga doṣa moha tā na sā cittasya yathā bhūta tā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Subhūti, the mind's passion, hatred, and delusion are not the mind's suchness. Why is that?

original: na hi subhūte yathābhūtaṃ cittam upalabhyate na caitasikā dharmāḥ prāg eva sarāgaṃ
analyzed: na hi subhūte yathābhūtam cittam upalabhyate na caitasikāḥ dharmāḥ prāk eva sa rāgam
translated: Subhūti, the mind and mental factors are not perceived in suchness, let alone a mind with passion,

original: vā sadoṣaṃ vā samohaṃ vā cittam upalapsyate / evaṃ hi subhūte tathāgataḥ prajñāpāramitām
analyzed: vā sa doṣam vā sa moham vā cittam upalapsyate evam hi subhūte tathāgataḥ prajñāpāramitām
translated: In this way, Subhuti, the Tathagata, having approached the perfection of wisdom,

original: āgamya teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ sarāgaṃ cittaṃ sarāgaṃ cittam iti yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: āgamya teṣām sattvānām sa rāgam cittam sa rāgam cittam iti yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: knows as it really is the minds of those beings with passion as having passion.

original: sadoṣaṃ cittaṃ sadoṣaṃ cittam iti yathābhutaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: sa doṣam cittam sa doṣam cittam iti yathābhutam prajānāti
translated: He knows as it really is the minds with hatred as having hatred.🔽He knows as it really is the minds with delusion as having delusion.

original: samohañ cittaṃ samohaṃ cittam iti yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti / kathaṃ ca subhūte tathāgatas teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ vigatarāgaṃ cittaṃ vigatarāgaṃ cittam 🔽iti yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /🔽vigatadoṣaṃ cittaṃ vigatadoṣaṃ cittam iti yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: sa moham cittam sa moham cittam iti yathābhūtam prajānāti katham ca subhūte tathāgataḥ teṣām sattvānām vigata rāgam cittam vigata rāgam cittam  iti yathābhūtam prajānāti  vigata doṣam cittam vigata doṣam cittam iti yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: And how, Subhuti, does the Tathagata know as it really is the minds of those beings without passion as without passion?🔽He knows as it really is the minds without hatred as without hatred.

original: vigatamohaṃ cittaṃ vigatamohaṃ cittam iti yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: vigata moham cittam vigata moham cittam iti yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: He knows as it really is the minds without delusion as without delusion.

original: yā subhūte cittasya vigatarāgatā na sā cittasya sarāgatā / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: yā subhūte cittasya vigata rāga tā na sā cittasya sa rāga tā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Subhuti, that which is the mind's freedom from passion is not the mind's passion. Why is it so?

original: na hi subhūte dvayoś cittayoḥ samavadhānam asti / evaṃ yā subhūte cittasya vigatadoṣatā na sā cittasya sadoṣatā /
analyzed: na hi subhūte dvayoḥ cittayoḥ samavadhānam asti evam yā subhūte cittasya vigata doṣa tā na sā cittasya sa doṣa tā
translated: Subhuti, the minds of two people do not meet. In the same way, Subhuti, the mind that is free from faults is not the mind that has faults.

original: yā subhūte cittasya vigatamohatā na sā cittasya samohatā / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: yā subhūte cittasya vigata moha tā na sā cittasya samoha tā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Subhuti, the mind that is free from delusion is not the mind that has delusion. Why is it so?

original: na hi subhūte dvayoś cittayoḥ samavadhānam asti / evaṃ subhūte tathāgatas teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ vigatarāgaṃ cittaṃ vigatarāgaṃ cittam iti yathābhūtaṃ🔽vigatadoṣaṃ cittaṃ vigatadoṣaṃ cittam iti yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: na hi subhūte dvayoḥ cittayoḥ samavadhānam asti evam subhūte tathāgataḥ teṣām sattvānām vigata rāgam cittam vigata rāgam cittam iti yathābhūtam  vigata doṣam cittam vigata doṣam cittam iti yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: Subhuti, the minds of two people do not meet. In the same way, Subhuti, the Tathagata accurately knows the minds of those beings that are free from passion as minds that are free from passion,🔽minds that are free from hatred as minds that are free from hatred,

original: vigatamohaṃ cittaṃ vigatamohaṃ cittam iti yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: vigata moham cittam vigata moham cittam iti yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: and minds that are free from delusion as minds that are free from delusion.

original: iti sarāgādicittajñānam🔽punar aparaṃ subhūte tathāgata imāṃ prajñāpāramitām āgamya parasattvānāṃ parapudgalānāṃ
analyzed: iti sa rāga ādi citta jñānam  punar aparam subhūte tathāgataḥ imām prajñāpāramitām āgamya para sattvānām para pudgalānām
translated: Thus, the knowledge of minds with passion, etc.

original: vipulacittaṃ vipulacittam iti yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti / kathaṃ ca subhūte tathāgata
analyzed: vipula cittam vipula cittam iti yathābhūtam prajānāti katham ca subhūte tathāgata
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, the Tathagata, having relied on this perfection of wisdom, accurately knows the vast minds of other beings, other persons, as vast minds. How does the Tathagata, Subhuti,

original: imāṃ prajñāpāramitām āgamya parasattvānāṃ parapudgalānāṃ vipulaṃ cittaṃ vipulaṃ cittam🔽iti yathābhutaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: imām prajñāpāramitām āgamya para sattvānām para pudgalānām vipulam cittam vipulam cittam  iti yathābhutam prajānāti
translated: Having approached this perfection of wisdom, he knows as it really is: 'The mind of other beings and persons is vast, the mind is vast,'

original: iha subhūte tathāgata imāṃ prajñāpāramitām āgamya parasattvānāṃ parapudgalānāṃ na
analyzed: iha subhūte tathāgataḥ imām prajñāpāramitām āgamya para sattvānām para pudgalānām na
translated: Here, Subhuti, the Tathagata, having approached this perfection of wisdom, knows as it really is: 'The mind of other beings and persons is not vast, the mind is not vast,'🔽he knows as it really is: 'The mind of other beings and persons is not contracted, the mind is not contracted,'

original: vistīrṇaṃ cittaṃ na saṃkuñcitañ cittaṃ na hi vivarddhate cittaṃ na parihīyate cittaṃ🔽nāgacchati na gacchati /
analyzed: vistīrṇam cittam na saṃkuñcitam cittam na hi vivarddhate cittam na parihīyate cittam  na āgacchati na gacchati
translated: he knows as it really is: 'The mind of other beings and persons does not expand, the mind does not expand,'🔽he knows as it really is: 'The mind of other beings and persons does not diminish, the mind does not diminish,'🔽he knows as it really is: 'The mind of other beings and persons does not come, the mind does not go.'

original: cittam iti yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: cittam iti yathābhūtam prajānāti tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hi subhūte cittasya svabhāvo nopalabhyate yena vistīrṇaṃ kriyate yāvad āgacched
analyzed: tathā hi subhūte cittasya svabhāvaḥ na upalabhyate yena vistīrṇam kriyate yāvat āgacchet
translated: Subhuti, it is because the intrinsic nature of the mind is not apprehended by which it would be expanded up to coming or going.🔽Thus, Subhuti, the Tathagata, having approached this perfection of wisdom, knows as it really is: 'The mind of other beings and persons is vast, the mind is vast,'

original: vā / evaṃ hi subhūte tathāgata imāṃ prajñāpāramitām āgamya parasattvānāṃ parapudgalānāṃ
analyzed: vā evam hi subhūte tathāgataḥ imām prajñāpāramitām āgamya para sattvānām para pudgalānām
translated: he knows as it really is: 'The mind of other beings and persons is not vast, the mind is not vast,'🔽he knows as it really is: 'The mind of other beings and persons is not contracted, the mind is not contracted,'🔽he knows as it really is: 'The mind of other beings and persons does not expand, the mind does not expand,'🔽he knows as it really is: 'The mind of other beings and persons does not diminish, the mind does not diminish,'

original: vipulaṃ cittaṃ vipulaṃ cittam iti yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti / iti vipulacittajñānam
analyzed: vipulam cittam vipulam cittam iti yathābhūtam prajānāti iti vipula citta jñānam
translated: he knows as it really is: 'The mind of other beings and persons does not come, the mind does not go.'🔽Why is that?🔽Subhuti, it is because the intrinsic nature of the mind is not apprehended by which it would be expanded up to coming or going.🔽Thus, Subhuti, the Tathagata, having approached this perfection of wisdom, knows as it really is: 'The mind of other beings and persons is vast, the mind is vast,'

original: punar aparaṃ subhūte tathāgata imāṃ prajñāpāramitām āgamya parasattvānāṃ parapudgalānāṃ
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte tathāgataḥ imām prajñāpāramitām āgamya para sattvānām para pudgalānām
translated: he knows

original: mahadgataṃ cittaṃ mahadgataṃ cittam iti yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti / kathaṃ ca subhūte
analyzed: mahadgatam cittam mahadgatam cittam iti yathābhūtam prajānāti katham ca subhūte
translated: He knows as it really is a great mind as a great mind. And how, Subhuti,

original: tathāgata imāṃ prajñāpāramitām āgamya parasattvānāṃ parapudgalānāṃ mahadgataṃ cittaṃ
analyzed: tathāgataḥ imām prajñāpāramitām āgamya para sattvānām para pudgalānām mahadgatam cittam
translated: does the Tathagata, having approached this perfection of wisdom, know as it really is the great mind of other beings,

analyzed: mahadgatam cittam iti yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: of other persons, as a great mind?

original: iha subhūte tathāgatas teṣāṃ parasattvānāṃ parapudgalānāṃ teṣāṃ cittānāṃ nāgamanaṃ na gamanaṃ notpādaṃ na nirodhaṃ na sthitiṃ nānyathātvaṃ
analyzed: iha subhūte tathāgataḥ teṣām para sattvānām para pudgalānām teṣām cittānām na āgamanam na gamanam na utpādam na nirodham na sthitim na anyathātvam
translated: Here, Subhuti, the Tathagata does not see the coming, the going, the origination, the passing away, the persistence of those minds of other beings, of other persons, or their change into something else.

original: samanupaśyati / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: samanupaśyati tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: na hi subhūte teṣām cittānām svabhāvaḥ saṃvidyate
translated: Because, Subhuti, the own-being of those minds does not exist,

original: ya āgacched vā gacched vā utpadyeta vā nirudhyeta vā sthīyeta vānyathā vā bhavet /🔽evaṃ khalu subhūte tathāgata imāṃ prajñāpāramitām āgamya parasattvānāṃ parapudgalānāṃ
analyzed: yaḥ āgacchet vā gacchet vā utpadyeta vā nirudhyeta vā sthīyeta vā anyathā vā bhavet  evam khalu subhūte tathāgataḥ imām prajñāpāramitām āgamya para sattvānām para pudgalānām
translated: which would come or go, originate or pass away, persist or change into something else.🔽Thus, Subhuti, the Tathagata, having approached this perfection of wisdom, knows as it really is the great mind of other beings, of other persons,

original: mahadgataṃ cittaṃ mahadgataṃ cittam iti yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti / iti mahadgatacittajñānam
analyzed: mahadgatam cittam mahadgatam cittam iti yathābhūtam prajānāti iti mahadgata citta jñānam
translated: as a great mind. Thus the knowledge of a great mind.

original: punar aparaṃ subhūte tathāgata imāṃ prajñāpāramitām āgamya parasattvānāṃ parapudgalānām
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte tathāgataḥ imām prajñāpāramitām āgamya para sattvānām para pudgalānām
translated: Furthermore, Subhuti, the Tathagata, by way of this perfection of wisdom, knows as it really is the immeasurable mind of other beings, other persons,

original: apramāṇaṃ cittam apramāṇaṃ cittam iti yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti / kathaṃ ca subhūte tathāgata
analyzed: apramāṇam cittam apramāṇam cittam iti yathābhūtam prajānāti katham ca subhūte tathāgata
translated: as immeasurable mind. And how, Subhuti, does the Tathagata,

analyzed: imām prajñāpāramitām āgamya para sattvānām para pudgalānām apramāṇam cittam apramāṇam
translated: by way of this perfection of wisdom, know as it really is the immeasurable mind of other beings, other persons,

translated: as immeasurable mind?

translated: Here, Subhuti, the Tathagata, by way of this perfection of wisdom, does not see that mind of other beings, other persons, as either standing or not standing.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ

original: anāśrayā hi subhūte cittadhārā apramāṇā /
analyzed: anāśrayā hi subhūte citta dhārā apramāṇā
translated: Because, Subhuti, the stream of mind is immeasurable, without a basis.

analyzed: na hi teṣām āśrayaḥ saṃvidyate yatra pratiṣṭheran evam hi subhūte tathāgataḥ imām
translated: For there is no basis for them to stand on. Thus, Subhuti, the Tathagata,🔽by way of this perfection of wisdom, knows as it really is the immeasurable minds of other beings, other persons,

analyzed: prajñāpāramitām āgamya para sattvānām para pudgalānām apramāṇāni cittāni apramāṇāni

original: ity apramāṇacittajñānam
analyzed: iti apramāṇa citta jñānam
translated: Thus is the knowledge of immeasurable minds.

original: punar aparaṃ subhūte tathāgata imāṃ prajñāpāramitām āgamya parasattvānāṃ parapudgalānām
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte tathāgataḥ imām prajñāpāramitām āgamya para sattvānām para pudgalānām
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, the Tathagata, by means of this perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: a nidarśanam cittam a nidarśanam cittam iti yathābhūtam prajānāti katham ca subhūte

analyzed: iha subhūte tathāgataḥ imām prajñāpāramitām āgamya para sattvānām para pudgalānām alakṣaṇāni

translated: Thus, Subhuti, the Tathagata, by means of this perfection of wisdom,🔽knows the minds of other beings and persons which are signless and devoid of intrinsic nature as 'the minds of other beings and persons which are signless and devoid of intrinsic nature'.

analyzed: punar aparam subhūte tathāgataḥ imām prajñāpāramitām āgamya para sattvānām para pudgalānām
