original: yā cāveṇikabuddhadharmatathatā /
analyzed: yā ca āveṇika buddha dharma tathatā
translated: And the suchness of the unshared qualities of a Buddha,

original: yā ca sarvākārajñatāyās tathatā /
analyzed: yā ca sarva ākāra jña tāyāḥ tathatā
translated: and the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects,

original: yā ca buddhadharmāṇāṃ tathatā ekaivaiṣā tathatādvayādvaidhīkārā /🔽atha khalu kāmāvacarā rūpāvacarāś ca devaputrā divyāni candanacūrṇāni gṛhītvā divyāny
analyzed: yā ca buddha dharmāṇām tathatā ekā eva eṣā tathatā dvayā a dvaidhīkārā  atha khalu kāmāvacarāḥ rūpāvacarāḥ ca deva putrāḥ divyāni candana cūrṇāni gṛhītvā divyāni
translated: and the suchness of the Buddha-qualities, this one suchness is non-dual, not divided into two.🔽Then the gods of the desire realm and the form realm, having taken divine sandalwood powders,

original: utpalakumudapuṇḍarīkasaugandhikamāndaravamahāmāndaravāṇi gṛhītvā yena bhagavāṃs tenākṣipanti
analyzed: utpala kumuda puṇḍarīka saugandhika māndarava mahāmāndaravāṇi gṛhītvā yena bhagavān tena ākṣipanti
translated: having taken divine blue lotuses, night lotuses, and white lotuses, and mandara and great mandara flowers, they scattered them towards the Blessed One.

original: sma / kṣiptvā ca /
analyzed: sma kṣiptvā ca
translated: Having scattered them,

original: yena bhagavāṃs tenopasaṃkrāntā upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasābhivandya ekānte tiṣṭhan /
analyzed: yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāntāḥ upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya ekānte tiṣṭhan
translated: they approached the Blessed One. Having approached and bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One, they stood to one side.

original: ekānte sthitāś ca kāmāvacarā rūpāvacarāś ca devaputrā bhagavantam etad avocan /
analyzed: ekānte sthitāḥ ca kāmāvacarāḥ rūpāvacarāḥ ca deva putrāḥ bhagavantam etat avocan
translated: And while standing to one side, the gods of the desire realm and the form realm said this to the Blessed One:

original: gambhīrā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā durdṛśā duranubodhātarkātarkāvacarā śāntā śūkṣmā
analyzed: gambhīrā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā durdṛśā duranubodhā a tarka a tarka avacarā śāntā śūkṣmā
translated: The perfection of wisdom is profound, Blessed One, difficult to see, difficult to understand, beyond the sphere of logic, not to be investigated, subtle,🔽to be experienced by the wise and the noble ones. It is contrary to the world, Blessed One, namely the enlightenment of the Tathāgatas,

original: nipuṇapaṇḍitavijñavedanīyā sarvalokavipratyanīkā yad uta tathāgatānāṃ bodhir yatra
analyzed: nipuṇa paṇḍita vijña vedanīyā sarva loka vipratyanīkā yat uta tathāgatānām bodhiḥ yatra
translated: in which

original: nāma tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ /
analyzed: nāma tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: The Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones are named thus.

original: evaṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitām evaṃ nipuṇāṃ nirdiśanti /
analyzed: evam gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām evam nipuṇām nirdiśanti
translated: Thus they teach the profound perfection of wisdom, which is so subtle.

original: rūpam eva sarvākārajñatā sarvākārajñataiva rūpaṃ /
analyzed: rūpam eva sarva ākāra jña tā sarva ākāra jña tā eva rūpam
translated: Form itself is the knowledge of all aspects, and the knowledge of all aspects is form itself.

original: vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārā /
analyzed: vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārā
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional formations,

original: vijñānam eva sarvākārajñatā sarvākārajñataiva vijñānam / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: vijñānam eva sarva ākāra jña tā sarva ākāra jña tā eva vijñānam tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: and consciousness itself is the knowledge of all aspects, and the knowledge of all aspects is consciousness itself. Why is that?

original: yā ca rūpasya tathatā /
analyzed: yā ca rūpasya tathatā
translated: And the suchness of form,

original: yā ca sarvākārajñatāyās tathatā ekaivaiṣā tathatādvayādvaidhīkārā /
analyzed: yā ca sarva ākāra jña tāyāḥ tathatā ekā eva eṣā tathatā dvayā a dvaidhīkārā
translated: and the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects, are one and the same suchness, non-dual and indivisible.

original: yā ca vedanāyās tathatā /
analyzed: yā ca vedanāyāḥ tathatā
translated: And the suchness of feeling,

original: yā ca saṃjñāyās tathatā /
analyzed: yā ca saṃjñāyāḥ tathatā
translated: and the suchness of perception,

original: yā ca saṃskārāṇāṃ tathatā /
analyzed: yā ca saṃskārāṇām tathatā
translated: and the suchness of volitional formations,

original: yā ca vijñānasya tathatā /
analyzed: yā ca vijñānasya tathatā
translated: and the suchness of consciousness,

original: yā ca sarvākārajñatāyās tathatā ekaivaiṣā tathatādvayādvaidhīkārā / evaṃ skandhadhātvāyatanapratītyasamutpāda eva sarvākārajñatā /
analyzed: yā ca sarva ākārajña tāyāḥ tathatā ekā eva eṣā tathatā dvayā a dvaidhīkārā evam skandha dhātu āyatana pratītyasamutpādaḥ eva sarva ākārajña tā
translated: and the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects, are one and the same suchness, non-dual and indivisible. Thus the aggregates, elements, and sense fields themselves are the knowledge of all aspects,

original: sarvākārajñataiva skandhadhātvāyatanapratītyasamutpādaḥ / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā eva skandha dhātu āyatana pratītyasamutpādaḥ tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: and the knowledge of all aspects is the aggregates, elements, and sense fields. Why is that?

original: yā ca skandhadhātvāyatanapratītyasamutpādatathatā /
analyzed: yā ca skandha dhātu āyatana pratītyasamutpāda tathatā
translated: And the suchness of the aggregates, elements, and sense fields,

original: yā ca sarvākārajñatātathatā ekaivaiṣā tathatādvayādvaidhīkārā / evaṃ yā ca yāvad buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ tathatā /
analyzed: yā ca sarva ākāra jña tā tathatā ekā eva eṣā tathatā dvayā dvaidhīkārā evam yā ca yāvat buddhānām bhagavatām tathatā
translated: And the suchness of all-knowledge is just this one suchness, non-dual and undivided.

original: yā ca yāvat sarvākārajñatāyās tathatā ekaivaiṣā tathatādvayādvaidhīkārā /
analyzed: yā ca yāvat sarva ākārajña tāyāḥ tathatā ekā eva eṣā tathatā dvayā a dvaidhīkārā
translated: In the same way, the suchness of the Buddhas, Blessed Ones, up to the suchness of all-knowledge is just this one suchness, non-dual and undivided.

original: evam ukte bhagavāṃs tān kāmāvacārān rūpāvacārāṃś ca devaputrān etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān tān kāma avacārān rūpa avacārān ca deva putrān etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to those gods of the desire realm and form realm:

original: evam etad devaputrā evam etat /
analyzed: evam etat deva putrāḥ evam etat
translated: It is so, gods! It is so!

original: rūpam eva devaputrāḥ sarvākārajñatā sarvākārajñataiva devaputrā rūpaṃ /
analyzed: rūpam eva deva putrāḥ sarva ākāra jña tā sarva ākāra jña tā eva deva putrāḥ rūpam
translated: Form itself, gods, is all-knowledge; all-knowledge itself, gods, is form.

original: vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ /
analyzed: vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional formations,

original: vijñānam eva devaputrāḥ sarvākārajñatā sarvākārajñataiva devaputrā vijñānam / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: vijñānam eva deva putrāḥ sarva ākāra jña tā sarva ākāra jña tā eva deva putrāḥ vijñānam tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: consciousness itself, gods, is all-knowledge; all-knowledge itself, gods, is consciousness. Why is it so?

original: yā ca rūpasya tathatā yā ca sarvākārajñatāyās tathatā ekaivaiṣā tathatādvayādvaidhīkārā /
analyzed: yā ca rūpasya tathatā yā ca sarva ākāra jña tāyāḥ tathatā ekā eva eṣā tathatā dvayā a dvaidhīkārā
translated: The suchness of form and the suchness of all-knowledge are just this one suchness, non-dual and undivided.

original: yā ca vedanāyās tathatā yā ca saṃjñāyās tathatā yā ca saṃskārāṇāṃ tathatā /
analyzed: yā ca vedanāyāḥ tathatā yā ca saṃjñāyāḥ tathatā yā ca saṃskārāṇām tathatā
translated: The suchness of feeling, the suchness of perception, the suchness of volitional formations,

original: yā ca vijñānasya tathatā yā ca sarvākārajñatāyās tathatā ekaivaiṣā tathatādvayādvaidhīkārā / evaṃ skandhadhātvāyatanapratītyasamutpāda eva sarvākārajñatā /
analyzed: yā ca vijñānasya tathatā yā ca sarva ākārajña tāyāḥ tathatā ekā eva eṣā tathatā dvayā a dvaidhīkārā evam skandha dhātu āyatana pratītyasamutpādaḥ eva sarva ākārajña tā
translated: And the suchness of consciousness and the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects are one and the same suchness, non-dual and indivisible. In the same way, the aggregates, elements, and sense bases are themselves the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sarvākārajñataiva skandhadhātvāyatanapratītyasamutpādaḥ / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā eva skandha dhātu āyatana pratītyasamutpādaḥ tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The knowledge of all aspects is itself the aggregates, elements, and sense bases. Why is that?

original: yā ca skandhadhātvāyatanapratītyasamutpādatathatā yā ca sarvākārajñatāyās tathatā ekaivaiṣā tathatādvayādvaidhīkārā / dānapāramitaiva sarvākārajñatā 🔽sarvākārajñataiva /
analyzed: yā ca skandha dhātu āyatana pratītyasamutpāda tathatā yā ca sarva ākāra jña tāyāḥ tathatā ekā eva eṣā tathatā dvayā a dvaidhīkārā dāna pāramitā eva sarva ākāra jña tā  sarva ākāra jña tā eva
translated: The suchness of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, and the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects, are one and the same suchness, non-dual and indivisible. The perfection of giving is itself the knowledge of all aspects.🔽The knowledge of all aspects is itself the perfection of giving.

original: dānapāramitā /
analyzed: dāna pāramitā
translated: The perfection of giving is itself the knowledge of all aspects.

original: evaṃ śīlapāramitā kṣāntipāramitā vīryapāramitā dhyānapāramitā /
analyzed: evam śīla pāramitā kṣānti pāramitā vīrya pāramitā dhyāna pāramitā
translated: In the same way, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of diligence, and the perfection of concentration.

original: prajñāpāramitaiva devaputrāḥ sarvākārajñatā sarvākārajñataiva devaputrāḥ prajñāpāramitā / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā eva deva putrāḥ sarva ākāra jña tā sarva ākāra jña tā eva deva putrāḥ prajñāpāramitā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The perfection of wisdom, sons of gods, is the knowledge of all aspects. The knowledge of all aspects, sons of gods, is the perfection of wisdom. Why is that?

original: yā ca dānapāramitātathatā /
analyzed: yā ca dāna pāramitā tathatā
translated: The suchness of the perfection of giving,

original: yā ca sarvākārajñatātathatā ekaivaiṣā tathatādvayādvaidhīkārā / evaṃ śīlapāramitā kṣāntipāramitā vīryapāramitā dhyānapāramitā /
analyzed: yā ca sarva ākāra jña tā atathatā ekā eva eṣā tathatā dvayā a dvaidhīkārā evam śīla pāramitā kṣānti pāramitā vīrya pāramitā dhyāna pāramitā
translated: And the suchness of the perfection of wisdom, and the suchness of the perfection of concentration, and the suchness of the perfection of perseverance, and the suchness of the perfection of patience, and the suchness of the perfection of morality, and the suchness of the perfection of giving, and the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects, this suchness is one single suchness, not two, not divided.

original: yā ca prajñāpāramitātathatā /
analyzed: yā ca prajñāpāramitā tathatā
translated: And the suchness of the perfection of wisdom,🔽and the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects, this suchness is one single suchness, not two, not divided.

original: yā ca sarvākārajñatātathatā ekaivaiṣā tathatādvayādvaidhīkārā / adhyātmaśūnyataiva sarvākārajñatā sarvākārajñataivādhyātmaśūnyatā /
analyzed: yā ca sarva ākāra jña tā a tathatā ekā eva eṣā tathatā dvayā dvaidhīkārā adhyātma śūnyatā eva sarva ākāra jña tā sarva ākāra jña tā eva adhyātma śūnyatā
translated: The emptiness of internal is the knowledge of all aspects, the knowledge of all aspects is the emptiness of internal.

original: evaṃ yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyataiva sarvākārajñatā sarvākārajñataivābhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatā / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: evam yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā eva sarva ākāra jñatā sarva ākāra jñatā eva abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: And so on up to the emptiness of the own-being of non-existence is the knowledge of all aspects, the knowledge of all aspects is the emptiness of the own-being of non-existence. Why is that?

original: yā cābhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāyās tathatā /
analyzed: yā ca abhāva svabhāva śūnyatāyāḥ tathatā
translated: And the suchness of the emptiness of the own-being of non-existence,

original: yā ca sarvākārajñatāyās tathatā ekaivaiṣā tathatādvayādvaidhīkārā / smṛtyupasthānāny eva sarvākārajñatā sarvākārajñataiva smṛtyupasthānāi /
analyzed: yā ca sarva ākāra jña tāyāḥ tathatā ekā eva eṣā tathatā dvayā a vaidhīkārā smṛti upasthānāni eva sarva ākāra jña tā sarva ākāra jña tā eva smṛti upasthānā
translated: and the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects, this suchness is one single suchness, not two, not divided. The applications of mindfulness are the knowledge of all aspects, the knowledge of all aspects is the applications of mindfulness.

original: evaṃ samyakprahāṇarddhipādendriyabalabodhyaṅgamārgā eva sarvākārajñatā sarvākārajñataiva samyakprahāṇarddhipādendriyabalabodhyaṅgamārgāḥ / tat
analyzed: evam samyak prahāṇa ṛddhipāda indriya bala bodhyaṅga mārgāḥ eva sarva ākāra jña tā sarva ākāra jña tā eva samyak prahāṇa ṛddhipāda indriya bala bodhyaṅga mārgāḥ tat
translated: Thus, the right efforts, bases of supernatural power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, and path are just the knowledge of all aspects, and the knowledge of all aspects is just the right efforts, bases of supernatural power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, and path.

original: kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: yā ca smṛtyupasthānatathatā yā ca sarvākārajñatātathathā ekaivaiṣā tathatādvayādvaidhīkārā / evaṃ yā ca samyakprahāṇarddhipādendriyabalabodhyaṅgamārgatathatā /
analyzed: yā ca smṛti upasthāna tathatā yā ca sarva ākāra jña tā tathathā ekā eva eṣā tathatā dvayā dvaidhīkārā evam yā ca samyakprahāṇa ṛddhipāda indriya bala bodhyaṅga mārga tathatā
translated: The suchness of the establishments of mindfulness and the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects are one suchness, non-dual and indivisible. Thus, the suchness of the right efforts, bases of supernatural power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, and path,

original: yā ca sarvākārajñatātathatā ekaivaiṣā tathatādvayādvaidhīkārā / apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattaya eva sarvākārajñatā sarvākārajñataivāpramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattayaḥ /
analyzed: yā ca sarva ākāra jña tā atathatā ekā eva eṣā tathatā dvayā dvaidhīkārāḥ apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattayaḥ eva sarva ākāra jña tā sarva ākāra jña tā eva apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattayaḥ
translated: and the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects are one suchness, non-dual and indivisible. The immeasurables, concentrations, and formless attainments are just the knowledge of all aspects, and the knowledge of all aspects is just the immeasurables, concentrations, and formless attainments.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: yā cāpramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattitathatā yā ca sarvākārajñatātathatā ekaivaiṣā tathatādvayāadvaidhīkārā /
analyzed: yā ca apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpatti tathatā yā ca sarva ākārajña tā tathatā ekā eva eṣā tathatā dvayā a dvaidhīkārā
translated: The suchness of the immeasurables, concentrations, and formless attainments and the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects are one suchness, non-dual and indivisible.

original: evam āryasatyaśūnyatānimittāpraṇihitābhijñāvimokṣasamādhisamāpattidhāraṇīmukhadaśabalavaiśāradyapratisaṃvid /
analyzed: evam ārya satya śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita abhijñā vimokṣa samādhi samāpatti dhāraṇī mukha daśa bala vaiśāradya pratisaṃvid
translated: In the same way, the noble truths, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, the higher knowledges, liberations, concentrations, meditative absorptions, and dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: āveṇikabuddhadharmā eva sarvākārajñatā sarvākārajñataivāveṇikabuddhadharmāḥ / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: āveṇika buddha dharmāḥ eva sarva ākāra jña tā sarva ākāra jña tā eva āveṇika buddha dharmāḥ tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: the unique qualities of a buddha, and the knowledge of all aspects are the same as the unique qualities of a buddha. Why is that?

original: yā cāveṇikabuddhadharmāṇāṃ tathatā /
analyzed: yā ca āveṇika buddha dharmāṇām tathatā
translated: And the suchness of the unique qualities of a buddha

original: yā ca sarvākārajñatāyās tathathā ekaivaiṣā tathatādvayādvaidhīkārā / evaṃ srotaāpattiphalaṃ sakṛdāgāmiphalam anāgāmiphalam arhattvaṃ pratyekabuddhā /
analyzed: yā ca sarva ākārajña tāyāḥ tathathā ekā eva eṣā tathatā dvayā dvaidhīkārā evam srotaāpatti phalam sakṛdāgāmi phalam anāgāmi phalam arhat tvam pratyekabuddhāḥ
translated: and the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects are one and the same suchness, without duality or differentiation. In the same way, the fruits of entering the stream, of being tied to one more rebirth, of no longer being subject to rebirth, of arhatship, of individual enlightenment,

original: buddhā eva sarvākārajñatā sarvākārajñataiva buddhāḥ / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: buddhāḥ eva sarva ākāra jña tā sarva ākāra jña tā eva buddhāḥ tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: and the buddhas are the same as the knowledge of all aspects. Why is that?

original: yā ca buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ tathatā /
analyzed: yā ca buddhānām bhagavatām tathatā
translated: And the suchness of the lord buddhas

original: yā ca sarvākārajñatāyās tathatā ekaivaiṣā tathatādvayādvaidhīkārā / idam api devaputrā
analyzed: yā ca sarva ākāra jña tāyāḥ tathatā ekā eva eṣā tathatā dvayā a dvaidhīkārāḥ idam api deva putrā
translated: and the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects are one and the same suchness, without duality or differentiation. Gods,

original: arthavaśaṃ saṃpaśyaṃs tathāgato 'lpotsukatāyāṃ cittaṃ nāmayāmāsa na dharmadeśanāyām / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: artha vaśam saṃpaśyan tathāgataḥ lpa utsuka tāyām cittam nāmayāmāsa na dharma deśanāyām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: seeing this situation, the Tathāgata turned his mind to indifference, not to teaching the Dharma. Why is that?

original: gambhīro batāyaṃ /
analyzed: gambhīraḥ bata ayam
translated: This Dharma is indeed profound.

original: dharmo durdṛśo duranubodho 'tarko 'tarkāvacaraḥ śāntaḥ śūkṣmaḥ paṇḍitavijñavedanīyaḥ sarvalokavipratyanīko yad uteyaṃ tathāgatānāṃ bodhiḥ /
analyzed: dharmaḥ durdṛśaḥ duranubodhaḥ tarko tarka avacaraḥ śāntaḥ śūkṣmaḥ paṇḍita vijña vedanīyaḥ sarva loka vipratyanīkaḥ yat uta iyam tathāgatānām bodhiḥ
translated: This enlightenment of the Tathāgatas is profound, difficult to see, difficult to understand, beyond the sphere of reasoning, inaccessible to logic, subtle, and comprehensible only to the wise. It is contrary to the whole world.

original: sā na kenacid abhisaṃbuddhā na kadācid abhisaṃbuddhā na kvacid abhisaṃbuddhā iyaṃ
analyzed: sā na kenacid abhisaṃbuddhā na kadācid abhisaṃbuddhā na kvacid abhisaṃbuddhā iyam
translated: It has never been fully awakened to by anyone, nor will it ever be. It is not awakened to anywhere.

original: sā dharmāṇāṃ gambhīratā dharmatā yatra na dvayasamudācāro nādvayasamudācāraḥ saṃvidyate /
analyzed: sā dharmāṇām gambhīra tā dharma tā yatra na dvaya samudācāraḥ na advaya samudācāraḥ saṃvidyate
translated: This is the profundity of dharmas, their true nature, where the practice of duality and the practice of non-duality do not exist.

original: ity ālambanasvabhāvaḥ🔽ākāśagambhīratayā devaputrā gambhīro 'yaṃ dharmaḥ /🔽tathatāgambhīratayā dharmadhātugambhīratayā bhūtakoṭīgambhīratayā acintyadharmadhātugambhīratayā devaputrā gambhīro 'yaṃ dharmaḥ /
analyzed: iti ālambana svabhāvaḥ  ākāśa gambhīra tayā devaputrāḥ gambhīraḥ yam dharmaḥ  tathatā gambhīra tayā dharmadhātu gambhīra tayā bhūtakoṭī gambhīra tayā acintya dharmadhātu gambhīra tayā devaputrāḥ gambhīraḥ yam dharmaḥ
translated: Thus, the essence of the object.🔽Devaputras, this Dharma is profound due to the profundity of space.🔽Devaputras, this Dharma is profound due to the profundity of suchness, the profundity of the dharma-element, the profundity of the peak of existence, and the profundity of the inconceivable dharma-element.

original: anantāparyantayā anāgamanāgamanatayā anutpādānirodhasamatayā asaṃkleśāvyavadānasamatayā /
analyzed: ananta aparyantayā an āgamana āgamanatayā anutpāda anirodha samatayā asaṃkleśa avyavadāna samatayā
translated: Devaputras, this Dharma is profound due to its infinitude and boundlessness, its non-coming and non-going, its equality of non-production and non-cessation, its equality of non-affliction and non-purification, its equality of non-grasping and non-rejection, and its equality of non-defilement and non-purification.

original: anabhisaṃskārasamatayā ātmagambhīratayā sattvajīvajantupoṣapuruṣapudgalamanujamānavakārakavedakajānakapaśyakagambhīratayā
analyzed: an abhisaṃskāra sama tayā ātma gambhīra tayā sattva jīva jantu poṣa puruṣa pudgala manuja mānava kāraka vedaka jānaka paśyaka gambhīra tayā
translated: It is profound due to the sameness of non-formation, due to the profundity of self, due to the profundity of beings, life, creatures, people, men, individuals, humans, actors, experiencers, knowers, and seers.

original: devaputrā gambhīro 'yaṃ dharmaḥ / rūpagambhīratayā devaputrā gambhīro 'yaṃ dharmaḥ /🔽vedanāsaṃjñāsaṃskāravijñānagambhīratayā devaputrā gambhīro 'yaṃ dharmaḥ /
analyzed: deva putrāḥ gambhīraḥ yam dharmaḥ rūpa gambhīra tayā deva putrāḥ gambhīraḥ yam dharmaḥ  vedanā saṃjñā saṃskāra vijñāna gambhīra tayā deva putrāḥ gambhīraḥ yam dharmaḥ
translated: Devaputras, this Dharma is profound due to the profundity of form.🔽Devaputras, this Dharma is profound due to the profundity of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.

original: skandhagambhīratayā dhātugambhīratayāyatanagambhīratayā pratītyasamutpādagambhīratayā pratītyasamutpādāṅgagambhīratayā devaputrā gambhīro 'yaṃ
analyzed: skandha gambhīra tayā dhātu gambhīra tayā āyatana gambhīra tayā pratītyasamutpāda gambhīra tayā pratītyasamutpāda aṅga gambhīra tayā deva putrāḥ gambhīraḥ yam
translated: Devaputras, this Dharma is profound due to the profundity of the aggregates, elements, sense bases, dependent origination, and the factors of dependent origination.

original: dānapāramitāgambhīratayā devaputrā gambhīro 'yaṃ dharmaḥ /
analyzed: dāna pāramitā gambhīra tayā devaputrāḥ gambhīraḥ yam dharmaḥ
translated: Devaputras, this Dharma is profound due to the profundity of the perfection of giving.

original: śīlapāramitāgambhīratayā kṣāntipāramitāgambhīratayā vīryapāramitāgambhīratayā dhyānapāramitāgambhīratayā prajñāpāramitāgambhīratayā devaputrā
analyzed: śīla pāramitā gambhīra tayā kṣānti pāramitā gambhīra tayā vīrya pāramitā gambhīra tayā dhyāna pāramitā gambhīra tayā prajñāpāramitā gambhīra tayā deva putrā
translated: Devaputras, this Dharma is profound due to the profundity of the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of diligence, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: gambhīro 'yaṃ dharmaḥ /
analyzed: gambhīraḥ yam dharmaḥ
translated: Devaputras, this Dharma is profound.

original: adhyātmaśūnyatāgambhīratayā yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāgambhīratayā devaputrā gambhīro 'yaṃ dharmaḥ /
analyzed: adhyātma śūnyatā gambhīra tayā yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā gambhīra tayā deva putrāḥ gambhīraḥ yam dharmaḥ
translated: Devaputras, this Dharma is profound due to the profundity of the emptiness of internal phenomena, up to the profundity of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence.

original: smṛtyupasthānagambhīratayā samyakprahāṇarddhipādendriyabalabodhyaṅgamārgagambhīratayā devaputrā gambhīro 'yaṃ dharmaḥ /
analyzed: smṛti upasthāna gambhīra tayā samyak prahāṇa ṛddhipāda indriya bala bodhyaṅga mārga gambhīra tayā deva putrāḥ gambhīraḥ yam dharmaḥ
translated: Devaputras, this Dharma is profound due to the profundity of the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the bases of supernatural power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, and the path.

original: apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattigambhīratayā devaputrā gambhīro 'yaṃ dharmaḥ /
analyzed: apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpatti gambhīra tayā devaputrāḥ gambhīraḥ yam dharmaḥ
translated: Devaputras, this Dharma is profound due to the profundity of the immeasurables, the concentrations, and the formless attainments.

original: āryasatyagambhīratayā śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitagambhīratayā abhijñāgambhīratayā sarvavimokṣasamādhisamāpattidhāraṇīmukhagambhīratayā
analyzed: ārya satya gambhīra tayā śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita gambhīra tayā abhijñā gambhīra tayā sarva vimokṣa samādhi samāpatti dhāraṇī mukha gambhīra tayā
translated: Devaputras, this Dharma is profound due to the profundity of the noble truths, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, the higher knowledges, all the liberations, concentrations, attainments, and dhāraṇī gateways,

original: daśabalavaiśāradyapratisaṃvidgambhīratayā aṣṭādaśāveṇikabuddhadharmagambhīratayā /
analyzed: daśa bala vaiśāradya pratisaṃvid gambhīra tayā aṣṭādaśa āveṇika buddha dharma gambhīra tayā
translated: the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the discernments, and the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha,

original: yāvat sarvākārajñatāgambhīratayā devaputrā gambhīro 'yaṃ dharmaḥ /
analyzed: yāvat sarva ākāra jña tā gambhīra tayā deva putrāḥ gambhīraḥ yam dharmaḥ
translated: up to the profundity of omniscience.

original: evam ukte devaputrā bhagavantam etad avocan /
analyzed: evam ukte deva putrāḥ bhagavantam etat avocan
translated: When this was said, the Devaputras said to the Blessed One:

original: sarvalokavipratyanīko 'yaṃ bhagavan dharmo deśyate / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: sarva loka vipratyanīkaḥ yam bhagavan dharmaḥ deśyate tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Blessed One, this Dharma that is taught is contrary to all worlds. Why is that?

original: nāyaṃ bhagavan dharmo rūpasyodgrahāya nānudgrahāya vā deśyate /🔽na vedanāyā na saṃjñāyā na saṃskārāṇāṃ /
analyzed: na ayam bhagavan dharmaḥ rūpasya udgrahāya na an udgrahāya vā deśyate  na vedanāyāḥ na saṃjñāyāḥ na saṃskārāṇām
translated: Blessed One, this Dharma is not taught for the sake of grasping or not grasping form.

original: na vijñānasyodgrahāya nānudgrahāya vā deśyate / na /
analyzed: na vijñānasya udgrahāya na an udgrahāya vā deśyate na
translated: It is not taught for the sake of grasping or not grasping feeling, perception, volitional formations, or consciousness.

original: skandhadhātvāyatanapratītyasamutpādapratītyasamutpādāṅgānām udgrahāya nānudgrahāya
analyzed: skandha dhātu āyatana pratītyasamutpāda pratītyasamutpāda aṅgānām udgrahāya na an udgrahāya
translated: It is not taught for the sake of grasping or not grasping the aggregates, elements, sense bases, dependent origination, or the factors of dependent origination.

original: vā deśyate / evaṃ na sarvaśūnyatānāṃ saptatriṃśadbodhipkṣyāṇāṃ dharmāṇāṃ daśabalavaiśāradyapratisaṃvidāveṇikabuddhadharmāṇām
analyzed: vā deśyate evam na sarva śūnyatānām saptatriṃśat bodhipkṣyāṇām dharmāṇām daśa bala vaiśāradya pratisaṃvid āveṇika buddha dharmāṇām
translated: In the same way, it is not taught for the sake of grasping or not grasping the emptinesses, the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the analytical knowledges, the unique qualities of a Buddha,

original: udgrahāya vā nānudgrahāya vā dharma upadeśyate /🔽na sarvadharmāṇām udgrahāya nānudgrahāya vā dharmo deśyate /
analyzed: udgrahāya vā na an udgrahāya vā dharmaḥ upadeśyate  na sarva dharmāṇām udgrahāya na an udgrahāya vā dharmaḥ deśyate
translated: or for the sake of grasping or not grasping any dharmas.

original: nāyaṃ bhagavan dharmaḥ srotaāpattiphalasya udgrahāya nānudgrahāya vā deśyate / evaṃ
analyzed: na ayam bhagavan dharmaḥ srotaāpatti phalasya udgrahāya na an udgrahāya vā deśyate evam
translated: This Dharma is not taught for the sake of grasping or not grasping the fruit of entering the stream,

original: na sakṛdāgāmiphalasya nānāgāmiphalasya nārhattvasya na pratyekabodher yāvat sarvākārajñatāyā
analyzed: na sakṛdāgāmi phalasya na anāgāmi phalasya na arhat tvasya na pratyeka bodheḥ yāvat sarva ākārajña tāyāḥ
translated: the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, arhatship, individual enlightenment, up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: nodgrahāya nānudgrahāya vā dharmo deśyate /
analyzed: na udgrahāya na an udgrahāya vā dharmaḥ deśyate
translated: It is not taught for the sake of grasping or not grasping any dharmas.

original: udgrahe ca lokaś carati mama rūpaṃ /
analyzed: udgrahe ca lokaḥ carati mama rūpam
translated: And the world engages in grasping: 'This is my form,

original: mama vedanā mama saṃjñā mama saṃskārā mama vijñānaṃ /
analyzed: mama vedanā mama saṃjñā mama saṃskārāḥ mama vijñānam
translated: this is my feeling, this is my perception, these are my volitional formations, this is my consciousness.

original: mama skandhā mama dhātavo mamāyatanāni mama pratītyasamutpādo 'haṃ pratītyasamutpannaḥ /
analyzed: mama skandhāḥ mama dhātavaḥ mama āyatanāni mama pratītyasamutpādaḥ ham pratītyasamutpannaḥ
translated: These are my aggregates, these are my elements, these are my sense bases, this is my dependent origination, I am dependently originated.🔽This is my giving, I am the giver, this is my morality, I am the one with morality, this is my patience, I am the patient one, this is my vigor, I am the one with vigor, this is my concentration,

original: mama dānam ahaṃ dānapatir mama śīlam ahaṃ śīlavān mama kṣāntir ahaṃ kṣāntimān mama vīryam ahaṃ vīryavān mama dhyānam ahaṃ dhyānavān mama prajñā
analyzed: mama dānam aham dāna patiḥ mama śīlam aham śīlavān mama kṣāntiḥ aham kṣāntimān mama vīryam aham vīryavān mama dhyānam aham dhyānavān mama prajñā
translated: I am the one with concentration, this is my wisdom,

original: ahaṃ prajñāvān /
analyzed: aham prajñāvān
translated: I am the wise one.

original: mamādhyātmaśūnyatā aham adhyātmaśūnyatāṃ bhāvayāmi yāvan mamābhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāham abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāṃ bhāvayāmi /
analyzed: mama adhyātma śūnyatā aham adhyātma śūnyatām bhāvayāmi yāvat mama abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā aham abhāva svabhāva śūnyatām bhāvayāmi
translated: This is my emptiness of internal phenomena, I cultivate the emptiness of internal phenomena, up to: this is my emptiness of the inherent nature of non-existence, I cultivate the emptiness of the inherent nature of non-existence.

original: mama smṛtyupasthānāni mama samyakprahāṇarddhipādendriyabalabodhyaṅgamārgā mamāpramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattayo
analyzed: mama smṛti upasthānāni mama samyak prahāṇa ṛddhipāda indriya bala bodhyaṅga mārgāḥ mama apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattayaḥ
translated: These are my establishments of mindfulness, these are my right efforts, legs of supernatural power, faculties, powers, factors of awakening and path, these are my immeasurables, concentrations, and formless attainments,

original: mamāryasatyāni mamābhijñā mama vimokṣasamādhisamāpattidhāraṇīmukhāni mama śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitāni
analyzed: mama ārya satyāni mama abhijñāḥ mama vimokṣa samādhi samāpatti dhāraṇī mukhāni mama śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihitāni
translated: these are my noble truths, these are my superknowledges, these are my liberations, concentrations, attainments, and dhāraṇī gateways, these are my emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness,

original: ahaṃ śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavān mama daśabalavaiśāradyapratisaṃvido mamāṣṭādaśāveṇikabuddhadharmā
analyzed: aham śūnyatā nimitta a praṇihitavān mama daśa bala vaiśāradya pratisaṃvidaḥ mama aṣṭādaśa āveṇika buddha dharmāḥ
translated: I am emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness. Mine are the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: mama srotaāpattiphalam ahaṃ srotaāpanno mama sakṛdāgāmiphalam ahaṃ sakṛdāgāmī mamānāgāmiphalam
analyzed: mama srotaāpatti phalam aham srotaāpannaḥ mama sakṛdāgāmi phalam aham sakṛdāgāmī mama anāgāmi phalam
translated: Mine is the fruit of entering the stream. I am one who has entered the stream. Mine is the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth. I am one who is tied to one more rebirth. Mine is the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth.

original: aham anāgāmī mamārhattvam aham arhan mama pratyekabodhir ahaṃ pratyekabuddho mama
analyzed: aham anāgāmī mama arhat tvam aham arhan mama pratyeka bodhiḥ aham pratyekabuddhaḥ mama
translated: I am no longer subject to rebirth. Mine is the state of an arhat. I am an arhat. Mine is individual enlightenment. I am a pratyekabuddha.

original: sarvākārajñatā ahaṃ sarvākārajñatāḥ /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tāḥ aham sarva ākāra jña tāḥ
translated: Mine is the knowledge of all aspects. I am the knowledge of all aspects.”

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Lord said,

original: evam etad devaputrā evam etan /
analyzed: evam etat deva putrāḥ evam etan
translated: “It is just so, gods, it is just so.

original: nāyaṃ devaputrā dharmo rūpasyodgrahāya deśyate nānudgrahāya /
analyzed: na ayam deva putrāḥ dharmaḥ rūpasya udgrahāya deśyate na an udgrahāya
translated: Gods, this Dharma is not taught for the sake of grasping form, nor for the sake of not grasping it.

original: na vedanāyā na saṃjñāyā na saṃskārāṇāṃ /
analyzed: na vedanāyāḥ na saṃjñāyāḥ na saṃskārāṇām
translated: It is not taught for the sake of grasping feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness, nor for the sake of not grasping it.

original: na vijñānasyodgrahāya deśyate nānudgrahāya / ye tu devaputrā rūpasyodgrahāya caranti /
analyzed: na vijñānasya udgrahāya deśyate na an udgrahāya ye tu deva putrāḥ rūpasya udgrahāya caranti
translated: But, gods, those who practice for the sake of grasping form,🔽for the sake of grasping feeling, perception, volitional factors,

original: vedanāyāḥ saṃjñāyāḥ saṃskārāṇāṃ /🔽ye vijñānasyodgrahāya caranti /
analyzed: vedanāyāḥ saṃjñāyāḥ saṃskārāṇām 🔽ye vijñānasya udgrahāya caranti
translated: or consciousness,

original: na te bhavyāḥ prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāvayitum / ye skandhadhātvāyatanapratītyasamutpādānām udgrahāya caranti /
analyzed: na te bhavyāḥ prajñāpāramitām bhāvayitum ye skandha dhātu āyatana pratītyasamutpādānām udgrahāya caranti
translated: They are not fit to cultivate the perfection of wisdom, who practice for the sake of grasping the aggregates, elements, sense-fields, and dependent origination.

original: ye sarvapāramitāsarvaśūnyatāsamādhisamāpattidhāraṇīmukhānām udgrahāya caranti /🔽ye pramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattyāryasatyaśūnyatānimittāpraṇihitābhijñādaśabalavaiśāradyapratisaṃvidāveṇikabuddhadharmāṇām /🔽udgrahāya caranti /
analyzed: ye sarva pāramitā sarva śūnyatā samādhi samāpatti dhāraṇī mukhānām udgrahāya caranti  ye pramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpatti ārya satya śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita abhijñā daśa bala vaiśāradya pratisaṃvid āveṇika buddha dharmāṇām  udgrahāya caranti
translated: They who practice for the sake of grasping all the perfections, all the emptinesses, the meditative stabilizations, the dhāraṇī gateways,🔽they who practice for the sake of grasping the immeasurables, the dhyānas, the formless attainments, the noble truths, the emptiness, signless, and wishless [gates], the superknowledges, the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the unique qualities of a buddha,

original: ye devaputrāḥ sarvākārajñatāyā udgrahāya caranti /
analyzed: ye deva putrāḥ sarva ākārajña tāyāḥ udgrahāya caranti
translated: they who practice for the sake of grasping omniscience,

original: na te bhavyāḥ prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāvayituṃ yāvan na pratibalā dhyānavīryakṣāntiśīladānapāramitāṃ bhāvayituṃ /
analyzed: na te bhavyāḥ prajñāpāramitām bhāvayitum yāvat na pratibalāḥ dhyāna vīrya kṣānti śīla dāna pāramitām bhāvayitum
translated: those gods are not fit to cultivate the perfection of wisdom, and are not able to cultivate the perfection of concentration, perseverance, patience, morality, or giving,

original: yāvan na pratibalāḥ sarvākārajñatāṃ bhāvayitum / iti sarvalokavipratyanīkasvabhāvaḥ
analyzed: yāvat na pratibalāḥ sarva ākāra jña tām bhāvayitum iti sarva loka vipratyanīka svabhāvaḥ
translated: and are not able to cultivate omniscience. Thus, it is contrary to all worlds in its nature.

original: subhūtir āha /🔽sarvadharmānulomiko 'yaṃ bhagavan dharmaḥ /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha  sarva dharma ānulomikaḥ yam bhagavan dharmaḥ
translated: Subhūti said:🔽Blessed One, this Dharma accords with all dharmas.

original: kasyānulomiko 'yaṃ bhagavan dharmaḥ /
analyzed: kasya ānulomikaḥ yam bhagavan dharmaḥ
translated: Blessed One, with what does this Dharma accord?

original: prajñāpāramitānulomiko 'yaṃ bhagavan dharmaḥ /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā ānulomikaḥ yam bhagavan dharmaḥ
translated: Blessed One, this Dharma accords with the perfection of wisdom.

original: yāvad dhyānapāramitā vīryapāramitā kṣāntipāramitā śīlapāramitā dānapāramitānulomiko 'yaṃ bhagavan dharmaḥ /
analyzed: yāvat dhyāna pāramitā vīrya pāramitā kṣānti pāramitā śīla pāramitā dāna pāramitā ānulomikaḥ yam bhagavan dharmaḥ
translated: Blessed One, this Dharma accords with the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of giving.

original: adhyātmaśūnyatānulomiko 'yaṃ bhagavan dharmaḥ /
analyzed: adhyātma śūnyatā ānulomikaḥ yam bhagavan dharmaḥ
translated: Blessed One, this Dharma accords with the emptiness of internal phenomena.

original: yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatānulomiko 'yaṃ bhagavan dharmaḥ /
analyzed: yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā ānulomikaḥ yam bhagavan dharmaḥ
translated: Blessed One, this Dharma accords with the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great extent, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-discarded phenomena, the emptiness of inherent existence, and the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: smṛtyupasthānānulomiko 'yaṃ bhagavan dharmaḥ /
analyzed: smṛti upasthāna ānulomikaḥ yam bhagavan dharmaḥ
translated: Blessed One, this Dharma accords with the applications of mindfulness.

original: samyakprahāṇarddhipādendriyabalabodhyaṅgamārgānulomiko 'yaṃ bhagavan dharmaḥ /
analyzed: samyak prahāṇa ṛddhipāda indriya bala bodhyaṅga mārga ānulomikaḥ yam bhagavan dharmaḥ
translated: Blessed One, this Dharma accords with the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path.

original: āryasatyānulomiko 'yaṃ bhagavan dharmaḥ /
analyzed: ārya satya ānulomikaḥ yam bhagavan dharmaḥ
translated: Blessed One, this Dharma accords with the noble truths.

original: apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattisarvavimokṣasamādhisamāpattidhāraṇīmukhānulomiko 'yaṃ bhagavan dharmaḥ /
analyzed: apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpatti sarva vimokṣa samādhi samāpatti dhāraṇī mukha ānulomikaḥ yam bhagavan dharmaḥ
translated: Blessed One, this Dharma accords with the immeasurables, the concentrations, the formless attainments, all the liberations, the meditative stabilizations, the meditative absorptions, and the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitābhijñānulomiko 'yaṃ bhagavan dharmaḥ /
analyzed: śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita abhijñā ānulomikaḥ yam bhagavan dharmaḥ
translated: Blessed One, this Dharma accords with emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, and the higher knowledges.

original: daśabalavaiśāradyapratisaṃvidāveṇikabuddhadharmānulomiko 'yaṃ bhagavan dharmaḥ /
analyzed: daśa bala vaiśāradya pratisaṃvid āveṇika buddha dharma ānulomikaḥ yam bhagavan dharmaḥ
translated: Blessed One, this Dharma accords with the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four unobstructed discernments, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: sarvākārajñatānulomiko 'yaṃ bhagavan dharmaḥ / nāyaṃ dharmaḥ kvacit pratihanyate rūpe na pratihanyate /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā ānulomikaḥ yam bhagavan dharmaḥ na ayam dharmaḥ kvacid pratihanyate rūpe na pratihanyate
translated: This Dharma, Blessed One, is in accord with omniscience. This Dharma is not obstructed anywhere. It is not obstructed in form.

original: evaṃ vedanāyāṃ saṃjñāyāṃ saṃskāreṣu vijñāne na pratihanyate /
analyzed: evam vedanāyām saṃjñāyām saṃskāreṣu vijñāne na pratihanyate
translated: Thus, it is not obstructed in feeling, perception, volitional formations, or consciousness.

original: skandhadhātvāyatanapratītyasamutpādapratītyasamutpādāṅgeṣu na pratihanyate /
analyzed: skandha dhātu āyatana pratītyasamutpāda pratītyasamutpāda aṅgeṣu na pratihanyate
translated: It is not obstructed in the aggregates, elements, sense bases, dependent origination, or the factors of dependent origination.

original: sarvapāramitāsu sarvaśūnyatāsu na pratihanyate /
analyzed: sarva pāramitāsu sarva śūnyatāsu na pratihanyate
translated: It is not obstructed in any of the perfections or any of the emptinesses.

original: saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣyeṣu dharmeṣu na pratihanyate /
analyzed: saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣyeṣu dharmeṣu na pratihanyate
translated: It is not obstructed in the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment.

original: āryasatyeṣu apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattisarvavimokṣasamādhisamāpattidhāraṇīmukheṣu na pratihanyate /
analyzed: ārya satyeṣu apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpatti sarva vimokṣa samādhi samāpatti dhāraṇī mukheṣu na pratihanyate
translated: It is not obstructed in the noble truths, the immeasurables, the concentrations, the formless attainments, all the liberations, the concentrations, the meditative absorptions, or the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitesv abhijñāsu daśabalavaiśāradyapratisaṃvidāveṇikabuddhadharmeṣu na pratihanyate /
analyzed: śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihitesu abhijñāsu daśa bala vaiśāradya pratisaṃvid āveṇika buddha dharmeṣu na pratihanyate
translated: It is not obstructed in emptiness, signlessness, or wishlessness, in the superknowledges, the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the specific knowledges, or the unique qualities of a buddha.

original: sarvākārajñatāyāṃ na pratihanyate / apratihatalakṣaṇo batāyaṃ dharmaḥ /
analyzed: sarva ākārajña tāyām na pratihanyate a pratihata lakṣaṇaḥ bata ayam dharmaḥ
translated: It is not obstructed in omniscience. This Dharma, indeed, has the characteristic of being unobstructed.

original: ākāśasamatām upādāya /
analyzed: ākāśa samatām upādāya
translated: On account of its equality with space.

original: tathatāsamatām upādāya /
analyzed: tathatā samatām upādāya
translated: On account of its equality with suchness.

original: dharmadhātusthititām upādāya /
analyzed: dharmadhātu sthiti tām upādāya
translated: On account of its abiding in the dharma-realm.

original: bhūtakoṭisamatām upādāya /
analyzed: bhūtakoṭi sama tām upādāya
translated: Because of the sameness of the peak of existence.

original: acintyadhātusamatām upādāya /
analyzed: acintya dhātu sama tām upādāya
translated: Because of the sameness of the inconceivable realm.

original: śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitasamatām upādāya /🔽anutpādānirodhasamatām upādāya /
analyzed: śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita samatām upādāya  anutpāda anirodha samatām upādāya
translated: Because of the sameness of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.🔽Because of the sameness of non-arising and non-cessation.

original: asaṃkleśāvyavadānasamatām upādāya /
analyzed: asaṃkleśa avyavadāna samatām upādāya
translated: Because of the sameness of non-defilement and non-purification.

original: anutpādo 'yaṃ dharmo rūpānutpādānirodhatām upādāya /
analyzed: anutpādaḥ yam dharmaḥ rūpa anutpāda anirodha tām upādāya
translated: This non-arising dharma is because of the non-arising and non-cessation of form.

original: vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārā /
analyzed: vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārā
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional formations,

original: vijñānānutpādānirodhatām upādāya /
analyzed: vijñāna anutpāda anirodha tām upādāya
translated: and consciousness are because of the non-arising and non-cessation of consciousness.

original: skandhadhātvāyatanapratītyasamutpādapratītyasamutpādāṅgānām /
analyzed: skandha dhātu āyatana pratītyasamutpāda pratītyasamutpāda aṅgānām
translated: The aggregates, elements, sense bases, dependent origination, and factors of dependent origination

original: anutpādānirodhatām upādāya /
analyzed: anutpāda anirodha tām upādāya
translated: are because of the non-arising and non-cessation.

original: sarvapāramitā sarvaśūnyatānutpādānirodhatām upādāya🔽saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣyadharmāpramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattyāryasatyābhijñāśūnyatānimittāpraṇihitasarvavimokṣasamādhisamāpattidhāraṇīmukhānutpādānirodhatām
analyzed: sarva pāramitā sarva śūnyatā anutpāda anirodha tām upādāya  saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣya dharma apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpatti ārya satya abhijñā śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita sarva vimokṣa samādhi samāpatti dhāraṇī mukha anutpāda anirodha tām
translated: All perfections, all emptinesses are because of the non-arising and non-cessation.🔽The thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, the immeasurables, the concentrations, the formless attainments, the noble truths, the superknowledges, emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, all liberations, concentrations, attainments, and dhāraṇī gateways are because of the non-arising and non-cessation.

original: daśabalavaiśāradyapratisaṃvidāveṇikabuddhadharmānutpādānirodhatām upādāya / ity apratighātasvabhāvaḥ
analyzed: daśa bala vaiśāradya pratisaṃvid āveṇika buddha dharma anutpāda anirodha tām upādāya iti a pratighāta svabhāvaḥ
translated: The ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the discernments, and the unique qualities of a buddha are because of the non-arising and non-cessation. Thus, the nature of non-obstruction.

original: apado 'yaṃ dharmo rūpapadānupalabdhitām upādāya /
analyzed: apadaḥ yam dharmaḥ rūpa pada anupalabdhi tām upādāya
translated: This Dharma is without a basis, because the basis of form is not perceived.

original: vedanāsaṃjñāsaṃskāravijñānapadānupalabdhitām upādāya /
analyzed: vedanā saṃjñā saṃskāra vijñāna pada anupalabdhi tām upādāya
translated: Because the basis of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness is not perceived.

original: skandhadhātvāyatanapratītyasamutpādapratītyasamutpādāṅgapadānupalabdhitām upādāya /
analyzed: skandha dhātu āyatana pratītyasamutpāda pratītyasamutpāda aṅga pada anupalabdhi tām upādāya
translated: Because the basis of the aggregates, the bases, and the entrances, dependent origination, and the links of dependent origination is not perceived.

original: sarvapāramitāsarvavimokṣasamādhisamāpattidhāraṇīmukhapadānupalabdhitām upādāya /
analyzed: sarva pāramitā sarva vimokṣa samādhi samāpatti dhāraṇī mukha pada anupalabdhi tām upādāya
translated: Because the basis of all the perfections, all the liberations, the concentrations, the meditative stabilizations, and the dhāraṇī gateways is not perceived.

original: bodhipakṣyadharmapadānupalabdhitām upādāya /
analyzed: bodhi pakṣya dharma pada anupalabdhi tām upādāya
translated: Because the basis of the dharmas on the side of awakening is not perceived.

original: apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattiśūnyatānimittāpraṇihitapadānupalabdhitām upādāya /
analyzed: apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpatti śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita pada anupalabdhi tām upādāya
translated: Because the basis of the emptiness, signless, and wishless gateways, the immeasurables, the concentrations, and the formless meditative attainments is not perceived.

original: āryasatyābhijñādaśabalavaiśāradyapratisaṃvidāveṇikabuddhadharmapadānupalabdhitām upādāya /
analyzed: ārya satya abhijñā daśa bala vaiśāradya pratisaṃvid āveṇika buddha dharma pada anupalabdhi tām upādāya
translated: Because the basis of the noble truths, the clairvoyances, the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the distinct attributes of a buddha is not perceived.

original: sarvākārajñatāpadānupalabdhitām upādāya /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā pada anupalabdhi tām upādāya
translated: Because the basis of the knowledge of all aspects is not perceived.

original: apado 'yaṃ dharmaḥ / ity apadasvabhāvaḥ
analyzed: a padaḥ yam dharmaḥ iti a pada svabhāvaḥ
translated: This Dharma is without a basis. Thus, it has the nature of being without a basis.

original: atha khalu te kāmāvacarā rūpāvacarāś ca devaputrā bhagavantam etad avocan /
analyzed: atha khalu te kāmāvacarāḥ rūpāvacarāḥ ca deva putrāḥ bhagavantam etat avocan
translated: Then, those gods of the desire realm and the form realm said this to the Blessed One:

original: anujāto 'yaṃ bhagavan bhagavataḥ subhūtiḥ sthaviraḥ / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: anujātaḥ yam bhagavan bhagavataḥ subhūtiḥ sthaviraḥ tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: This elder Subhūti, Blessed One, has been born after the Blessed One. Why is that?

original: tathā hi yadyad eva deśayati sarvatac chūnyatānimittāpraṇihitam ārabhya dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: tathā hi yat yat eva deśayati sarva tat śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihitam ārabhya dharmam deśayati
translated: Because whatever he teaches, all that he teaches the Dharma beginning with emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: atha khalv āyuṣmān subhūtis tān kāmāvacarān rūpāvacarāṃś ca devaputrān āmantrayāmāsa /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ tān kāmāvacarān rūpāvacarān ca deva putrān āmantrayāmāsa
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti addressed those gods of the desire realm and form realm:

original: yad evaṃ devaputrā vadatha /
analyzed: yat evam deva putrāḥ vadatha
translated: If, gods, you say:

original: anujāto 'yaṃ bhagavan bhagavataḥ subhūtiḥ sthaviraḥ /
analyzed: anujātaḥ yam bhagavan bhagavataḥ subhūtiḥ sthaviraḥ
translated: This elder Subhūti, Blessed One, has been born after the Blessed One.

original: kim ity anujātatvāt subhūtiḥ sthaviro 'nujātas tathāgatasya /
analyzed: kim iti anujāta tvāt subhūtiḥ sthaviraḥ nujātaḥ tathāgatasya
translated: Why is it that because of being born after, the elder Subhūti is born after the Tathāgata?

original: yathā tathāgatasya tathānāgatāgatā /
analyzed: yathā tathāgatasya tathā anāgatāgatā
translated: Just as the Tathāgata has come in the same way,

original: evam eva subhūter api tathatānāgatāgatā /
analyzed: evam eva subhūteḥ api tathatā anāgata āgatā
translated: in the same way Subhūti has also come.

original: evaṃ hi subhūtiḥ sthaviras tathāgatasyānujātaḥ / yā tathāgatasya tathatā sā sarvadharmatathatā /
analyzed: evam hi subhūtiḥ sthaviraḥ tathāgatasya anujātaḥ yā tathāgatasya tathatā sā sarva dharma tathatā
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the elder, is born after the Tathāgata. The suchness of the Tathāgata is the suchness of all dharmas.

original: yā sarvadharmatathatā sā tathāgatatathatā avitathatā ananyatathatā /
analyzed: yā sarva dharma tathatā sā tathāgata tathatā avitathatā ananya tathatā
translated: The suchness of all dharmas is the suchness of the Tathāgata, the undeluded suchness, the non-other suchness.

original: evaṃ hi subhūtiḥ sthaviras tathāgatam anujātaḥ / yā tathāgatatathatā sā sthititathatā yā sthititathatā sā tathāgatatathatā /🔽evaṃ hi subhūtiḥ sthaviras tathāgatam anujātaḥ / yathā tathāgatatathatāvikārā nirvikārā /
analyzed: evam hi subhūtiḥ sthaviraḥ tathāgatam anujātaḥ yā tathāgata tathatā sā sthiti tathatā yā sthiti tathatā sā tathāgata tathatā  evam hi subhūtiḥ sthaviraḥ tathāgatam anujātaḥ yathā tathāgata tathatā vikārā nirvikārā
translated: For thus the elder Subhuti has been born after the Tathāgata. That which is the Suchness of the Tathāgata is the Suchness of the established order. That which is the Suchness of the established order is the Suchness of the Tathāgata.🔽Thus the elder Subhuti has been born after the Tathāgata. Just as the Suchness of the Tathāgata is unchanging and without change,

original: evaṃ hi subhūteḥ sthavirasya tathatāvikārā nirvikārā yathā tathāgatasya tathatā na
analyzed: evam hi subhūteḥ sthavirasya tathatā vikārāḥ nirvikārāḥ yathā tathāgatasya tathatā na
translated: thus the Suchness of the elder Subhuti is unchanging and without change. Just as the Suchness of the Tathāgata

original: kvacit pratihanyate / evaṃ sarvadharmatathatā na kvacit pratihanyate / yā ca tathāgatatathatā
analyzed: kvacid pratihanyate evam sarva dharma tathatā na kvacid pratihanyate yā ca tathāgata tathatā
translated: is not obstructed anywhere, thus the Suchness of all dharmas is not obstructed anywhere. And that which is the Suchness of the Tathāgata,

original: yā ca sarvadharmatathatā /
analyzed: yā ca sarva dharma tathatā
translated: and that which is the Suchness of all dharmas,

original: ekaivaiṣā tathatādvayādvaidhīkārā na sā kadācin na tathatā /
analyzed: ekā eva eṣā tathatā dvayā a dvaidhīkārā na sā kadācid na tathatā
translated: this Suchness is one and the same, non-dual, and indivisible. It is never not Suchness.

original: yataḥ sā na kadācin na tathatā tataḥ sā tathatādvayādvaidhīkārā / evaṃ hi subhūtiḥ sthaviras tathāgatam anujātaḥ / yathā tathāgatatathatā sarvatragāvikalpā
analyzed: yatas sā na kadācid na tathatā tatas sā tathatā dvayā a vaidhīkārā evam hi subhūtiḥ sthaviraḥ tathāgatam anujātaḥ yathā tathāgata tathatā sarvatragā avikalpā
translated: Since it is never not Suchness, therefore that Suchness is non-dual and indivisible. Thus the elder Subhuti has been born after the Tathāgata. Just as the Suchness of the Tathāgata is all-pervading and non-discriminating,

original: evaṃ hi subhūtitathatā sarvatragāvikalpā nirvikalpā / yathā tathāgatatathatā abhinnā abhedatathatānupalabhyā /
analyzed: evam hi subhūti tathatā sarvatragā avikalpā nirvikalpā yathā tathāgata tathatā abhinnā abheda tathatā anupalabhyā
translated: For thus the suchness of Subhūti is all-pervading, non-conceptual, and free from conceptualization, just as the suchness of the Tathāgata is indivisible, with the indivisible suchness not being apprehended.

original: evaṃ subhūtitathatā abhinnā abhedatathatānupalabhyā / evaṃ hi subhūtisthaviras tathāgatam anujātaḥ / yathā tathāgatatathatānanyatathatā sarvadharmatathatā /
analyzed: evam subhūti tathatā abhinnā abheda tathatā anupalabhyā evam hi subhūti sthaviraḥ tathāgatam anujātaḥ yathā tathāgata tathatā ananya tathatā sarva dharma tathatā
translated: Thus the suchness of Subhūti is indivisible, with the indivisible suchness not being apprehended. Thus the elder Subhūti has been born after the Tathāgata, just as the suchness of the Tathāgata, which is the suchness of all dharmas, is not another suchness.

original: yā na sā kadācin na tathatā /
analyzed: yā na sā kadācid na tathatā
translated: That is never not suchness.

original: sadā sā tathatā tathaiva subhūtisthaviro 'nanyatathatā yā tathāgatam anujāto na kvacid anujātaḥ /
analyzed: sadā sā tathatā tathā eva subhūti sthaviraḥ na anya tathatā yā tathāgatam anujātaḥ na kvacid anujātaḥ
translated: Always that suchness is suchness just as it is. Thus the elder Subhūti, who has been born after the Tathāgata, is not another suchness, and has not been born anywhere.

original: evaṃ hi subhūtisthaviras tathāgatam anujātaḥ / yathā tathāgatatathatā nātītā nānāgatā na pratyutpannā /
analyzed: evam hi subhūti sthaviraḥ tathāgatam anujātaḥ yathā tathāgata tathatā na atītā na anāgatā na pratyutpannā
translated: Thus the elder Subhūti has been born after the Tathāgata, just as the suchness of the Tathāgata is not past, not future, and not present.

original: evaṃ sarvadharmatathatā nātītā nānāgatā na pratyutpannā / evaṃ hi subhūtisthaviratathatā nātītā nānāgatā na pratyutpannā /
analyzed: evam sarva dharma tathatā na atītā na anāgatā na pratyutpannā evam hi subhūti sthavira tathatā na atītā na anāgatā na pratyutpannā
translated: Thus the suchness of all dharmas is not past, not future, and not present. Thus the suchness of the elder Subhūti is not past, not future, and not present.

original: evaṃ hi subhūtisthaviras tathāgatam anujāta iti ucyate / atītatathatāsamatayā tathāgatatathatāsamatātathāgatatathatāsamatayātītatathatāsamatā /
analyzed: evam hi subhūti sthaviraḥ tathāgatam anujātaḥ iti ucyate atīta tathatā samatayā tathāgata tathatā samatā tathāgata tathatā samatayā atīta tathatā samatā
translated: The sameness of the past thusness is the sameness of the Tathāgata's thusness, and the sameness of the Tathāgata's thusness is the sameness of the past thusness.

original: anāgatatathatāsamatayā tathāgatatathatāsamatā tathāgatatathatāsamatayā anāgatatathatāsamatā /
analyzed: anāgata tathatā samatayā tathāgata tathatā samatā tathāgata tathatā samatayā anāgata tathatā samatā
translated: The sameness of the future thusness is the sameness of the Tathāgata's thusness, and the sameness of the Tathāgata's thusness is the sameness of the future thusness.

original: pratyutpannatathatāsamatayā tathāgatatathatāsamatā tathāgatatathatāsamatayā pratyutpannatathatāsamatā /
analyzed: pratyutpanna tathatā samatayā tathāgata tathatā samatā tathāgata tathatā samatayā pratyutpanna tathatā samatā
translated: The sameness of the present thusness is the sameness of the Tathāgata's thusness, and the sameness of the Tathāgata's thusness is the sameness of the present thusness.

original: iti hy atītānāgatapratyutpannatathatā ca tathāgatatathatā cādvayam etad advaidhīkāram /
analyzed: iti hi atīta anāgata pratyutpanna tathatā ca tathāgata tathatā ca advayam etat a dvaidhīkāram
translated: Thus, the thusness of the past, future, and present, and the Tathāgata's thusness, are non-dual, indivisible.

original: rūpatathatayā tathāgatatathatā tathāgatatathatayā rūpatathatā /
analyzed: rūpa tathatayā tathāgata tathatā tathāgata tathatayā rūpa tathatā
translated: The thusness of form is the Tathāgata's thusness, and the Tathāgata's thusness is the thusness of form.

original: vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ /
analyzed: vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional formations,

original: vijñānatathatayā tathāgatatathatā tathāgatatathatayā vijñānatathatā /
analyzed: vijñāna tathatayā tathāgata tathatā tathāgata tathatayā vijñāna tathatā
translated: and consciousness are the Tathāgata's thusness, and the Tathāgata's thusness is the thusness of consciousness.

original: iti hi tathāgatatathatā ca rūpavedanāsaṃjñāsaṃskāravijñānatathatā cādvayam etad advaidhīkāram / skandhatathatayā tathāgatatathatā tathāgatatathatayā
analyzed: iti hi tathāgata tathatā ca rūpa vedanā saṃjñā saṃskāra vijñāna tathatā ca advayam etat a dvaidhīkāram skandha tathatayā tathāgata tathatā tathāgata tathatayā
translated: Thus, the suchness of the Tathāgata and the suchness of form, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are non-dual, not divided into two.

original: dhātutathatayā tathāgatatathatā tathāgatatathatayā dhātutathatā /🔽āyatanatathatayā tathāgatatathatā tathāgatatathatayā āyatanatathatā /🔽pratītyasamutpādatathatayā tathāgatatathatā tathāgatatathatayā pratītyasamutpādatathatā /
analyzed: dhātu tathatayā tathāgata tathatā tathāgata tathatayā dhātu tathatā  āyatana tathatayā tathāgata tathatā tathāgata tathatayā āyatana tathatā  pratītyasamutpāda tathatayā tathāgata tathatā tathāgata tathatayā pratītyasamutpāda tathatā
translated: The suchness of the Tathāgata is the suchness of the elements. The suchness of the elements is the suchness of the Tathāgata.🔽The suchness of the Tathāgata is the suchness of the sense bases. The suchness of the sense bases is the suchness of the Tathāgata.🔽The suchness of the Tathāgata is the suchness of dependent origination. The suchness of dependent origination is the suchness of the Tathāgata.

original: pratītyasamutpādāṅgatathatayā tathāgatatathatā tathāgatatathatayā pratītyasamutpādāṅgatathatā /
analyzed: pratītyasamutpāda aṅga tathatayā tathāgata tathatā tathāgata tathatayā pratītyasamutpāda aṅga tathatā
translated: The suchness of the Tathāgata is the suchness of the factors of dependent origination. The suchness of the factors of dependent origination is the suchness of the Tathāgata.

original: iti hi skandhadhātvāyatanapratītyasamutpādapratītyasamutpādāṅgatathatā ca tathāgatatathatā cādvayam etad /
analyzed: iti hi skandha dhātu āyatana pratītyasamutpāda pratītyasamutpāda aṅga tathatā ca tathāgata tathatā ca advayam etat
translated: Thus, the suchness of the aggregates, elements, sense bases, dependent origination, and the factors of dependent origination, and the suchness of the Tathāgata, are non-dual, not divided into two.

original: advaidhīkāram / ananyatathatayā tathāgatatathatā tathāgatatathatayānanyatathatā /
analyzed: a dvaidhīkāram an anya tathatayā tathāgata tathatā tathāgata tathatayā an anya tathatā
translated: The suchness of the Tathāgata is the suchness of non-otherness. The suchness of non-otherness is the suchness of the Tathāgata.

original: evaṃ sattvajīvajantupoṣapuruṣapudgalamanujamānavakārakavedakajānakapaśyakatathatā
analyzed: evam sattva jīva jantu poṣa puruṣa pudgala manuja mānava kāraka vedaka jānaka paśyaka tathatā
translated: Thus, the suchness of sentient beings, living beings, creatures, humans, persons, beings, humankind, the doer, the feeler, the knower, the seer, and the suchness of the Tathāgata

original: ca tathāgatatathatā cādvayam etad advaidhīkāram / dānapāramitātathatayā tathāgatatathatā
analyzed: ca tathāgata tathatā ca advayam etat a dvaidhīkāram dāna pāramitā tathatayā tathāgata tathatā
translated: are non-dual, not divided into two. The suchness of the perfection of giving and the suchness of the Tathāgata

original: tathāgatatathatayā dānapāramitātathatā /
analyzed: tathāgata tathatayā dāna pāramitā tathatā
translated: are the suchness of the perfection of giving.

original: evaṃ śīlapāramitākṣāntipāramitāvīryapāramitādhyānapāramitāprajñāpāramitātathatayā tathāgatatathatā tathāgatatathatayā prajñāpāramitātathatā /
analyzed: evam śīla pāramitā kṣānti pāramitā vīrya pāramitā dhyāna pāramitā prajñāpāramitā tathatayā tathāgata tathatā tathāgata tathatayā prajñāpāramitā tathatā
translated: Thus, the suchness of the perfection of morality, patience, diligence, concentration, and wisdom and the suchness of the Tathāgata are the suchness of the perfection of wisdom and the suchness of the Tathāgata.

original: iti hi dānaśīlakṣāntivīryadhyānaprajñāpāramitātathatā ca tathāgatatathatā cādvayam🔽etad advaidhīkāram / adhyātmaśūnyatātathatayā tathāgatatathatā tathāgatatathatayādhyātmaśūnyatātathatā /
analyzed: iti hi dāna śīla kṣānti vīrya dhyāna prajñāpāramitā tathatā ca tathāgata tathatā ca advayam  etat a dvaidhīkāram adhyātma śūnyatā tathatayā tathāgata tathatā tathāgata tathatayā adhyātma śūnyatā tathatā
translated: Thus, the suchness of the perfections of giving, morality, patience, diligence, concentration, and wisdom and the suchness of the Tathāgata🔽are non-dual, not divided into two. The suchness of internal emptiness and the suchness of the Tathāgata

original: evaṃ yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatātathatayā tathāgatatathatā tathāgatatathatayā yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatātathatā /
analyzed: evam yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā tathatayā tathāgata tathatā tathāgata tathatayā yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā tathatā
translated: are the suchness of the Tathāgata and the suchness of internal emptiness. Thus, up to the suchness of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence and the suchness of the Tathāgata are the suchness of the Tathāgata and the suchness of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence.

original: iti hy adhyātmaśūnyatātathatā ca tathāgatatathatā ca /
analyzed: iti hi adhyātma śūnyatā tathatā ca tathāgata tathatā ca
translated: Thus, the suchness of internal emptiness and the suchness of the Tathāgata,

original: yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatātathatā ca tathāgatatathatā cādvayam etad advaidhīkāram / smṛtyupasthānatathatayā tathāgatatathatā tathāgatatathatayā
analyzed: yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā tathatā ca tathāgata tathatā ca advayam etat a dvaidhīkāram smṛti upasthāna tathatayā tathāgata tathatā tathāgata tathatayā
translated: up to the suchness of the emptiness of essential nature of non-existence and the suchness of the Tathāgata, are non-dual, not divided into two. The suchness of the applications of mindfulness and the suchness of the Tathāgata,

original: evaṃ samyakprahāṇarddhipādendriyabalabodhyaṅgamārgatathatayā tathāgatatathatā tathāgatatathatayā
analyzed: evam samyak prahāṇa ṛddhipāda indriya bala bodhyaṅga mārga tathatayā tathāgata tathatā tathāgata tathatayā
translated: the suchness of the Tathāgata and the suchness of the right efforts, bases of supernatural power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, and path,

original: mārgatathatā / iti hi smṛtyupasthānatathatā ca samyakprahāṇarddhipādendriyabalabodhyaṅgamārgatathatā
analyzed: mārga tathatā iti hi smṛti upasthāna tathatā ca samyakprahāṇa ṛddhipāda indriya bala bodhyaṅga mārga tathatā
translated: are the suchness of the applications of mindfulness, right efforts, bases of supernatural power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, and path,

original: ca tathāgatatathatā cādvayam etad advaidhīkāram / apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattitathatayā
analyzed: ca tathāgata tathatā ca advayam etat a dvaidhīkāram a pramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpatti tathatayā
translated: and the suchness of the Tathāgata, are non-dual, not divided into two. The suchness of the immeasurables, concentrations, and formless attainments,

original: tathāgatatathatā tathāgatatathatayā pramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattitathatā /
analyzed: tathāgata tathatā tathāgata tathatayā pramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpatti tathatā
translated: the suchness of the Tathāgata and the suchness of the immeasurables, concentrations, and formless attainments,

original: sarvavimokṣasamādhisamāpattidhāraṇīmukhatathatayā tathāgatatathatā tathāgatatathatayā sarvavimokṣasamādhisamāpattidhāraṇīmukhatathatā /
analyzed: sarva vimokṣa samādhi samāpatti dhāraṇī mukha tathatayā tathāgata tathatā tathāgata tathatayā sarva vimokṣa samādhi samāpatti dhāraṇī mukha tathatā
translated: are the suchness of all liberations, concentrations, attainments, and dhāraṇī gateways,🔽and the suchness of the Tathāgata, are non-dual, not divided into two.

original: iti hy apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattitathatā ca sarvavimokṣasamādhisamāpattidhāraṇīmukhatathatā
analyzed: iti hi apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpatti tathatā ca sarva vimokṣa samādhi samāpatti dhāraṇī mukha tathatā
translated: Thus, the suchness of the immeasurables, dhyānas, and formless attainments, and the suchness of the liberations, concentrations, attainments, and dhāraṇī gateways,

original: ca tathāgatatathatā cādvayam etad advaidhīkāram / śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitatathatayā
analyzed: ca tathāgata tathatā ca advayam etat a dvaidhīkāram śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita tathatayā
translated: the suchness of the Tathāgata, are non-dual, not divided into two. The suchness of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness

original: tathāgatatathatā tathāgatatathatayā śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitatathatā /
analyzed: tathāgata tathatā tathāgata tathatayā śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita tathatā
translated: is the suchness of the Tathāgata, and the suchness of the Tathāgata is the suchness of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: āryasatyatathatayā tathāgatatathatā tathāgatatathatayā āryasatyatathatā /
analyzed: ārya satya tathatayā tathāgata tathatā tathāgata tathatayā ārya satya tathatā
translated: The suchness of the noble truths is the suchness of the Tathāgata, and the suchness of the Tathāgata is the suchness of the noble truths.

original: abhijñātathatayā tathāgatatathatā tathāgatatathatayābhijñātathatā /
analyzed: abhijñā tathatayā tathāgata tathatā tathāgata tathatayā abhijñā tathatā
translated: The suchness of the higher knowledges is the suchness of the Tathāgata, and the suchness of the Tathāgata is the suchness of the higher knowledges.

original: iti hi śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitatathatā cāryasatyatathatā cābhijñātathatā ca tathāgatatathatā
analyzed: iti hi śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita tathatā ca ārya satya tathatā ca abhijñā tathatā ca tathāgata tathatā
translated: Thus, the suchness of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, the suchness of the noble truths, and the suchness of the higher knowledges, and the suchness of the Tathāgata,

original: cādvayam etad advaidhīkāram / daśabalavaiśāradyapratisaṃvittathatayā tathāgatatathatā
analyzed: ca advayam etat a dvaidhīkāram daśa bala vaiśāradya pratisaṃvid tathatayā tathāgata tathatā
translated: are non-dual, not divided into two. The suchness of the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, and the four detailed and thorough knowledges is the suchness of the Tathāgata,

original: tathāgatatathatayā daśabalavaiśāradyapratisaṃvittathatā /
analyzed: tathāgata tathatayā daśa bala vaiśāradya pratisaṃvid tathatā
translated: and the suchness of the Tathāgata is the suchness of the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, and the four detailed and thorough knowledges.

original: āveṇikabuddhadharmatathatayā tathāgatatathatā tathāgatatathatayāveṇikabuddhadharmatathatā /
analyzed: āveṇika buddha dharma tathatayā tathāgata tathatā tathāgata tathatayā āveṇika buddha dharma tathatā
translated: The suchness of the unique qualities of a Buddha and the suchness of a Tathāgata are not two nor divided.

original: iti hi daśabalavaiśāradyapratisaṃvittathatā /
analyzed: iti hi daśa bala vaiśāradya pratisaṃvid tathatā
translated: Thus, the suchness of the ten powers, fearlessnesses, and detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: cāveṇikabuddhadharmatathatā ca tathāgatatathatā cādvayam etad advaidhīkāram / sarvākārajñatātathatayā tathāgatatathatā tathāgatatathatayā sarvākārajñatātathatā /
analyzed: ca āveṇika buddha dharma tathatā ca tathāgata tathatā ca advayam etat a dvaidhīkāram sarva ākāra jña tā tathatayā tathāgata tathatā tathāgata tathatayā sarva ākāra jña tā tathatā
translated: and the suchness of the unique qualities of a Buddha and the suchness of a Tathāgata are not two nor divided.🔽Thus, the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects and the suchness of a Tathāgata are not two nor divided.

original: iti hi sarvākārajñatātathatā ca tathāgatatathatā cādvayam etad advaidhīkāram / iyaṃ
analyzed: iti hi sarva ākāra jña tā tathatā ca tathāgata tathatā ca advayam etat a dvaidhīkāram iyam
translated: This, Subhūti, is the suchness of a Tathāgata.

original: sā subhūte tathāgatatathatāyāṃ tathatām āgamya tathāgato 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim
analyzed: sā subhūte tathāgata tathatāyām tathatām āgamya tathāgataḥ nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim
translated: Having come to this suchness of a Tathāgata, the Tathāgata has fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.🔽He obtains the name 'Tathāgata.'

original: abhisaṃbuddhas tathāgata iti nāmadheyaṃ labhate / asmin khalu punas tathatāparivarte bhāṣyamāṇe /
analyzed: abhisaṃbuddhaḥ tathāgataḥ iti nāmadheyam labhate asmin khalu punar tathatā parivarte bhāṣyamāṇe
translated: When this chapter on suchness was being taught,🔽this great trichiliocosm shook in six ways, trembled, trembled strongly, and trembled intensely;🔽it quivered, quivered strongly, and quivered intensely;

original: yaṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasralokadhātuḥ ṣaḍvikāram aṣṭādaśamahānimittaṃ kampate prakampate saṃprakampate /
analyzed: yam tri sāhasra mahā sāhasra lokadhātuḥ ṣaṣ vikāram aṣṭādaśa mahā nimittam kampate prakampate saṃprakampate
translated: it shook, shook strongly, and shook intensely;🔽it quaked, quaked strongly, and quaked intensely;🔽it stirred, stirred strongly, and stirred intensely;

original: calati pracalati saṃpracalati /
analyzed: calati pracalati saṃpracalati
translated: it moved, moved strongly, and moved intensely;🔽it roared, roared strongly, and roared intensely;🔽it resounded, resounded strongly, and resounded intensely.

original: vedhate pravedhate saṃpravedhate /🔽raṇati praraṇati saṃpraraṇati /🔽kṣubhyati prakṣubhyati saṃprakṣubhyati /
analyzed: vedhate pravedhate saṃpravedhate  raṇati praraṇati saṃpraraṇati  kṣubhyati prakṣubhyati saṃprakṣubhyati
translated: It trembles, quakes, and shakes violently.🔽It rumbles, roars, and shakes violently.🔽It is agitated, greatly agitated, and violently agitated.

original: garjati pragarjati saṃpragarjati /
analyzed: garjati pragarjati saṃpragarjati
translated: It roars, thunders, and shakes violently.

original: pūrvā dig unnamati paścimā dig avanamati /🔽paścimā dig unnamati pūrvā dig avanamati /🔽uttarā dig unnamati dakṣiṇā dig avanamati /
analyzed: pūrvā diś unnamati paścimā diś avanamati  paścimā diś unnamati pūrvā diś avanamati  uttarā diś unnamati dakṣiṇā diś avanamati
translated: The eastern direction rises, the western direction subsides.🔽The western direction rises, the eastern direction subsides.🔽The northern direction rises, the southern direction subsides.

original: dakṣiṇā dig unnamati uttarā dig avanamati /
analyzed: dakṣiṇā diś unnamati uttarā diś avanamati
translated: The southern direction rises, the northern direction subsides.

original: antād unnamati madhyād avanamati /
analyzed: antāt unnamati madhyāt avanamati
translated: The end rises, the middle subsides.

original: madhyād unnamati antād avanamati /
analyzed: madhyāt unnamati antāt avanamati
translated: The middle rises, the end subsides.

original: atha khalu kāmāvacarā rūpāvacarāś ca devaputrā divyaiś candanacūrṇair bhagavantaṃ subhūtisthaviraṃ cābhyavakirann evaṃ ca vācam abhāṣanta /
analyzed: atha khalu kāmāvacarāḥ rūpāvacarāḥ ca deva putrāḥ divyaiḥ candana cūrṇaiḥ bhagavantam subhūti sthaviram ca abhyavakiran evam ca vācam abhāṣanta
translated: Then the gods of the desire realm and the form realm, scattering divine sandalwood powder on the Blessed One and the elder Subhūti, spoke thus:

original: āścaryaṃ bhagavan yāvad ayaṃ subhūtisthaviras tathāgatatathatayā tathāgatam anujātaḥ / ity agatisvabhāvaḥ
analyzed: āścaryam bhagavan yāvat ayam subhūti sthaviraḥ tathāgata tathatayā tathāgatam anujātaḥ iti agati svabhāvaḥ
translated: It is wonderful, Blessed One, that this elder Subhūti has been born from the suchness of the Tathāgata, in accordance with the suchness of the Tathāgata. Thus, the nature of non-going.

original: atha khalu subhūtisthaviras teṣāṃ devaputrāṇāṃ tām eva kathām anubadhnāti sma /
analyzed: atha khalu subhūti sthaviraḥ teṣām deva putrāṇām tām eva kathām anubadhnāti sma
translated: Then the elder Subhuti continued the same conversation with those sons of gods.

original: iti hi devaputrāḥ subhūtisthaviro na rūpam anujāto na rūpasya tathatām anujāto /
analyzed: iti hi deva putrāḥ subhūti sthaviraḥ na rūpam anujātaḥ na rūpasya tathatām anujātaḥ
translated: Thus, sons of gods, the elder Subhuti has not been born from form, nor has he been born from the suchness of form.

original: nānyatra rūpatathatāyā anujātaḥ /🔽vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārā /
analyzed: na anyatra rūpa tathatāyāḥ anujātaḥ  vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārā
translated: He has not been born from anything other than the suchness of form.🔽He has not been born from feeling, perception, volitional formations,

original: na vijñānam anujāto /
analyzed: na vijñānam anujātaḥ
translated: or consciousness.

original: na vijñānatathatām anujāto /🔽nānyatra vijñānatathatāyā anujātaḥ na skandhadhātvāyatanam anujāto na skandhadhātvāyatanatathatām
analyzed: na vijñāna tathatām anujātaḥ  na anyatra vijñāna tathatāyāḥ anujātaḥ na skandha dhātu āyatanam anujātaḥ na skandha dhātu āyatana tathatām
translated: He has not been born from the suchness of consciousness.🔽He has not been born from anything other than the suchness of consciousness. He has not been born from the aggregates, elements, or sense fields, nor has he been born from the suchness of the aggregates, elements, or sense fields.

original: anujāto nānyatra skandhadhātvāyatanatathatāyā anujātaḥ na pratītyasamutpādam anujāto
analyzed: anujātaḥ na anyatra skandha dhātu āyatana tathatāyāḥ anujātaḥ na pratītyasamutpādam anujātaḥ
translated: He has not been born from dependent origination,

original: na pratītyasamutpādatathatām anujāto /
analyzed: na pratītyasamutpāda tathatām
translated: nor has he been born from the suchness of dependent origination.

original: nānyatra pratītyasamutpādatathatāyā anujātaḥ / evaṃ sarvapāramitāḥ sarvaśūnyatāḥ saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣyā
analyzed: na anyatra pratītyasamutpāda tathatāyāḥ anujātaḥ evam sarva pāramitāḥ sarva śūnyatāḥ saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣyā
translated: He has not been born from anything other than the suchness of dependent origination. Thus, he has not been born from all the perfections, all the emptinesses, the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment,

original: dharmā āryasatyāpramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattayaḥ sarvavimokṣasamādhisamāpattidhāraṇīmukhaśūnyatānimittāpraṇihitābhijñādaśabalavaiśāradyapratisaṃvidāveṇikabuddhadharmāḥ /
analyzed: dharmāḥ ārya satya apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattayaḥ sarva vimokṣa samādhi samāpatti dhāraṇī mukha śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita abhijñā daśa bala vaiśāradya pratisaṃvid āveṇika buddha dharmāḥ
translated: The dharmas are the noble truths, the immeasurables, the dhyānas, the formless attainments, all the liberations, the concentrations, the absorptions, the dhāraṇī gateways, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, the superknowledges, the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the unique qualities of a buddha.

original: na sarvākārajñatām anujāto /
analyzed: na sarva ākāra jña tām anujātaḥ
translated: He is not born into the knowledge of all aspects.

original: na sarvākārajñatātathatām anujāto /
analyzed: na sarva ākāra jña tā tathatām
translated: He is not born into the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: nānyatra sarvākārajñatātathatāyā anujātaḥ / nāsaṃskṛtam anujāto /
analyzed: na anyatra sarva ākāra jña tā tathatāyāḥ anujātaḥ na asaṃskṛtam anujātaḥ
translated: He is not born apart from the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects. He is not born into the uncompounded.

original: nāsaṃskṛtatathatām anujāto /
analyzed: na a saṃskṛta tathatām
translated: He is not born into the suchness of the uncompounded.

original: nānyatra saṃskṛtatathatāyā anujātaḥ / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi te dharmā na saṃvidyante nopalabhyante yo vānujāyeta yena vānujāyeta /
analyzed: na anyatra saṃskṛta tathatāyāḥ anujātaḥ tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi te dharmāḥ na saṃvidyante na upalabhyante yaḥ vā anujāyeta yena vā anujāyeta
translated: He is not born apart from the suchness of the uncompounded. Why is that?🔽Because those dharmas do not exist and are not found, and he who would be born, and by whom he would be born,

original: yo vānujanyeta yena vānujanyeta / ity ajātisvabhāvaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ vā anujanyeta yena vā anujanyeta iti ajāti svabhāvaḥ
translated: and he who would be born, and by whom he would be born, are not found. Thus, the non-birth is the nature of

original: atha khalv āyuṣmāc chāriputro bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra said this to the Blessed One:

original: gambhīreyaṃ bhagavaṃs tathatā avitathatā ananyatathatā dharmatā dharmadhātusthititā dharmaniyāmatā bhūtakoṭir /
analyzed: gambhīrā iyam bhagavan tathatā avitatha tā ananya tathatā dharmatā dharmadhātu sthiti tā dharma niyāma tā bhūtakoṭiḥ
translated: Blessed One, this suchness, non-otherness, suchness of non-otherness, nature of dharmas, establishment of the dharma-element, regulation of dharmas, and summit of reality are deep.

original: yatra na rūpam upalabhyate na rūpatathatā /
analyzed: yatra na rūpam upalabhyate na rūpa tathatā
translated: Where form is not perceived, nor the suchness of form.
