original: yadā rūpam eva nopalabhyate kutaḥ punā rūpatathatopalapsyate /
analyzed: yadā rūpam eva nā upalabhyate kutas rūpa tathatā upalapsyate
translated: When form itself is not perceived, how much less can the suchness of form be perceived?

original: yatra na vedanā na saṃjñā na saṃskārā /
analyzed: yatra na vedanā na saṃjñā na saṃskārā
translated: Where feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness are not perceived,

original: yatra na vijñānam upalabhyate na vijñānatathatā /
analyzed: yatra na vijñānam upalabhyate na vijñāna tathatā
translated: where consciousness is not perceived, nor the suchness of consciousness.

original: yadā vijñānam eva nopalabhyate kutaḥ punar vijñānatathatopalapsyate / yatra na skandhadhātvāyatanāny upalabhyante na skandhadhātvāyatanatathatā /
analyzed: yadā vijñānam eva na upalabhyate kutas punar vijñāna tathatā upalapsyate yatra na skandha dhātu āyatanāni upalabhyante na skandha dhātu āyatana tathatā
translated: When consciousness itself is not perceived, how much less can the suchness of consciousness be perceived? Where the aggregates, elements, and sense fields are not perceived, nor the suchness of the aggregates, elements, and sense fields.

original: yadā skandhadhātvāyatanāny eva nopalabhyate /
analyzed: yadā skandha dhātu āyatanāni eva na upalabhyate
translated: When the aggregates, elements, and sense fields themselves are not perceived,

original: kutaḥ punaḥ skandhadhātvāyatanatathatopalapsyate / yatra na pratītyasamutpādo na pratītyasamutpādāṅgāni copalabhyante na pratītyasamutpādatathatā 🔽na pratītyasamutpādāṅgatathatā vā /
analyzed: kutas punar skandha dhātu āyatana tathatā upalapsyate yatra na pratītyasamutpādaḥ na pratītyasamutpāda aṅgāni ca upalabhyante na pratītyasamutpāda tathatā  na pratītyasamutpāda aṅga tathatā vā
translated: how much less can the suchness of the aggregates, elements, and sense fields be perceived? Where dependent origination and the factors of dependent origination are not perceived,🔽nor the suchness of dependent origination or the factors of dependent origination.

original: yadā pratītyasamutpādaḥ pratītyasamutpādāṅgāny eva vā nopalabhyate /
analyzed: yadā pratītyasamutpādaḥ pratītyasamutpāda aṅgāni eva vā na upalabhyate
translated: When dependent origination or the factors of dependent origination themselves are not perceived,

original: kutaḥ punaḥ pratītyasamutpādatathatā pratītyasamutpādāṅgatathatā vopalapsyate / evaṃ
analyzed: kutas punar pratītyasamutpāda tathatā pratītyasamutpāda aṅga tathatā vā upalapsyate evam
translated: Thus,

original: sarvapāramitāḥ sarvaśūnyatāḥ sarvavimokṣasamādhisamāpattidhāraṇīmukhāni saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣyā dharmāḥ /
analyzed: sarva pāramitāḥ sarva śūnyatāḥ sarva vimokṣa samādhi samāpatti dhāraṇī mukhāni saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣyāḥ dharmāḥ
translated: all perfections, all emptinesses, all liberations, concentrations, attainments, and dhāraṇī gateways, the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment,

original: āryasatyāny apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattayaḥ śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitābhijñādaśabalavaiśāradyapratisaṃvidāveṇikabuddhadharmā /
analyzed: ārya satyāni apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattayaḥ śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita abhijñā daśa bala vaiśāradya pratisaṃvid āveṇika buddha dharmā
translated: the noble truths, the immeasurables, the dhyānas, the formless attainments, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, the superknowledges, the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the unique qualities of a buddha,

original: yatra na sarvākārajñatopalabhyate /
analyzed: yatra na sarva ākāra jña tā upalabhyate
translated: where the knowledge of all aspects is not apprehended,

original: na sarvākārajñatātathatā /🔽yadā sarvākārajñataiva nopalabhyate /
analyzed: na sarva ākāra jña tā atathatā  yadā sarva ākāra jña tā eva na upalabhyate
translated: and the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects is not apprehended.🔽When even the knowledge of all aspects is not apprehended,

original: kutaḥ punaḥ sarvākārajñatātathatopalapsyate /
analyzed: kutas punar sarva ākāra jña tā tathatā upalapsyate
translated: how then will the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects be apprehended?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: evam etac chāriputra evam etad /
analyzed: evam etat śāriputra evam etat
translated: So it is, Śāriputra, so it is.

original: gambhīreyaṃ śāriputra tathatā /
analyzed: gambhīrā iyam śāriputra tathatā
translated: This suchness, Śāriputra, is profound,

original: yatra na rūpam upalabhyate /
analyzed: yatra na rūpam upalabhyate
translated: where form is not apprehended,

original: na rūpasya tathatopalabhyate /
analyzed: na rūpasya tathatā upalabhyate
translated: and the suchness of form is not apprehended.

original: rūpam eva nopalabhyate kutaḥ punā rūpasya tathatopalapsyate /
analyzed: rūpam eva na upalabhyate kutas punar rūpasya tathatā upalapsyate
translated: Form itself is not apprehended, so how will the suchness of form be apprehended?

original: yatra na vedanā na saṃjñā na saṃskārā /
analyzed: yatra na vedanā na saṃjñā na saṃskārā
translated: Where there is no feeling, no perception, no volitional formations,

original: na vijñānam upalabhyate na vijñānasya tathatopalabhyate vijñānam eva nopalabhyate kuto vijñānasya tathatopalapsyate / /
analyzed: na vijñānam upalabhyate na vijñānasya tathatā upalabhyate vijñānam eva na upalabhyate kutas vijñānasya tathatā upalapsyate
translated: Consciousness is not apprehended, nor is the suchness of consciousness apprehended. Consciousness itself is not apprehended, so how will the suchness of consciousness be apprehended?

original: yatra na skandhadhātvāyatanapratītyasamutpādā upalabhyante na skandhadhātvāyatanapratītyasamutpādasya tathatopalabhyate /🔽skandhadhātvāyatanapratītyasamutpāda eva nopalapsyate /🔽kutaḥ punaḥ skandhadhātvāyatanapratītyasamutpādasya tathatopalapsyate / evaṃ yāvan na sarvākārajñatopalabhyate na sarvākārajñatāyās tathatopalabhyate 🔽sarvākārajñataiva nopalabhyate /
analyzed: yatra na skandha dhātu āyatana pratītyasamutpādāḥ upalabhyante na skandha dhātu āyatana pratītyasamutpādasya tathatā upalabhyate  skandha dhātu āyatana pratītyasamutpādaḥ eva nā upalapsyate  kutas punar skandha dhātu āyatana pratītyasamutpādasya tathatā upalapsyate evam yāvat na sarva ākāra jña tā upalabhyate na sarva ākāra jña tāyāḥ tathatā upalabhyate  / sarva ākāra jña tā eva na upalabhyate
translated: Where the aggregates, elements, and sense fields, and dependent origination are not apprehended, the suchness of the aggregates, elements, and sense fields, and dependent origination is not apprehended.🔽Dependent origination itself is not apprehended, so how will the suchness of dependent origination be apprehended? In the same way, up to: all aspects of knowledge are not apprehended, nor is the suchness of all aspects of knowledge apprehended.🔽All aspects of knowledge itself are not apprehended, so how will the suchness of all aspects of knowledge be apprehended?

original: kutaḥ punaḥ sarvākārajñatāyās tathatopalapsyate / asyāṃ khalu punaḥ śāriputra tathatāyām
analyzed: kutas punar sarva ākāra jña tāyāḥ tathatā upalapsyate asyām khalu punar śāriputra tathatāyām
translated: When this suchness,

original: avitathatāyām ananyatathatāyāṃ bhāṣyamāṇāyāṃ bhikṣuśatadvayasyānupādāyāsravebhyaś cittāni vimuktāni /
analyzed: avitatha tāyām ananya tathatāyām bhāṣyamāṇāyām bhikṣu śata dvayasya an upādāya āsravebhyaḥ cittāni vimuktāni
translated: unmistaken suchness, and unaltered suchness was being taught, the minds of two hundred monks were liberated from contaminants without further appropriation.

original: pañcānāṃ bhikṣuṇīśatānāṃ virajo vigatamalaṃ dharmeṣu dharmacakṣur viśuddhaṃ /
analyzed: pañcānām bhikṣuṇī śatānām virajaḥ vigata malam dharmeṣu dharma cakṣuḥ viśuddham
translated: The Dharma-eye, pure and spotless, arose in five hundred nuns regarding the dharmas.

original: pañcānāṃ bodhisattvasahasrāṇām anutpattikadharmeṣu kṣāntipratilambho 'bhūt /
analyzed: pañcānām bodhisattva sahasrāṇām anutpattika dharmeṣu kṣānti pratilambhaḥ bhūt
translated: Five thousand bodhisattvas attained receptivity to the non-arising of dharmas.

original: ṣaṣṭeś ca bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ parihāṇadharmakāṇām anupādāyāsravebhyaś cittāni vimuktāni /
analyzed: ṣaṣṭeḥ ca bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām parihāṇa dharmakāṇām an upādāya āsravebhyaḥ cittāni vimuktāni
translated: The minds of sixty bodhisattvas, great beings, who were liable to regression, were liberated from the contaminations without further appropriation.

original: atha khalv āyuṣmān śāriputras teṣāṃ bodhisattvānām anupādāyāsravebhyaś cittāni vimuktāni viditvā bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ teṣām bodhisattvānām an upādāya āsravebhyaḥ cittāni vimuktāni viditvā bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the Venerable Śāriputra, knowing that the minds of those bodhisattvas were liberated from the contaminations without further appropriation, said this to the Blessed One:

original: ko bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayo yad eteṣāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām anupādāyāsravebhyaś cittāni vimuktāni /
analyzed: kaḥ bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ yat eteṣām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām an upādāya āsravebhyaḥ cittāni vimuktāni
translated: What is the cause, Blessed One, what is the reason why the minds of these bodhisattvas, great beings, are liberated from the contaminations without further appropriation?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: etaiś ca śāriputra bodhisattvaiḥ pañcabuddhaśatāni paryupāsitāni sarvatra ca dānaṃ dattaṃ śīlaṃ rakṣitaṃ kṣāntyā saṃpāditaṃ vīryam ārabdhaṃ
analyzed: etaiḥ ca śāriputra bodhisattvaiḥ pañca buddha śatāni paryupāsitāni sarvatra ca dānam dattam śīlam rakṣitam kṣāntyā saṃpāditam vīryam ārabdham
translated: Śāriputra, these bodhisattvas have attended on five hundred buddhas, and everywhere they have given gifts, guarded morality, perfected patience, undertaken vigor,

original: dhyānāny utpāditāni prajñā bhāvitā /
analyzed: dhyānāni utpāditāni prajñā bhāvitā
translated: produced the concentrations, and cultivated wisdom.

original: te prajñāpāramitayā virahitatvād upāyakauśalyena cāparigṛhītatvād evaṃ caritāḥ /
analyzed: te prajñāpāramitayā virahita tvāt upāya kauśalyena ca a parigṛhīta tvāt evam caritāḥ
translated: They, being devoid of the perfection of wisdom and not taken hold of by skillful means, practice like this:

original: vayaṃ dānaṃ dadāmo vayaṃ śīlaṃ rakṣāmo vayaṃ kṣāntyā saṃpādayāmo vayaṃ vīryam ārabhāmahe vayaṃ dhyānaṃ samāpadyāmahe vayaṃ prajñāṃ bhāvayāmaḥ /
analyzed: vayam dānam dadāmaḥ vayam śīlam rakṣāmaḥ vayam kṣāntyā saṃpādayāmaḥ vayam vīryam ārabhāmahe vayam dhyānam samāpadyāmahe vayam prajñām bhāvayāmaḥ
translated: We give gifts, we guard morality, we perfect patience, we undertake perseverance, we become absorbed in meditation, we cultivate wisdom.

original: te prajñāpāramitāvirahitatvād anupāyakauśalena dānaṃ śīlaṃ kṣāntiṃ vīryaṃ dhyānaṃ prajñāṃ bhāvayāmāsuḥ /
analyzed: te prajñāpāramitā virahita tvāt an upāya kauśalena dānam śīlam kṣāntim vīryam dhyānam prajñām bhāvayāmāsuḥ
translated: They, being devoid of the perfection of wisdom and lacking skillful means, cultivated generosity, morality, patience, perseverance, meditation, and wisdom.

original: te nānātvasaṃjñāyāṃ caranto nānātvopalabdhyā bodhisattvaniyāmaṃ nāvakrāmanti /
analyzed: te nānātva saṃjñāyām carantaḥ nānātva upalabdhyā bodhisattva niyāmam na avakrāmanti
translated: They, practicing with the perception of multiplicity and apprehending multiplicity, did not enter into the certainty of the bodhisattvas.

original: te bodhisattvaniyāmam anavakrāmantaḥ srotaāpattiphalaṃ prāptā yāvad arhattvaṃ prāptāḥ /
analyzed: te bodhisattva niyāmam an avakrāmantaḥ srotaāpatti phalam prāptāḥ yāvat arhat tvam prāptāḥ
translated: They, not entering into the certainty of the bodhisattvas, attained the fruit of stream-entry up to the state of an arhat.

original: kiṃ cāpi śāriputra bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām asti mārgaḥ śūnyatā vā nimittaṃ vā
analyzed: kim ca api śāriputra bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām asti mārgaḥ śūnyatā vā nimittam vā
translated: Moreover, Śāriputra, although there is the path of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas, emptiness, signlessness,

original: praṇihitaṃ vā te prajñāpāramitayā virahitā upāyakauśalyena cāparigṛhītā bhūtakoṭiṃ
analyzed: praṇihitam vā te prajñāpāramitayā virahitāḥ upāya kauśalyena ca a parigṛhītāḥ bhūtakoṭim
translated: and wishlessness, they, being devoid of the perfection of wisdom and not taken hold of by skillful means, directly realize the limit of reality

original: sākṣātkṛtvā śrāvaka bhavanti /
analyzed: sākṣātkṛtvā śrāvaka bhavanti
translated: and become śrāvakas.

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: kena kāraṇena bhagavaṃs tair evaṃ śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitair dharmaiḥ subhāvitaiḥ
analyzed: kena kāraṇena bhagavan taiḥ evam śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihitaiḥ dharmaiḥ su bhāvitaiḥ
translated: For what reason, Blessed One, do those who have well cultivated those dharmas of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness,

original: prajñāpāramitayā virahitā upāyakauśalyena cāparigṛhītā bhūtakoṭiṃ sākṣātkṛtvā śrāvakā
analyzed: prajñāpāramitayā virahitāḥ upāya kauśalyena ca a parigṛhītāḥ bhūtakoṭim sākṣātkṛtvā śrāvakāḥ
translated: deprived of the perfection of wisdom and not taken up skillful means, manifest the limit of reality and become śrāvakas

original: bhavanti / bodhisattvāḥ punar bhagavaṃs tair evaṃ śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitair dharmaiḥ
analyzed: bhavanti bodhisattvāḥ punar bhagavan taiḥ evam śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihitaiḥ dharmaiḥ
translated: or pratyekabuddhas? But, Blessed One, how is it that bodhisattvas, having well cultivated those dharmas of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness,

original: subhāvitaiḥ prajñāpāramitām upāyakauśalyaṃ cāgamyānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhyante /
analyzed: su bhāvitaiḥ prajñāpāramitām upāya kauśalyam ca āgamya anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhyante
translated: having relied on the perfection of wisdom and skillful means, fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: iha śāriputra ekaḥ sarvākārajñatācittena virahitaḥ /
analyzed: iha śāriputraḥ ekaḥ sarva ākāra jña tā cittena virahitaḥ
translated: Here, Śāriputra, one who is devoid of the mind of omniscience,

original: śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitān dharmān bhāvayann upāyakauśalyam anāgamya śrāvako bhavati /
analyzed: śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihitān dharmān bhāvayan upāya kauśalyam an āgamya śrāvakaḥ bhavati
translated: cultivating the dharmas of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, not having relied on skillful means, becomes a śrāvaka.

original: aparaḥ punaḥ śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sarvākārajñatācittenāvirahitaḥ śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitān
analyzed: aparaḥ punar śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarva ākāra jña tā cittena avirahitaḥ śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihitān
translated: But, Śāriputra, another bodhisattva mahāsattva, not devoid of the mind of omniscience, cultivating the dharmas of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness,

original: dharmān bhāvayann upāyakauśalena bodhisattvaniyāmam avakrāmaty anuttarāṃ ca samyaksaṃbodhim
analyzed: dharmān bhāvayan upāya kauśalena bodhisattva niyāmam avakrāmati anuttarām ca samyaksaṃbodhim
translated: Meditating on the dharmas, through skillful means, he enters the stage of the bodhisattva and attains unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: abhisaṃbuddhyate / tadyathāpi nāma śāriputra pakṣiṇaḥ śakuner yojanaśatiko vā ātmabhāvo bhaved /
analyzed: abhisaṃbuddhyate tat yathā api nāma śāriputra pakṣiṇaḥ śakuneḥ yojana śatikaḥ vā ātma bhāvaḥ bhavet
translated: Just as, Śāriputra, a bird, a bird of prey, might have a body a hundred yojanas in size,

original: dviyojanaśatiko vā triyojanaśatiko vā caturyojanaśatiko vā ātmabhāvo bhavet /
analyzed: dvi yojana śatikaḥ vā tri yojana śatikaḥ vā catur yojana śatikaḥ vā ātma bhāvaḥ bhavet
translated: or a body two hundred yojanas in size, or three hundred yojanas in size, or four hundred yojanas in size.

original: sa devebhyas trayastriṃśebhyo jambūdvīpam āgantavyaṃ manyeta /
analyzed: sa devebhyaḥ trayastriṃśebhyaḥ jambūdvīpam āgantavyam manyeta
translated: It might think of coming from the Heaven of the Thirty-Three to Jambudvīpa.

original: sa ca pakṣī śakunir apakṣo bhavet /
analyzed: sa ca pakṣī śakuniḥ apakṣaḥ bhavet
translated: And that bird, that bird of prey, might be wingless.

original: sa devebhyas trayastriṃśebhya ātmānaṃ parimoktavyaṃ manyeta jambūdvīpaṃ gamiṣyāmīti / atha tasya pakṣiṇaḥ śakuner ardhapatitasyaltad abhavat /🔽aho batāhaṃ deveṣu trayastriṃśeṣu pratitiṣṭheyam iti / tat kiṃ manyase śāriputrāpi nu sa pakṣī śakuniḥ pratibalaḥ /
analyzed: sa devebhyaḥ trayastriṃśebhyaḥ ātmānam parimoktavyam manyeta jambūdvīpam gamiṣyāmi iti atha tasya pakṣiṇaḥ śakuneḥ ardha patitasya altat abhavat  aho bata aham deveṣu trayastriṃśeṣu pratitiṣṭheyam iti tat kim manyase śāriputra api nu sa pakṣī śakuniḥ pratibalaḥ
translated: It might think of throwing itself from the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, thinking, 'I will go to Jambudvīpa.' Then, as that bird, that bird of prey, was falling, it would think,

original: punar eva deveṣu trayastriṃśeṣu pratiṣṭhātum /
analyzed: punar eva deveṣu trayastriṃśeṣu pratiṣṭhātum
translated: 'Alas, I wish I were established among the gods in the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.' What do you think, Śāriputra, would that bird, that bird of prey, be able to establish itself among the gods in the Heaven of the Thirty-Three again?

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: no bhagavan /
analyzed: naḥ bhagavan
translated: No, Blessed One.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: sacet punar asyāntare /
analyzed: saced punar asya antare
translated: If, in the meantime,

original: evaṃ bhaved /
analyzed: evam bhavet
translated: it were to think like this:

original: aho batāham akṣato 'nupahato jambūdvīpe pratitiṣṭheyam iti / tat kiṃ manyase śāriputrāpi nu sa pakṣī śakunir akṣato 'nupahato jambūdvīpe pratitiṣṭhet /
analyzed: aho bata aham akṣataḥ na upahataḥ jambūdvīpe pratitiṣṭheyam iti tat kim manyase śāriputra api nu sa pakṣī śakuniḥ akṣataḥ na upahataḥ jambūdvīpe pratitiṣṭhet
translated: 'Oh, I wish I could stand in Jambudvipa without being hurt or harmed,' what do you think, Śāriputra, would that bird be able to stand in Jambudvipa without being hurt or harmed?

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: no bhagavan /
analyzed: naḥ bhagavan
translated: No, Blessed One.

original: kṣataś cāsau bhagavann upahataś cāprāpta eva jambūdvīpaṃ maraṇaṃ nigacchet / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: kṣataḥ ca asau bhagavan upahataḥ ca aprāptaḥ eva jambūdvīpam maraṇam nigacchet tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Blessed One, it would be hurt and harmed, and would die even before reaching Jambudvipa. Why is that?

original: evam etad bhavati bhagavan yasya mahāṃś cātmabhāvo bhavati /
analyzed: evam etat bhavati bhagavan yasya mahān ca ātmabhāvaḥ bhavati
translated: Blessed One, it is like this: it has a large body,

original: ajātapakṣaś ca dūrāc ca viprakṛṣṭāt prapatati /
analyzed: a jāta pakṣaḥ ca dūrāt ca viprakṛṣṭāt prapatati
translated: its wings have not grown, and it falls from far away and a great distance.

original: bhagavān āha /🔽evam eva śāriputra kiñ cāpi bodhisattvo mahāsattvo gaṅgānadīvālukopamān kalpān avagamya dānaṃ dadāti śīlaṃ rakṣati kṣāntyā saṃpādayati vīryam
analyzed: bhagavān āha  evam eva śāriputra kim ca api bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamān kalpān avagamya dānam dadāti śīlam rakṣati kṣāntyā saṃpādayati vīryam
translated: The Blessed One said:🔽Just so, Śāriputra, even if a bodhisattva mahāsattva were to practice generosity, guard morality, cultivate patience,

original: ārabhate dhyānaṃ samāpadyate /
analyzed: ārabhate dhyānam samāpadyate
translated: exert vigor, and enter into meditation for eons equal in number to the sands of the Ganges river,

original: tasya ca mahat prasthānaṃ mahāṃś cittotpādo 'pramāṇaparigraho 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhuṃ /
analyzed: tasya ca mahat prasthānam mahān citta utpādaḥ pramāṇa parigrahaḥ nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhum
translated: And that great departure, that great production of the thought, that immeasurable undertaking, is for the sake of fully awakening to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: sa ca prajñāpāramitayopāyakauśalenaiva /
analyzed: sa ca prajñāpāramitayā upāya kauśalena eva
translated: And that is not separated from the perfection of wisdom and skillful means.

original: virahitaḥ śrāvakabhūmiṃ vā pratyekabuddhabhūmiṃ vā patati / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: virahitaḥ śrāvaka bhūmim vā pratyekabuddha bhūmim vā patati tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: And that one falls to the śrāvaka level or the pratyekabuddha level. Why is that?

original: tathā hi tena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sarvākārajñatāvirahitena cittena dānaṃ dattaṃ
analyzed: tathā hi tena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sarva ākāra jña tā virahitena cittena dānam dattam
translated: Because that bodhisattva mahāsattva has given gifts with a mind separated from the knowledge of all aspects,

original: bhavati śīlaṃ rakṣitaṃ kṣāntyā saṃpāditaṃ vīryam ārabdhaṃ dhyānāny utpāditāni sa
analyzed: bhavati śīlam rakṣitam kṣāntyā saṃpāditam vīryam ārabdham dhyānāni utpāditāni sa
translated: has guarded morality, has cultivated patience, has undertaken vigor, has given rise to the concentrations,

original: ca bodhisattvaḥ prajñāpāramitayopāyakauśalena ca virahito 'bhūt /
analyzed: ca bodhisattvaḥ prajñāpāramitayā upāya kauśalena ca virahitaḥ bhūt
translated: and that bodhisattva is separated from the perfection of wisdom and skillful means.

original: tena sa śrāvakabhūmiṃ vā pratyekabuddhabhūmiṃ vā patati / kiñ cāpi sa śāriputra bodhisattvo
analyzed: tena sa śrāvaka bhūmim vā pratyekabuddha bhūmim vā patati kim ca api sa śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ
translated: Therefore, he falls to the śrāvaka level or the pratyekabuddha level. Moreover, Śāriputra, that bodhisattva

original: 'tītānāgatapratyutpannānāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ śīlasamādhiprajñāvimuktivimuktijñānadarśanaṃ🔽samanvāharati ārādhayati nimittīkaroti /
analyzed: tīta anāgata pratyutpannānām buddhānām bhagavatām śīla samādhi prajñā vimukti vimukti jñāna darśanam 🔽samanvāharati ārādhayati nimittīkaroti
translated: who mentally attends to, practices, and takes as a basis the morality, concentration, wisdom, liberation, and knowledge and vision of liberation of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, of the past, future, and present,

original: na ca sa tathāgatānāṃ śīlaṃ jānāti samādhiṃ jānāti prajñāṃ jānāti vimuktiṃ jānāti vimuktijñānadarśanaṃ jānāti /
analyzed: na ca sa tathāgatānām śīlam jānāti samādhim jānāti prajñām jānāti vimuktim jānāti vimukti jñāna darśanam jānāti
translated: And he does not know the morality of the Tathāgatas, does not know the concentration, does not know the wisdom, does not know the liberation, does not know the knowledge and vision of liberation of the Tathāgatas.

original: so 'jānan na budhyamānaḥ śūnyatāyām ānimitte praṇihite vā śāntiṃ śṛṇoti sa tāṃ śāntiṃ
analyzed: saḥ jānan na budhyamānaḥ śūnyatāyām ā animitte praṇihite vā śāntim śṛṇoti sa tām śāntim
translated: Not knowing, not understanding, he hears about emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness as peace, and

original: nimittīkaroti nimittataś cānuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayati / evaṃ hi pariṇāmayan
analyzed: nimittīkaroti nimittataḥ ca anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayati evam hi pariṇāmayan
translated: he takes that peace as a sign, and from that sign he dedicates [the roots of virtue] to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment. Thus dedicating,

original: bodhisattvaḥ sthāsyati śrāvakabhūmau vā pratyekabuddhabhūmau vā / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: bodhisattvaḥ sthāsyati śrāvaka bhūmau vā pratyekabuddha bhūmau vā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: the bodhisattva will stand on the śrāvaka level or the pratyekabuddha level. Why is that?

original: evam etac chāriputra yaḥ prajñāpāramitayopāyakauśalena ca virahito bhavati /
analyzed: evam etat śāriputra yaḥ prajñāpāramitayā upāya kauśalena ca virahitaḥ bhavati
translated: It is just so, Śāriputra, that one who is devoid of the perfection of wisdom and skillful means,

original: na ca kuśalamūlāny anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayati /
analyzed: na ca kuśala mūlāni anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayati
translated: and does not dedicate the roots of virtue to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,

original: sa śrāvakabhūmiṃ vā pratyekabuddhabhūmiṃ vā patati / iti tathatānupalambhasvabhāvaḥ
analyzed: sa śrāvaka bhūmim vā pratyekabuddha bhūmim vā patati iti tathatā anupalambha svabhāvaḥ
translated: falls to the śrāvaka level or the pratyekabuddha level. Thus is said the nature of non-apprehending suchness.

original: ity uktaṃ svabhāvalakṣaṇam
analyzed: iti uktam svabhāva lakṣaṇam
translated: Thus is said the characteristic of intrinsic nature.

original: yaḥ punaḥ śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prathamacittotpādam upādāya sarvākārajñatācittenāvirahito
analyzed: yaḥ punar śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prathama citta utpādam upādāya sarva ākārajña tā cittena avirahitaḥ
translated: Moreover, Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who, from the first production of the thought of enlightenment, is not separated from the thought of the knowledge of all modes,

original: dānaṃ dadāti śīlaṃ rakṣati kṣāntyā saṃpādayati vīryam ārabhate dhyānāni ca samāpadyate
analyzed: dānam dadāti śīlam rakṣati kṣāntyā saṃpādayati vīryam ārabhate dhyānāni ca samāpadyate
translated: and who gives gifts, guards morality, cultivates patience, exerts vigor, and becomes absorbed in trance,

original: na ca nimittīkaroti /
analyzed: na ca nimittīkaroti
translated: but does not take his stand on them,

original: smṛtyupasthānasamyakprahāṇarddhipādendriyabalabodhyaṅgamārgān bhāvayati na ca nimittīkaroti yāvat sarvākārajñatāṃ bhāvayati na ca nimittīkaroti /
analyzed: smṛti upasthāna samyakprahāṇa ṛddhipāda indriya bala bodhyaṅga mārgān bhāvayati na ca nimittīkaroti yāvat sarva ākārajña tām bhāvayati na ca nimittīkaroti
translated: and who develops the applications of mindfulness, etc. to: the noble eightfold path, but does not take his stand on them, and who develops the ten powers of a Tathagata, etc. to: the knowledge of all modes, but does not take his stand on them,🔽he, Śāriputra, is called a bodhisattva who courses in the perfection of wisdom and the skill in means.

original: iti sāmānyena mokṣabhāgīyam
analyzed: iti sāmānyena mokṣa bhāgīyam
translated: This is the general [explanation of] the aids to penetration.

original: sa ca prajñāpāramitayopāyakauśalyena cāvirahitas traiyadhvikān buddhān samanvāharati /
analyzed: sa ca prajñāpāramitayā upāya kauśalyena ca avirahitaḥ traiyadhvikān buddhān samanvāharati
translated: And he, not separated from the perfection of wisdom and skill in means, recollects the Buddhas of the three times.

original: teṣāṃ cātītānāgatapratyutpannānāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatayaś ca śīlaskandhaḥ samādhiskandhaḥ prajñāskandho vimuktiskandho vimuktijñānadarśanaskandhaḥ /
analyzed: teṣām ca atīta anāgata pratyutpannānām buddhānām bhagavatayaḥ ca śīla skandhaḥ samādhi skandhaḥ prajñā skandhaḥ vimukti skandhaḥ vimukti jñāna darśana skandhaḥ
translated: And of those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, of the past, future, and present, he recollects the morality aggregate, the concentration aggregate, the wisdom aggregate, the emancipation aggregate, and the aggregate which is the knowledge and insight of emancipation.

original: tatsarvaṃ na nimittīkaroti na śūnyatāsamādhiṃ nimittīkaroti ānimittasamādhim apraṇihitasamādhiṃ
analyzed: tat sarvam na nimittīkaroti na śūnyatā samādhim nimittīkaroti ānimitta samādhim apraṇihita samādhim
translated: He does not take any of that as a causal sign. He does not take the emptiness meditative stabilization as a causal sign, nor the signless meditative stabilization, nor the wishless meditative stabilization,

original: na nimittīkaroti veditavyam etac chāriputra nāyaṃ bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ śrāvakabhūmau
analyzed: na nimittīkaroti veditavyam etat śāriputra na ayam bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ śrāvaka bhūmau
translated: nor the unmoving meditative stabilization as a causal sign. Śāriputra, you should know that this bodhisattva great being will not stand on the śrāvaka level

original: vā pratyekabuddhabhūmau /🔽vā sthāsyatīti /
analyzed: vā pratyekabuddha bhūmau  vā sthāsyati iti
translated: or the pratyekabuddha level.🔽He will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: akṣato 'nupahato 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate / iti śraddhātmakaṃ mokṣabhāgīyam
analyzed: akṣataḥ na upahataḥ na uttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyate iti śraddhā ātmakam mokṣa bhāgīyam
translated: unharmed and uninjured.” This is the faith aspect of the path of preparation.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hi tena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prathamacittotpādam upādāya dānaṃ dattaṃ na ca nimittīkṛtaṃ /
analyzed: tathā hi tena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prathama citta utpādam upādāya dānam dattam na ca nimittīkṛtam
translated: Because, beginning from the first production of the thought, that bodhisattva great being has given gifts without taking anything as a causal sign.

original: śīlaṃ rakṣitaṃ kṣāntyā saṃpāditaṃ vīryam ārabdhaṃ dhyānaṃ samāpannaṃ prajñā bhāvitā na ca nimittīkṛtā /
analyzed: śīlam rakṣitam kṣāntyā saṃpāditam vīryam ārabdham dhyānam samāpannam prajñā bhāvitā na ca nimittīkṛtā
translated: He has guarded morality, developed patience, exerted perseverance, become absorbed in concentration, and cultivated wisdom without taking anything as a causal sign.

original: atitānāgatapratyutpannānāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ śīlasamādhiprajñāvimuktivimuktijñānadarśanāni na nimittīkṛtāni /
analyzed: atitāna āgata pratyutpannānām buddhānām bhagavatām śīla samādhi prajñā vimukti vimukti jñāna darśanāni na nimittīkṛtāni
translated: He has not taken as a causal sign the morality, concentration, wisdom, liberation, or knowledge and seeing of liberation of the buddhas, the blessed ones, of the past, future, and present.

original: idaṃ śāriputra bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ tad upāyakauśalyaṃ yan nimittavirahitena
analyzed: idam śāriputra bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām tat upāya kauśalyam yat nimitta virahitena
translated: This, Śāriputra, is the skillful means of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas, that with a mind free from signs

original: cittena dānaṃ dadāti śīlaṃ rakṣati kṣāntyā saṃpādayati vīryam ārabhate dhyānaṃ samāpadyate
analyzed: cittena dānam dadāti śīlam rakṣati kṣāntyā saṃpādayati vīryam ārabhate dhyānam samāpadyate
translated: they give gifts, guard morality, accomplish patience, undertake perseverance, become absorbed in concentration,

original: prajñāṃ bhāvayati / smṛtyupasthānasamyakprahāṇarddhipādendriyabalabodhyaṅgamārgān bhāvayati /
analyzed: prajñām bhāvayati smṛti upasthāna samyakprahāṇa ṛddhipāda indriya bala bodhyaṅga mārgān bhāvayati
translated: and cultivate wisdom. They cultivate the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the bases of supernatural power, the faculties, the powers, the limbs of awakening, and the path.

original: āryasatyāpramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattīr bhāvayati /
analyzed: ārya satya apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattīḥ bhāvayati
translated: They cultivate the noble truths, the immeasurables, the concentrations, and the formless attainments.

original: sarvavimokṣasamādhisamāpattidhāraṇīmukhāni samāpadyate /
analyzed: sarva vimokṣa samādhi samāpatti dhāraṇī mukhāni samāpadyate
translated: They attain all the liberations, concentrations, attainments, and dhāraṇī gateways.

original: śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitāni bhāvayati na ca nimittīkaroti /
analyzed: śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihitāni bhāvayati na ca nimittīkaroti
translated: They cultivate emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, but do not take them as signs.

original: daśabalavaiśāradyapratisaṃvidāveṇikabuddhadharmān bhāvayati yāvat sarvākārajñatāyāṃ carati na ca nimittīkaroti / iti vīryātmakaṃ mokṣabhāgīyam
analyzed: daśa bala vaiśāradya pratisaṃvid āveṇika buddha dharmān bhāvayati yāvat sarva ākārajña tāyām carati na ca nimittīkaroti iti vīrya ātmakam mokṣa bhāgīyam
translated: They cultivate the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the unique qualities of a buddha, and practice up to the knowledge of all aspects, but do not take them as signs. Thus is the self-nature of the path of preparation.

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: yathāhaṃ bhagavan bhagavato bhāṣitasyārtham ājānāmi /
analyzed: yathā aham bhagavan bhagavataḥ bhāṣitasya artham ājānāmi
translated: Blessed One, as I understand the meaning of what the Blessed One has said,

original: yo bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitayā copāyakauśalyena cāvirahitāśayas tasyānuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ / iti smṛtyātmakaṃ mokṣabhāgīyam
analyzed: yaḥ bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitayā ca upāya kauśalyena ca avirahita āśayaḥ tasya anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ iti smṛti ātmakam mokṣa bhāgīyam
translated: Blessed One, the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment of that bodhisattva great being whose intention is never separate from the perfection of wisdom and skillful means. Thus, the stage conducive to liberation is characterized by mindfulness.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hi bhagavan tena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prathamacittotpādam upādāya na
analyzed: tathā hi bhagavan tena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prathama citta utpādam upādāya na
translated: Blessed One, it is because that bodhisattva great being, from the first production of the thought of enlightenment onward, has not

original: kaścid dharma upalabdho yo 'bhisaṃbudhyeta yena cābhisaṃbudhyeta yaṃ cābhisaṃbudhyeta
analyzed: kaścid dharmaḥ upalabdhaḥ yaḥ abhisaṃbudhyeta yena ca abhisaṃbudhyeta yam ca abhisaṃbudhyeta
translated: found any dharma that would awaken, by which one would awaken, or to which one would awaken,

original: rūpaṃ vā vedanā vā saṃjñā vā saṃskārā vā vijñānaṃ vā /
analyzed: rūpam vā vedanā vā saṃjñā vā saṃskārāḥ vā vijñānam vā
translated: whether it be form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: evaṃ skandhadhātvāyatanapratītyasamutpādo vā pratītyasamutpādāṅgāni vā sarvapāramitā
analyzed: evam skandha dhātu āyatana pratītyasamutpādaḥ vā pratītyasamutpāda aṅgāni vā sarva pāramitā
translated: Thus, he has not found any dharma that would awaken, by which one would awaken, or to which one would awaken, whether it be the aggregates, elements, sense fields, dependent origination, factors of dependent origination, all perfections,

original: vā sarvaśūnyatā vā saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣyā vā dharmā āryasatyāni vā apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattayo
analyzed: vā sarva śūnyatā vā saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣyāḥ vā dharmāḥ ārya satyāni vā apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattayaḥ
translated: all emptinesses, the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, the noble truths, the immeasurables, concentrations, and formless absorptions,

original: vā sarvavimokṣasamādhisamāpattidhāraṇīmukhāni vā śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitāni vā abhijñādaśabalavaiśāradyapratisaṃvidāveṇikā
analyzed: vā sarva vimokṣa samādhi samāpatti dhāraṇī mukhāni vā śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihitāni vā abhijñā daśa bala vaiśāradya pratisaṃvid āveṇikā
translated: all liberations, concentrations, absorptions, and dhāraṇī gateways, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, the superknowledges, the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, the distinctive qualities of a buddha,

original: vā buddhadharmāḥ sarvākārajñatā vā / ye punar ime bhagavan bodhisattvayānikāḥ kulaputrāḥ🔽kuladuhitaraś ca prajñāpāramitāvirahitā upāyakauśalyavirahitāś ca saṃśayas teṣāṃ
analyzed: vā buddha dharmāḥ sarva ākāra jña tā vā ye punar ime bhagavan bodhisattva yānikāḥ kula putrāḥ  kula duhitaraḥ ca prajñāpāramitā virahitāḥ upāya kauśalya virahitāḥ ca saṃśayaḥ teṣām
translated: But, O Lord, those sons and daughters of good family who belong to the vehicle of the Bodhisattvas,

original: pratikāṅkṣitavyo /🔽'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau / tat kasya hetoḥ /🔽tathā hi bhagavaṃs tair bodhisattvayānikaiḥ kulaputraiḥ kuladuhitṛbhir vā prajñāpāramitopāyakauśalyavirahitair yadyad eva dānaṃ dattaṃ tatsarvaṃ
analyzed: pratikāṅkṣitavyaḥ  anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi bhagavan taiḥ bodhisattva yānikaiḥ kula putraiḥ kula duhitṛbhiḥ vā prajñāpāramitā upāya kauśalya virahitaiḥ yat yat eva dānam dattam tat sarvam
translated: if they are without the perfection of wisdom and without skill in means, they should be considered as doubtful🔽as to full enlightenment.🔽Why is it so? Because, O Lord, those sons and daughters of good family who belong to the vehicle of the Bodhisattvas,

original: nimittīkṛtya dattam /
analyzed: nimittīkṛtya dattam
translated: if they are without the perfection of wisdom and without skill in means, whatever gift they give, all that is given as a causal-sign.

original: evaṃ yadyad eva śīlaṃ rakṣitaṃ kṣāntyā saṃpāditaṃ vīryam ārabdhaṃ dhyānaṃ samāpannaṃ /
analyzed: evam yat yat eva śīlam rakṣitam kṣāntyā saṃpāditam vīryam ārabdham dhyānam samāpannam
translated: Thus whatever morality they guard, whatever patience they endeavour in, whatever energy they exert, whatever meditation they enter,

original: yā caiva prajñā vyavacāritā sā sarvā nimittīkṛtya vyavacāritā / tasmāt saṃśayas teṣāṃ
analyzed: yā ca eva prajñā vyavacāritā sā sarvā nimittīkṛtya vyavacāritā tasmāt saṃśayaḥ teṣām
translated: whatever wisdom they ponder, all that is pondered as a causal-sign. Therefore,🔽those sons and daughters of good family who belong to the vehicle of the Bodhisattvas should be considered as doubtful

original: bodhisattvayānikānāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṛṇāṃ cānuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ pratikāṅkṣitavyaḥ /
analyzed: bodhisattva yānikānām kula putrāṇām kula duhitṛṇām ca anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ pratikāṅkṣitavyaḥ
translated: as to full enlightenment.

original: tasmāt tarhi bhagavan bodhisattvena mahāsattvenānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhukāmena
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi bhagavan bodhisattvena mahāsattvena anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhu kāmena
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment

original: prajñāpāramitopāyakauśalyāvirahitena bhavitavyaṃ /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā upāya kauśalya avirahitena bhavitavyam
translated: should not be separated from the perfection of wisdom and skillful means.

original: prajñāpāramitāyām upāyakauśalyena sthitvānupalambhayogena ānimittasahagatena cittena
analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyām upāya kauśalyena sthitvā anupalambha yogena ā nimitta sahagatena cittena
translated: Having stood in the perfection of wisdom and skillful means, through the yoga of non-apprehension, with a thought accompanied by the absence of signs,

original: dānaṃ dātavyaṃ śīlaṃ rakṣitavyaṃ kṣāntyā saṃpādayitavyaṃ vīryam ārabdhavyaṃ dhyānaṃ
analyzed: dānam dātavyam śīlam rakṣitavyam kṣāntyā saṃpādayitavyam vīryam ārabdhavyam dhyānam
translated: one should give gifts, one should guard morality, one should perfect patience, one should undertake vigor, one should enter into meditation,

original: samāpattavyaṃ prajñā bhāvayitavyā / ānimittasahagatena cittena adhyātmaśūnyatā bhāvayitavyā /
analyzed: samāpattavyam prajñā bhāvayitavyā ānimitta sahagatena cittena adhyātma śūnyatā bhāvayitavyā
translated: one should cultivate wisdom. With a thought accompanied by the absence of signs, one should cultivate the emptiness of internal phenomena.

original: yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatā bhāvayitavyā / ānimittasahagatena cittena smṛtyupasthānāni bhāvayitavyāni / evaṃ samyakprahāṇarddhipādendriyabalabodhyaṅgāni /
analyzed: yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā bhāvayitavyā ānimitta sahagatena cittena smṛti upasthānāni bhāvayitavyāni evam samyak prahāṇa ṛddhipāda indriya bala bodhyaṅgāni
translated: Up to one should cultivate the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence. With a thought accompanied by the absence of signs, one should cultivate the applications of mindfulness. In the same way, one should cultivate the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, and the limbs of awakening.

original: ānimittasahagatena cittenāryāṣṭāṅgo mārgo bhāvayitavyaḥ / ānimittasahagatena cittenāpramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattayaḥ
analyzed: ā nimitta sahagatena cittena ārya aṣṭāṅgaḥ mārgaḥ bhāvayitavyaḥ ā nimitta sahagatena cittena apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattayaḥ
translated: With a thought accompanied by the absence of signs, one should cultivate the noble eightfold path. With a thought accompanied by the absence of signs, one should cultivate the immeasurables, the concentrations, and the formless attainments.

original: samāpattavyāḥ / ānimittasahagatena cittenāryasatyāni bhāvayitavyāni / ānimittasahagatena
analyzed: samāpattavyāḥ ā nimitta sahagatena cittena ārya satyāni bhāvayitavyāni ā nimitta sahagatena
translated: should be cultivated. The noble truths should be cultivated with a mind accompanied by the signless.

original: cittena sarvavimokṣasamādhisamāpattidhāraṇīmukhāni bhāvayitavyāni / ānimittasahagatena
analyzed: cittena sarva vimokṣa samādhi samāpatti dhāraṇī mukhāni bhāvayitavyāni ā nimitta sahagatena
translated: The liberations, concentrations, absorptions, and dhāraṇī gateways should be cultivated with a mind accompanied by the signless.

original: cittena abhijñādaśabalavaiśāradyapratisaṃvidāveṇikabuddhadharmā bhāvayitavyāḥ /
analyzed: cittena abhijñā daśa bala vaiśāradya pratisaṃvid āveṇika buddha dharmāḥ bhāvayitavyāḥ
translated: The higher knowledges, ten powers, fearlessnesses, detailed and thorough knowledges, and unique qualities of a buddha should be cultivated with a mind accompanied by the signless.

original: ānimittasahagatena cittena sarvākārajñatāyāṃ caritavyam /
analyzed: ā nimitta sahagatena cittena sarva ākārajña tāyām caritavyam
translated: The knowledge of all aspects should be practiced with a mind accompanied by the signless.

original: iti samādhyātmakaṃ mokṣabhāgīyam
analyzed: iti samādhi ātmakam mokṣa bhāgīyam
translated: Thus, the inner liberation consisting of concentration is the factor of enlightenment.

original: atha khalu kāmāvacarā rūpāvacarāś ca devaputrā bhagavantam etad avocan /
analyzed: atha khalu kāmāvacarāḥ rūpāvacarāḥ ca deva putrāḥ bhagavantam etat avocan
translated: Then the gods of the desire realm and the form realm said this to the Blessed One:

original: durabhisaṃbhavā bhagavan duradhimucyānuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ /
analyzed: durabhisaṃbhavā bhagavan duradhimucyā anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ
translated: Blessed One, unsurpassed perfect enlightenment is difficult to attain, difficult to believe in.

original: yatra hi sarvākāraiś ca nāma bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sarvadharmā 'bhisaṃboddhavyās te ca dharmā na saṃvidyanti nopalabhyante /
analyzed: yatra hi sarva ākāraiḥ ca nāma bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sarva dharmāḥ abhisaṃboddhavyāḥ te ca dharmāḥ na saṃvidyanti na upalabhyante
translated: For here, all aspects of all dharmas are to be fully awakened to by the bodhisattva mahāsattva, and those dharmas do not exist and are not perceived.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: evam etad devaputrā evam etat /
analyzed: evam etat deva putrāḥ evam etat
translated: So it is, gods, so it is.

original: durabhisaṃbhavā devaputrā duradhimucyānuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ /
analyzed: durabhisaṃbhavāḥ deva putrāḥ duradhimucyā anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ
translated: Gods, unsurpassed perfect enlightenment is difficult to attain, difficult to believe in.

original: mayāpi devaputrāḥ sarvadharmāḥ sarvākārair abhisaṃbuddhāḥ /
analyzed: mayā api deva putrāḥ sarva dharmāḥ sarva ākāraiḥ abhisaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: Gods, I have fully awakened to all dharmas in all aspects,

original: na ca me kaścid dharma upalabdho yo 'bhisaṃbudhyeta yena cābhisaṃbudhyeta yaṃ cābhisaṃbudhyeta / /
analyzed: na ca me kaścid dharmaḥ upalabdhaḥ yaḥ abhisaṃbudhyeta yena ca abhisaṃbudhyeta yam ca abhisaṃbudhyeta
translated: and I do not apprehend any dharma that would fully awaken, by which one would fully awaken, or to which one would fully awaken.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: atyantaviśuddhatvād devaputrāḥ sarvadharmāṇām / iti prajñātmakaṃ mokṣabhāgiyam
analyzed: atyanta viśuddha tvāt devaputrāḥ sarva dharmāṇām iti prajñā ātmakam mokṣa bhāgiyam
translated: Gods, it is because all dharmas are extremely pure. Thus it is the liberation-conducive aspect that consists in wisdom.

original: atha khalv āyuṣmān subhūtir bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said this to the Blessed One:

original: yad bhagavān evam āha /
analyzed: yat bhagavān evam āha
translated: The Blessed One has said:

original: durabhisaṃbhavānuttarā samyaksaṃbodhir iti /
analyzed: durabhisaṃbhavā anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ iti
translated: 'Unsurpassed perfect enlightenment is difficult to attain.'

original: yathā punar ahaṃ bhagavato bhāṣitasyārtham ājānāmi / yathā ca mama bhavati /
analyzed: yathā punar aham bhagavataḥ bhāṣitasya artham ājānāmi yathā ca mama bhavati
translated: As I understand the meaning of what the Blessed One has said, and as it occurs to me,

original: tathā svabhisaṃbodhā bhagavann anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tathā su abhisaṃbodhā bhagavan anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Blessed One, unsurpassed perfect enlightenment is self-awakened. Why is that?

original: tathā hi bhagavan na kaścid abhisaṃbudhyate na kenacid abhisaṃbudhyate na kiñcid abhisaṃboddhavyaṃ /

translated: Blessed One, it is because no one awakens, no one awakens to anything, and nothing is to be awakened to.

translated: Blessed One, in all dharmas which are empty, that dharma which would awaken, by which one would awaken, or to which one would awaken, does not exist. Why is it so?

original: tathā hi bhagavan sarvadharmāḥ śūnyāḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi bhagavan sarva dharmāḥ śūnyāḥ
translated: Because, Blessed One, all dharmas are empty.

original: yasyāpi dharmasya vṛddhaye vā prahāṇāya vā dānaṃ vā dadyāt /
analyzed: yasya api dharmasya vṛddhaye vā prahāṇāya vā dānam vā dadyāt

original: śīlaṃ vā rakṣet kṣāntiṃ vā saṃpādayet vīryaṃ vā ārabheta dhyānaṃ vā samāpadyeta /

original: evaṃ yāvat sarvākārajñatāyāṃ vā śikṣeta /
analyzed: evam yāvat sarva ākārajña tāyām vā śikṣeta
translated: or would train in the knowledge of all aspects up to that,

original: te ca dharmā na saṃvidyante /
analyzed: te ca dharmāḥ na saṃvidyante
translated: and those dharmas do not exist.

original: yaś cābhisaṃbudhyeta yena cābhisaṃbudhyeta yaṃ cābhisaṃbudhyeta sarve te dharmāḥ
analyzed: yaḥ ca abhisaṃbudhyeta yena ca abhisaṃbudhyeta yam ca abhisaṃbudhyeta sarve te dharmāḥ
translated: And that which would awaken, by which one would awaken, and to which one would awaken, all those dharmas

original: śūnyāḥ / anena bhagavan paryāyeṇa svabhisaṃbodhā bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām anuttarā
analyzed: śūnyāḥ anena bhagavan paryāyeṇa su abhisaṃbodhā bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām anuttarā
translated: are empty. By this method, Blessed One, the self-awakening of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas is the unsurpassed

original: samyaksaṃbodhiḥ / tat kasya hetoḥ /

original: tathā hi bhagavan rūpaṃ rūpasvabhāvena śūnyaṃ /

translated: Because, Blessed One, form is empty of the intrinsic nature of form.

original: vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārā /
analyzed: vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārā

translated: Consciousness is empty of the intrinsic nature of consciousness.

original: evaṃ skandhadhātvāyatanapratītyasamutpādāḥ /
analyzed: evam skandha dhātu āyatana pratītyasamutpādāḥ

analyzed: pratītyasamutpāda aṅgāni pratītyasamutpāda aṅga svabhāvena śūnyāni

translated: the noble truths, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, all liberations, concentrations, attainments, and dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers, fearlessnesses, detailed and thorough knowledges, and unentangled buddhadharmas are empty of the intrinsic nature of the unentangled buddhadharmas.

original: sarvākārajñatā sarvākārajñatāsvabhāvena śūnyā /

analyzed: anyatra saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣya dharma apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpatti tathatāyāḥ
translated: apart from the suchness of the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, the immeasurables, the dhyānas, and the formless concentrations,

original: anyatra śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitābhijñāryasatyadaśabalavaiśāradyapratisaṃvittathatāyā /
analyzed: anyatra śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita abhijñā ārya satya daśa bala vaiśāradya pratisaṃvid tathatāyāḥ
translated: apart from the suchness of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, the higher knowledges, the noble truths, the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, and the analytical knowledges,

original: anyatrāveṇikabuddhadharmatathatāyā /
analyzed: anyatra āveṇika buddha dharma tathatāyāḥ
translated: apart from the suchness of the unique qualities of a buddha,

original: anyatra sarvākārajñatātathatāyāḥ sa dharmo yo vivartate 'nuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ /
analyzed: anyatra sarva ākāra jña tā tathatāyāḥ sa dharmaḥ yaḥ vivartate nuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: Except for the suchness of omniscience, that dharma which turns away from unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: nāyuṣman subhūte /
analyzed: na āyuṣman subhūte
translated: No, Venerable Subhūti.

original: subhūtir āha /🔽tat kiṃ manyase /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha  tat kim manyase
translated: Subhūti said:🔽What do you think, Venerable Śāriputra,

original: āyuṣman śāriputra tathatā vivartate /
analyzed: āyuṣman śāriputra tathatā vivartate
translated: does suchness turn away

original: 'nuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ /
analyzed: nuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: from unsurpassed perfect enlightenment?

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: nāyuṣman subhūte /
analyzed: na āyuṣman subhūte
translated: No, Venerable Subhūti.

original: evaṃ dharmatā dharmadhātur dharmasthititā dharmaniyāmatā bhūtakoṭīḥ /
analyzed: evam dharma tā dharma dhātuḥ dharma sthiti tā dharma niyāma tā bhūta koṭīḥ
translated: In the same way, does the dharma-constituent, the establishment of dharmas, the certification of dharmas, and the very limit of reality turn away from unsurpassed perfect enlightenment?

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: nāyuṣman subhūte /
analyzed: na āyuṣman subhūte
translated: No, Venerable Subhūti.

original: subhūtir āha /🔽tat kiṃ manyase /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha  tat kim manyase
translated: Subhūti said:

original: āyuṣman śāriputrācintyadhātur vivartate 'nuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ /
analyzed: āyuṣman śāriputra acintya dhātuḥ vivartate nuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: What do you think, Venerable Śāriputra, does the inconceivable constituent turn away from unsurpassed perfect enlightenment?

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: nāyuṣman subhūte /
analyzed: na āyuṣman subhūte
translated: No, Venerable Subhūti.

original: subhūtir āha /🔽tat kiṃ manyase /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha  tat kim manyase
translated: Subhūti said:

original: āyuṣman śāriputrānyatra tathatāyāḥ sa dharmo yo vivartate 'nuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ / evaṃ dharmatāyā dharmadhātor dharmasthititāyā dharmaniyāmatāyā
analyzed: āyuṣman śāriputra anyatra tathatāyāḥ sa dharmaḥ yaḥ vivartate nuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ evam dharma tāyāḥ dharma dhātoḥ dharma sthiti tāyāḥ dharma niyāma tāyāḥ
translated: What do you think, Venerable Śāriputra, is that dharma which turns away from unsurpassed perfect enlightenment other than suchness, and in the same way, other than the dharma-constituent, the establishment of dharmas, the certification of dharmas, and the very limit of reality?

original: anyatrācintyadhātoḥ sa dharmo yo vivartate 'nuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ /
analyzed: anyatra acintya dhātoḥ sa dharmaḥ yaḥ vivartate nuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: Apart from the inconceivable element, that dharma which turns away from unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: nāyuṣman subhūte /
analyzed: na āyuṣman subhūte
translated: No, Venerable Subhūti.

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: evaṃ satyataḥ sthititas teṣu dharmeṣv anupalambhamāneṣu /
analyzed: evam satyataḥ sthititaḥ teṣu dharmeṣu an upalambha māneṣu
translated: Thus, when those dharmas are not apprehended as real or existent,

original: katamaḥ sa dharmo yo vivartate 'nuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ /
analyzed: katamaḥ sa dharmaḥ yaḥ vivartate nuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: which dharma turns away from unsurpassed perfect enlightenment?

original: evam ukte āyuṣmān śāriputra āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtim etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Śāriputra said to the Venerable Subhūti:

original: yayā dharmanayajātyā subhūtiḥ sthaviro nirdiśati /
analyzed: yayā dharma naya jātyā subhūtiḥ sthaviraḥ nirdiśati
translated: The elder Subhūti teaches with the kind of lineage of the Dharma method

original: tayā na kaścid bodhisattvo mahāsattvo vivartiṣyate anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ / ya ime trayo bodhisattvayānikāḥ pudgalāḥ tathāgatenākhyātāḥ /
analyzed: tayā na kaścid bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ vivartiṣyate anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ ye ime trayaḥ bodhisattva yānikāḥ pudgalāḥ tathāgatena ākhyātāḥ
translated: that not a single bodhisattva mahāsattva will turn away from unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, among those three kinds of persons who are taught as belonging to the vehicle of the bodhisattvas.

original: eṣāṃ ca trayāṇāṃ bodhisattvayānikānāṃ pudgalānāṃ vyavasthānaṃ na bhaviṣyati / eka eva bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhaviṣyati yad uta bodhisattvayāniko
analyzed: eṣām ca trayāṇām bodhisattva yānikānām pudgalānām vyavasthānam na bhaviṣyati ekaḥ eva bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhaviṣyati yat uta bodhisattva yānikaḥ
translated: And there will be no distinction among those three kinds of persons belonging to the vehicle of the bodhisattvas. There will be only one bodhisattva mahāsattva, namely one who belongs to the vehicle of the bodhisattvas,

original: yathāyuṣmataḥ subhūter nirdeśaḥ /
analyzed: yathā āyuṣmataḥ subhūteḥ nirdeśaḥ
translated: as taught by the Venerable Subhūti.

original: atha khalv āyuṣmān Pūrṇo maitrāyaṇīputra āyuṣmantaṃ śāriputram etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān pūrṇaḥ maitrāyaṇīputraḥ āyuṣmantam śāriputram etat avocat
translated: Then the venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaṇīputra said to the venerable Śāriputra:

original: kiṃ punar āyuṣman śāriputra subhūtiḥ sthavira ekam api bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvam icchati /
analyzed: kim punar āyuṣman śāriputra subhūtiḥ sthaviraḥ ekam api bodhisattvam mahāsattvam icchati
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, does the elder Subhūti accept even one bodhisattva mahāsattva?

original: paripraṣṭavyas tāvat subhūtiḥ sthaviraḥ /
analyzed: paripraṣṭavyaḥ tāvat subhūtiḥ sthaviraḥ
translated: The elder Subhūti should be asked about this.

original: atha khalv āyuṣmān śāriputra āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtim etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra said to the venerable Subhūti:

original: kiṃ punar āyuṣman subhūte ekam api bodhisattvayānikaṃ bodhisattvam icchasi /
analyzed: kim punar āyuṣman subhūte ekam api bodhisattva yānikam bodhisattvam icchasi
translated: Venerable Subhūti, do you accept even one bodhisattva who follows the vehicle of the bodhisattvas?

original: evam ukte āyuṣmān subhūtir āyuṣmantaṃ śāriputram etad avocat / /
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ āyuṣmantam śāriputram etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the venerable Subhūti said to the venerable Śāriputra:

original: kiṃ punar āyuṣmañ chāriputra tathatāyāṃ trīn bodhisattvān icchasi /
analyzed: kim punar āyuṣman śāriputra tathatāyām trīn bodhisattvān icchasi
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, do you accept three bodhisattvas in the tathatā?

original: śrāvakayānikaṃ vā bodhisattvaṃ pratyekabuddhayānikaṃ vā bodhisattvaṃ bodhisattvayānikaṃ vā bodhisattvam icchasi /
analyzed: śrāvaka yānikam vā bodhisattvam pratyekabuddha yānikam vā bodhisattvam bodhisattva yānikam vā bodhisattvam icchasi
translated: Do you accept a bodhisattva who follows the vehicle of the hearers, a bodhisattva who follows the vehicle of the solitary buddhas, or a bodhisattva who follows the vehicle of the bodhisattvas?

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: nāyuṣman subhūte /
analyzed: na āyuṣman subhūte
translated: No, Venerable Subhūti.

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:🔽What do you think, Venerable Śāriputra,

original: tat kiṃ punar āyuṣmañ śāriputra tathatāyāṃ trayo bodhisattvā upalabhyante /
analyzed: tat kim punar āyuṣmam śāriputra tathatāyām trayaḥ bodhisattvāḥ upalabhyante
translated: Then, Venerable Śāriputra, are three kinds of bodhisattvas perceived in suchness?

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said,

original: nāyuṣman subhūte /
analyzed: na āyuṣman subhūte
translated: “No, Venerable Subhūti.”

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said,

original: kiṃ punar āyuṣmañ chāriputra tathatā ekato vā dvābhyāṃ vā tribhir vākārair upalabhyate /
analyzed: kim punar āyuṣman śāriputra tathatā ekataḥ vā dvābhyām vā tribhiḥ vā ākāraiḥ upalabhyate
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, is suchness perceived as one, or as two, or as three modes?”

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said,

original: nāyuṣman subhūte /
analyzed: na āyuṣman subhūte
translated: “No, Venerable Subhūti.”

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said,

original: kiṃ punar āyuṣmañ śāriputra tathatāyām ekaṃ bodhisattvam upalabhate /
analyzed: kim punar āyuṣmam śāriputra tathatāyām ekam bodhisattvam upalabhate
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, is a single bodhisattva perceived in suchness?”

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said,

original: nāyuṣman subhūte /
analyzed: na āyuṣman subhūte
translated: “No, Venerable Subhūti.”

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said,

original: evaṃ satyataḥ sthititas te dharmā anupalabhyamānāḥ kutaḥ punar āyuṣmataḥ śāriputrasyaivaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: evam satyataḥ sthititaḥ te dharmāḥ an upalabhyamānāḥ kutas punar āyuṣmataḥ śāriputrasya evam bhavati
translated: “Thus, Venerable Śāriputra, those dharmas, not being perceived as real or as existing, from where then does this thought of yours come:

original: ayaṃ śrāvakayāniko bodhisattvo 'yaṃ pratyekabuddhayāniko bodhisattvo 'yaṃ buddhayāniko bodhisattva ity /
analyzed: ayam śrāvaka yānikaḥ bodhisattvaḥ yam pratyekabuddha yānikaḥ bodhisattvaḥ yam buddha yānikaḥ bodhisattvaḥ iti
translated: ‘This is a bodhisattva of the Śrāvakayāna, this is a bodhisattva of the Pratyekabuddhayāna, this is a bodhisattva of the Buddha-yāna’?

original: ayaṃ sarvadharmatathatāyāṃ prabhāvyamānāyāṃ yasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya cittan
analyzed: ayam sarva dharma tathatāyām prabhāvyamānāyām yasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya
translated: This bodhisattva, this great being, whose mind, when the suchness of all dharmas is being revealed,

original: nāvalīyate na saṃlīyate na vipratisārī bhavati mānasaṃ nottrasyati na saṃtrasyati
analyzed: na avalīyate na saṃlīyate na vipratisārī bhavati mānasam na uttrasyati na saṃtrasyati
translated: does not shrink back, does not draw back, does not feel revulsion, does not feel his hair standing on end,

original: na saṃtrāsam āpadyate / ayaṃ bodhisattvo mahāsattvo niryāsyaty anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: na saṃtrāsam āpadyate ayam bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ niryāsyati anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: this bodhisattva mahāsattva will go forth to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: tatra khalu bhagavān āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtim āmantrayate sma /
analyzed: tatra khalu bhagavān āyuṣmantam subhūtim āmantrayate sma
translated: There the Lord said to the venerable Subhūti:

original: sādhu sādhu subhūte pratibhāntu te subhūte yathāpīdaṃ buddhānubhāvena /
analyzed: sādhu sādhu subhūte pratibhāntu te subhūte yathā api idam buddha anubhāvena
translated: “Good, good, Subhūti! Let it occur to you, Subhūti, just as it does through the power of the Buddha.

original: evaṃ khalu subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sarvadharmatathatāyāṃ prabhāvyamānāyāṃ
analyzed: evam khalu subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarva dharma tathatāyām prabhāvyamānāyām
translated: Thus, Subhūti, when the suchness of all dharmas is being revealed,

original: yasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya cittan nāvalīyate na saṃlīyate na vipratisārī
analyzed: yasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya cittan na avalīyate na saṃlīyate na vipratisārī
translated: the mind of that bodhisattva mahāsattva does not shrink back, does not draw back, does not feel revulsion,

original: bhavati mānasaṃ nottrasyati na saṃtrasyati na saṃtrāsam āpadyate /
analyzed: bhavati mānasam na uttrasyati na saṃtrasyati na saṃtrāsam āpadyate
translated: does not tremble, does not quake, does not quake violently,

original: niryāsyaty ayaṃ bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: niryāsyati ayam bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ nuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: this bodhisattva mahāsattva will go forth to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: atha khalv āyuṣmāñ śāriputro bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra said to the Lord:

original: katamayā bhagavan bodhyā niryāsyati bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ /
analyzed: katamayā bhagavan bodhyā niryāsyati bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ
translated: By which enlightenment, Blessed One, will the bodhisattva mahāsattva go forth?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: anuttarayā samyaksaṃbodhyā niryāsyaty ayaṃ bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ / iti madhyāni mokṣabhāgīyānīty uktaṃ mokṣabhāgīyam
analyzed: anuttarayā samyaksaṃbodhyā niryāsyati ayam bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ iti madhyāni mokṣa bhāgīyāni iti uktam mokṣa bhāgīyam
translated: This bodhisattva mahāsattva will go forth to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment. Thus the middling factors conducive to liberation have been explained.

original: atha khalv āyuṣmān subhūtir bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the Venerable Subhūti said this to the Blessed One:

original: niryātukāmena bhagavan bodhisattvena mahāsattvenānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau kathaṃ sthātavyam /
analyzed: niryātu kāmena bhagavan bodhisattvena mahāsattvena anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau katham sthātavyam
translated: Blessed One, how should a bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to go forth to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment stand?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: iha subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvenānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhukāmena sattvānām antike samacittatāyāṃ sthātavyaṃ /
analyzed: iha subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhu kāmena sattvānām antike sama citta tāyām sthātavyam
translated: Subhūti, here a bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment should stand in equanimity towards sentient beings.

original: sarvasattvānām antike samacittam utpādayitavyaṃ /
analyzed: sarva sattvānām antike sama cittam utpādayitavyam
translated: He should generate equanimity towards all sentient beings.

original: na viṣamaṃ cittam utpādayitavyaṃ /
analyzed: na viṣamam cittam utpādayitavyam
translated: He should not generate an uneven mind.

original: sarvasattvāḥ samacittenālambitavyāḥ /🔽sarvasattvānām antike mahāmaitry utpādayitavyā /
analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ sama cittena ālambitavyāḥ  sarva sattvānām antike mahāmaitrī utpādayitavyā
translated: All sentient beings should be embraced with an even mind.🔽He should generate great loving kindness towards all sentient beings.

original: sarvasattveṣu mahākaruṇotpādayitavyā /
analyzed: sarva sattveṣu mahā karuṇā utpādayitavyā
translated: He should generate great compassion towards all sentient beings.

original: sarvasattvā maitreṇa cittenālambitavyāḥ /
analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ maitreṇa cittena ālambitavyāḥ
translated: All sentient beings should be contemplated with a mind of loving-kindness.

original: sarvasattvā mahākaruṇācittenālambitavyā /
analyzed: sarva sattvā mahā karuṇā cittena ālambitavyā
translated: All sentient beings should be contemplated with a mind of great compassion.

original: na puruṣacittenālambitavyāḥ sarvasattvānām antike nihatamānatotpādayitavyā /
analyzed: na puruṣa cittena ālambitavyāḥ sarva sattvānām antike nihata māna tā utpādayitavyā
translated: One should not contemplate all sentient beings with a mind of desire. One should generate a mind free from pride towards all sentient beings.

original: sarvasattvāś ca niḥśāṭhyenālambitavyāḥ / iti mṛdūṣmagatam
analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ ca niḥśāṭhyena ālambitavyāḥ iti mṛdu ūṣma gatam
translated: All sentient beings should be contemplated without deceit. This is the weak stage of heat.

original: sarvasattvānām antike hitacittatotpādayitavyā /
analyzed: sarva sattvānām antike hita citta tā utpādayitavyā
translated: One should generate a mind of benefit towards all sentient beings.

original: ahitaṃ cittaṃ notpādayitavyaṃ /
analyzed: ahitam cittam na utpādayitavyam
translated: A mind of harm should not be generated.

original: sarvasattvāś ca hitacittenālambitavyā /
analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ ca hita cittena ālambitavyā
translated: All sentient beings should be contemplated with a mind of benefit.

original: nāhitacittenālambitavyāḥ /
analyzed: na āhita cittena ālambitavyāḥ
translated: They should not be contemplated with a mind of harm.

original: sarvasattvānām antike apratihataṃ cittam utpādayitavyaṃ /
analyzed: sarva sattvānām antike apratihatam cittam utpādayitavyam
translated: A mind free from obstruction should be generated towards all sentient beings.

original: sarvasattvā na pratihatacittenālambitavyāḥ /
analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ na pratihata cittena ālambitavyāḥ
translated: All sentient beings should be contemplated with a mind free from obstruction.

original: sarvasattvānām antike aviheṭhanācittam utpādayitavyaṃ /
analyzed: sarva sattvānām antike a viheṭhanā cittam utpādayitavyam
translated: A mind free from injury should be generated towards all sentient beings.

original: sarvasattvā na viheṭhanācittenālambitavyāḥ / iti madhyam uṣmagatam
analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ na viheṭhanā cittena ālambitavyāḥ iti madhyam uṣma gatam
translated: All sentient beings should be contemplated with a mind free from injury. This is the medium stage of heat.

original: sarvasattvānām antike mātṛcittam utpādayitavyaṃ pitṛcittam utpādayitavyaṃ bhrātṛcittam
analyzed: sarva sattvānām antike mātṛ cittam utpādayitavyam pitṛ cittam utpādayitavyam bhrātṛ cittam
translated: A mind like a mother should be generated towards all sentient beings. A mind like a father should be generated.

original: utpādayitavyaṃ bhaginīcittam utpādayitavyaṃ putracittam utpādayitavyaṃ duhitṛcittam
analyzed: utpādayitavyam bhaginī cittam utpādayitavyam putra cittam utpādayitavyam duhitṛ cittam
translated: One should arouse the thought of a sister, one should arouse the thought of a son, one should arouse the thought of a daughter,

original: utpādayitavyaṃ mitrāmātyajñātisālohitacittam utpādayitavyaṃ sarvasattvāś ca mātṛcittena
analyzed: utpādayitavyam mitra amātya jñāti sālohita cittam utpādayitavyam sarva sattvāḥ ca mātṛ cittena
translated: one should arouse the thought of friends, ministers, relatives, and kinsmen, and one should think of all beings as one's mother,

original: pitṛcittenālambitavyā /
analyzed: pitṛ cittena ālambitavyā
translated: one should think of them as one's father,

original: bhrātṛcittena bhaginīcittenālambitavyāḥ /
analyzed: bhrātṛ cittena bhaginī cittena ālambitavyāḥ
translated: one should think of them as one's brother, one should think of them as one's sister,

original: putracittena duhitṛcittenālambitavyā /
analyzed: putra cittena duhitṛ cittena ālambitavyā
translated: one should think of them as one's son, one should think of them as one's daughter,

original: mitrāmātyajñātisālohitacittenālambitavyāḥ / evaṃ khalu subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvenānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau niryāntukāmena sthātavyam /
analyzed: mitra amātya jñāti sālohita cittena ālambitavyāḥ evam khalu subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau niryāntu kāmena sthātavyam
translated: one should think of them as one's friends, ministers, relatives, and kinsmen. In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening should stand.

original: ity adhimātram uṣmagatam
analyzed: iti adhimātram uṣma gatam
translated: Thus ends the great heat.

original: ātmanā ca prāṇātipātāt prativiratena bhavitavyaṃ pare ca prāṇātipātavairamaṇo samādāpayitavyāḥ /
analyzed: ātmanā ca prāṇa atipātāt prativiratena bhavitavyam pare ca samādāpayitavyāḥ
translated: One should oneself abstain from killing living beings, and one should encourage others to abstain from killing living beings.

original: prāṇātipātavirateś ca varṇavādinā bhavitavyaṃ /
analyzed: prāṇa atipāta virateḥ ca varṇa vādinā bhavitavyam
translated: One should speak in praise of abstaining from killing living beings.

original: ye cānye prāṇātipātāt prativiratā bhavanti /
analyzed: ye ca anye prāṇa atipātāt prativiratāḥ bhavanti
translated: And one should rejoice in those who abstain from killing living beings.

original: teṣāñ ca varṇavādinā bhavitavyaṃ samanujñena / evaṃ bodhisattvena mahāsattvenānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau niryāstukāmena sthātavyam /🔽ātmanā cādattādānāt prativiratena bhavitavyaṃ /
analyzed: teṣām ca varṇa vādinā bhavitavyam samanujñena evam bodhisattvena mahāsattvena anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau niryāstu kāmena sthātavyam  ātmanā ca a datta ādānāt prativiratena bhavitavyam
translated: In the same way, a bodhisattva great being who wishes to set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening should stand,🔽and personally abstain from taking what is not given.

original: pare cādattādānavairamaṇye samādāpayitavyāḥ /
analyzed: pare ca adatta ādāna vairamaṇye samādāpayitavyāḥ
translated: And others should be caused to take up abstaining from taking what is not given.

original: adattādānavirateś ca varṇavādinā bhavitavyaṃ /🔽ye cānye adattādānāt prativiratā bhavanti /
analyzed: adatta ādāna virateḥ ca varṇa vādinā bhavitavyam  ye ca anye a datta ādānāt prativiratāḥ bhavanti
translated: And one should be a speaker of praise of abstaining from taking what is not given.

original: teṣāñ ca varṇavādinā bhavitavyaṃ samanujñena /
analyzed: teṣām ca varṇa vādinā bhavitavyam samanujñena
translated: And one should be a speaker of praise of those others who are abstaining from taking what is not given, and one should applaud them.

original: ātmanā ca kāmamithyācārāt prativiratena bhavitavyaṃ /
analyzed: ātmanā ca kāma mithyā ācārāt prativiratena bhavitavyam
translated: And one should personally abstain from sexual misconduct.

original: pare ca kāmamithyācāraprativiratau samādāpayitavyāḥ /
analyzed: pare ca kāma mithyā ācāra prativiratau samādāpayitavyāḥ
translated: And others should be caused to take up abstaining from sexual misconduct.

original: kāmamithyācāravirateś ca varṇavādinā bhavitavyaṃ /
analyzed: kāma mithyā ācāra virateḥ ca varṇa vādinā bhavitavyam
translated: And one should be a speaker of praise of abstaining from sexual misconduct.

original: ye cānye kāmamithyācārāt prativiratā bhavanti teṣāṃ ca varṇavādinā bhavitavyaṃ samanujñena /
analyzed: ye ca anye kāma mithyā ācārāt prativiratāḥ bhavanti teṣām ca varṇa vādinā bhavitavyam samanujñena
translated: And one should be a speaker of praise of those others who are abstaining from sexual misconduct, and one should applaud them.

original: evam anṛtavacanāt paruṣavacanāt piśunavacanād avadyapralāpād abhidhyāyā vyāpādāt /
analyzed: evam anṛta vacanāt paruṣa vacanāt piśuna vacanāt avadya pralāpāt abhidhyāyāḥ vyāpādāt
translated: In the same way, from false speech, harsh speech, frivolous speech, covetousness, ill will,

original: ātmanā ca mithyādṛṣṭeḥ prativiratena bhavitavyaṃ /
analyzed: ātmanā ca mithyādṛṣṭeḥ prativiratena bhavitavyam
translated: One should oneself abstain from wrong views.

original: pare ca mithyādṛṣṭiviratau samādāpayitavyā /🔽mithyādṛṣṭivirateś ca varṇavādinā bhavitavyaṃ /🔽ye cānye mithyādṛṣṭer viratā bhavanti /
analyzed: pare ca mithyādṛṣṭi viratau samādāpayitavyā  mithyā dṛṣṭi virateḥ ca varṇa vādinā bhavitavyam  ye ca anye mithyādṛṣṭeḥ viratāḥ bhavanti
translated: One should encourage others to abstain from wrong views.🔽One should speak in praise of abstaining from wrong views.

original: teṣāñ ca varṇavādinā bhavitavyaṃ samanujñena /
analyzed: teṣām ca varṇa vādinā bhavitavyam samanujñena
translated: And one should rejoice in others who abstain from wrong views.

original: ātmanā ca prathamaṃ dhyānaṃ samāpattavyaṃ /
analyzed: ātmanā ca prathamam dhyānam samāpattavyam
translated: One should oneself enter the first absorption.

original: pare ca prathame dhyāne samādāpayitavyāḥ /
analyzed: pare ca prathame dhyāne samādāpayitavyāḥ
translated: One should encourage others to enter the first absorption.

original: prathamadhyānasamāpatteś ca varṇavādinā bhavitavyaṃ /🔽ye cānye prathamaṃ dhyānaṃ samāpadyante /
analyzed: prathama dhyāna samāpatteḥ ca varṇa vādinā bhavitavyam  ye ca anye prathamam dhyānam samāpadyante
translated: One should speak in praise of entering the first absorption.

original: teṣāñ ca varṇavādinā bhavitavyaṃ samanujñena /
analyzed: teṣām ca varṇa vādinā bhavitavyam samanujñena
translated: And one should rejoice in others who enter the first absorption.

original: evam ātmanā ca dvitīyaṃ dhyānaṃ samāpattavyaṃ /
analyzed: evam ātmanā ca dvitīyam dhyānam samāpattavyam
translated: In the same way, one should oneself enter the second absorption.

original: evaṃ tṛtīyaṃ dhyānaṃ samāpattavyaṃ /
analyzed: evam tṛtīyam dhyānam samāpattavyam
translated: In the same way, one should enter the third absorption.

original: ātmanā ca caturthaṃ dhyānaṃ samāpattavyaṃ /
analyzed: ātmanā ca caturtham dhyānam samāpattavyam
translated: One should oneself enter the fourth absorption.

original: pare ca caturthe dhyāne samādāpayitavyāś caturthadhyānasamāpatteś ca varṇavādinā bhavitavyaṃ /
analyzed: pare ca caturthe dhyāne samādāpayitavyāḥ caturtha dhyāna samāpatteḥ ca varṇa vādinā bhavitavyam
translated: One should encourage others to enter the fourth absorption. One should speak in praise of entering the fourth absorption.

original: ye cānye caturthadhyānaṃ samāpadyante /
analyzed: ye ca anye caturtha dhyānam samāpadyante
translated: And those who enter the fourth meditation,

original: teṣāñ ca varṇavādinā bhavitavyaṃ samanujñena /
analyzed: teṣām ca varṇa vādinā bhavitavyam samanujñena
translated: one should be their praiser and approver.

original: ātmanā ca maitrī bhāvayitavyā /
analyzed: ātmanā ca maitrī bhāvayitavyā
translated: And one should oneself cultivate loving-kindness.

original: pare ca maitrībhāvanāyāṃ samādāpayitavyā /🔽maitrībhāvanāyāś ca varṇavādinā bhavitavyaṃ /
analyzed: pare ca maitrī bhāvanāyām samādāpayitavyā  maitrī bhāvanāyāḥ ca varṇa vādinā bhavitavyam
translated: And one should encourage others to cultivate loving-kindness.🔽And one should be a speaker of praise for the cultivation of loving-kindness.

original: ye cānye maitrīvihāriṇas teṣām api varṇavādinā bhavitavyaṃ samanujñena /
analyzed: ye ca anye maitrī vihāriṇaḥ teṣām api varṇa vādinā bhavitavyam samanujñena
translated: And one should be a praiser and approver of others who dwell in loving-kindness.

original: evaṃ karuṇāyāṃ muditāyāṃ ca kartavyam /
analyzed: evam karuṇāyām muditāyām ca kartavyam
translated: The same should be done for compassion and sympathetic joy.

original: ātmanā copekṣāvihāriṇā bhavitavyaṃ /
analyzed: ātmanā ca upekṣā vihāriṇā bhavitavyam
translated: And one should oneself dwell in equanimity.

original: pare copekṣāvihāre samādāpayitavyā /🔽upekṣāvihārasya ca varṇavādinā bhavitavyaṃ /🔽ye cānye upekṣāvihāriṇas /
analyzed: pare ca upekṣāvihāre samādāpayitavyā  upekṣāvihārasya ca varṇa vādinā bhavitavyam  ye ca anye upekṣā vihāriṇaḥ
translated: And one should encourage others to dwell in equanimity.🔽And one should be a speaker of praise for the dwelling in equanimity.

original: teṣām api varṇavādinā bhavitavyaṃ samanujñena /🔽ātmanā cākāśānantyāyatanāsamāpattiḥ samāpattavyā /
analyzed: teṣām api varṇa vādinā bhavitavyam samanujñena  ātmanā ca ākāśa ānantya āyatana a samāpattiḥ samāpattavyā
translated: And one should be a praiser and approver of others who dwell in equanimity.🔽And one should oneself enter the attainment of the sphere of infinite space.

original: pare cākāśānantyāyatanasamāpattau samādāpayitavyāḥ /
analyzed: pare ca ākāśa anantya āyatana samāpattau samādāpayitavyāḥ
translated: And one should encourage others in the attainment of the sphere of infinite space.

original: ākāśānantyāyatanasamāpatteś ca varṇavādinā bhavitavyaṃ /
analyzed: ākāśa ānantya āyatana samāpatteḥ ca varṇa vādinā bhavitavyam
translated: And one should be a speaker of praise for the attainment of the sphere of infinite space.

original: ye cānye ākāśānantyāyatanasamāpattiṃ /
analyzed: ye ca anye ākāśa ānantya āyatana samāpattim
translated: And those who enter the sphere of infinite space,🔽and those who enter the sphere of infinite consciousness,🔽and those who enter the sphere of nothingness,🔽and those who enter the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception,

original: samāpadyante /
analyzed: samāpadyante
translated: and those who enter the concentration of the cessation of perception and feeling,

original: teṣāṃ ca varṇavādinā bhavitavyaṃ samanujñena /
analyzed: teṣām ca varṇa vādinā bhavitavyam samanujñena
translated: and those who enter the concentration of the sphere of infinite space,🔽and those who enter the concentration of the sphere of infinite consciousness,🔽and those who enter the concentration of the sphere of nothingness,🔽and those who enter the concentration of the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception,

original: evaṃ vijñānānantyāyatanasamāpattir ākiṃcānyāyatanasamāpattiḥ /
analyzed: evam vijñāna anantya āyatana samāpattiḥ ākiṃcānya āyatana samāpattiḥ
translated: and those who enter the concentration of the cessation of perception and feeling,🔽and those who enter the concentration of the sphere of infinite space,🔽and those who enter the concentration of the sphere of infinite consciousness,🔽and those who enter the concentration of the sphere of nothingness,

original: ātmanā ca naivasaṃjñānāsaṃjñāyatanasamāpattiḥ samāpattavyā /
analyzed: ātmanā ca na eva saṃjñā na asaṃjñā āyatana samāpattiḥ samāpattavyā
